Long Description: The project aimed to explore and realise energy saving and energy efficiency potentials on a communal (mainly buildings) level by building up energy agencies and collaterally advising these. Within the frame of the project, one energy agency was institutionally established in Odessa, a range of services was developed and staff  qualified. Experiences were consolidated into best practices and disseminated in Ukraine. Furthermore, a range of consulting services were created for, inter alia, the management of communal energy, which reveal energy saving options and related operating cost reductions in a community. Thereby, incentives were created for other cities and communities to adopt successful approaches. On the German side the Berlin Energy Agency was involved, and, on the Ukrainian side, regional administrations (Oblast governments), city administrations and energy providers became partners.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The Christina Specialist Hospital is specialised in orthopaedic treatments. Most often patients come from accident cases and with life-threatening bone problems. In Nigeria, there are no adequate provisions for the handicapped. After adequate medical treatment in Christina Specialist Hospital, patients can continue with their work or studies and take care of themselves and their families. In order to carry out the treatments several orthopaedic instruments are needed. Some of the orthopaedic instruments are broken and need to be replaced. The project financed the necessary new equipment to guarantee further medical treatments.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Conditions for an improved food security concerning the dimensions accessto and physiological utilisation of food from by the dryness to internally displaced, repatriates and vulnerablen inhabitants in Kismayo are created.

Long Description: Tanzania's electricity system requires rapid addition of generation capacity to cope with grid extension and industrialization efforts. Its location in the East African Rift System implies a significant potential for tapping into geothermal energy to diversify the electricity mix and balance power generation geographically. Thus, the  Institute for Geosciences and Natural Resources (BGR) supports Tanzanian lead institutions to improve the framework conditions and implementation capacities for the sustainable use of geothermal energy in the country. The programme aims to strategically integrate geothermal energy into the national energy planning, and to build related capacities in the responsible institutions. Besides this strategic and policy support, BGR assists the national lead agency Tanzania Geothermal Development Company Ltd. in geothermal exploration at the Northern Tanzanian Prospect Mt. Meru and to build a cost-effective project pipeline.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

IBMETRO carries out 6 (six) bilateral comparisons with EPSAs, for control their drinking water meters. 3. IBMETRO offers Proficiency Testing for 10 (ten) waste water parameters.

Long Description: This global project is jointly implemented by GIZ (=Deutschen Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit), GRID-Arendal, IUCN (=International  for Conservation of Nature) und UN Environment  (UNEP = United Nations Environment Programme) and is dedicated to the conservation and sustainable use of marine biodiversity. The project identifies and disseminates successful on-the-ground solutions that concern a wide range of marine topics. In addition, it contributes to capacity development by the means of training courses and different exchange formats. The project also collates results of exchanges and advises on how to integrate approaches into national and regional strategies as well as into planning processes. In this way, the project supports partner countries to contribute to implementing one of the key areas of activity of the Convention on Biodiversity (CBD).
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: German positions for Shaping and Implementing international REDD Initiatives are integrated in International REDD Programmes, the Germany, Norway, UK (GNU)-Initiatives and in bilateral Development cooperation programmes.

Long Description: The project aims to increase the effectiveness of forest-related climate finance and to increase capacity in partner countries to reduce emissions in the forest and land-use sector. For this purpose, three lines of action are pursued. First, the strategic positioning of the issue shall be improved internationally and progress in mobilizing private climate finance shall be achieved. Secondly, the coordination of relevant actors for the effective implementation of forest-relevant climate financing and for the achievement of the goals of the New York Declaration on Forests shall be supported. Thirdly, the implementation of climate finance shall become more effective through selected measures in partner countries. Improved coordination of key donors of climate finance and knowledge transfer from project activities in international initiatives shall strengthen ambitious climate protection through forests.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project's task is to advise  Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development in matters of fisheries and aquaculture development policy. Fishers and fish farmers in partner countries adopt sustainable practices and enhace their foodsecurity.

The school building and the classrooms that will then be available, will reduce the size of the school classes and aim at equal treatment among male and female pupils.

Long Description: The project will restore and protect forest and mangrove ecosystems in the coastal county of Kwale. It will address major threats from recent large scale economic developments and an increasing demand for wood-fuel energy. This will be done through public-private-people partnerships. Coastal forests constitute important carbon sinks, biodiversity hotspots and are crucial for community livelihoods. The project will work with communities, authorities and stakeholders on ecosystem restoration, sustainable management of resources and the integration of ecosystem values in policies and plans. The project will also address new drivers for ecosystem destruction from the private sector, by promoting energy and water efficiency and by strengthening and applying environmental and social safeguards at the national and the local level. Thus, the Kenyan government will be supported to implement Aichi target 15 and the National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan, objectives 1, 3, 6 and 10.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

The schools are located in Makoko, a large slum by the Lagos lagoon. The inhabitants live in very poor social conditions, and there is a huge lack of social services, including schools, which are poorly equipped, and a lot of their pupils lack basic school materials.

Through trainings in the planned seminar center, the local population should be offered the possibility of vocational training as an orthopedic technician or physiotherapist.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Hesse

Long Description: The NGO Springs of Life Zimbabwe resides in Epworth, a very poor part of Harare which is known for its prostitution in the so called booster area. The NGO takes care of children, the elderly and especially of the prostitutes. Approximately 350 prostitutes are part of the rehabilitation programm for an alternative lifestyle. This garment project will establish a sewing centre and train about 100 prostitutes. Good contacts in the community will guarantee orders for school and other uniforms. A shop has been donated by a company in Epworth.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Unprecedented growth in African cities is resulting in traffic congestion and uncontrolled sprawl, leading to rising GHG emissions, local air pollution, urban poverty, and climate vulnerabilities. The project aims to avoid this trajectory and deliver GHG reductions from the transport sector by promoting and improving public and non-motorized transport. The project will focus on Kenya, Rwanda, Tanzania, and Uganda, all of which mention transport as part of their NDCs. The project will implement shift strategies that introduce low carbon mobility options as well as avoid strategies that reduce the need for trips. The project will support the implementation of high quality mass rapid transit systems in Nairobi, Kigali, and Kampala and the expansion of the existing BRT system in Dar es Salaam. The project seeks to complement rapid transit through better access for pedestrians and cyclists and regulations to facilitate the intensification of land uses along rapid transit corridors.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Creation of a laboratory in an existing infirmary in the El Capotillo slum. This will prevent patients from transferring to hospitals in other parts of Santo Domingo to verify diagnosis.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Humanitarian Preparedness in the departments Chalatenango, San Vicente and San Salvador in El Salvador
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Support concerning the official twinning between the City of Moers and La Trinidad/Nicaragua. Main Focus - Education and Health.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Follow-up Financing for a Montessori preschool in León
Donor Agency: City State of Hamburg

Long Description: School program for reduction of gender-based discrimination in El Alto and La Paz provinces in Bolivia
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Since 1938 the old folks home San Jose in Cochabamba is taking care of old people who are in difficult physicall conditions or in special need. The home is run by nuns who are taking the responsibility of looking after these people because Bolivia has no state welfare system for old homeless people whose family members cannot financially support them. Currently there are 140 old people in the home.  The new mattresses enable the home to maintain a minimum hygienic standard for sleeping. This gesture helps to improve the life in the old folks home.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project seeks to support the implementation of Colombia's Low Carbon Development Strategy (since 2012) towards the achievement of a less carbon-intensive economy. After diagnosis, prospective and planning phases and setting up a goal (iNDC), there is a need to start effective execution of actions in different sectors and regions, to demonstrate the feasibility of the low-carbon approach. The project will carry out demonstration initiatives on GHG emissions reductions covering industry, agriculture, energy and housing sectors in particular regions. Yet, the project also recognizes the need to work on policy development, which has a huge potential to facilitate the transition to a low carbon economy, as well on building capacities in the public and private sectors at the local level, through different means, including communication.The project seeks to contribute to the deviation of trends in emissions and to prepare the country for the implementation of the Paris commitments.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Basic health care, nutrition and psychosocial care for internally displaced persons and Venezuelan refugees in Antioquia and Córdoba, Colombia
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Analysis of origins of organized criminality as threat for the peace process in Columbia, the daily life in Venezuela and in close to the border communities in Ecuador
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Forecast-based Financing - Closing the Gap between Disaster Preparedness and Emergency Assistance (Peru and Ecuador)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The goal is the sustainable improvement of the very poor medical situation of the Tibetan nomadic population. Improving the medical situation in the remote nomadic district of Lhundrup in the districts of Pundo, Nanang and Thango, east of Lhasa in Tibet. Medical training for poorly trained local medical assistants / local health workers.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Saxony

Long Description: There are a lot of people with mental problems on the isle of Flores, Indonesia. Because of a lack of knowledge, families and neighbours react to these peoples often violent behaviour by chaining them into stocks outside. As a possible solution, the NGO wants to build shelters for the mentally ill people to allow them a more humane life, so that they can sleep in their own beds, have shelter from rain etc.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: TransJakarta, the first and longest Bus rapid transit (BRT) system in . The Institute for Transportation and Development Policy (ITDP) has been asked to help physically integrate it with the new , optimize its services, improve NMT access, and help the city reform new zoning and parking regulations in the city. A goal is to upgrade TransJakarta to Gold Standard BRT and change zoning and parking regulations to be consistent with Gold Standard transit oriented development.ITDP has also been asked by the Mayor of Medan to develop a conceptual plan for the first full BRT outside Jakarta.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Improving hygiene standards for school children in Ban Kouey and Ban Ang Noy in Vientiane by building new toilet blocks and a sewage filter system.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Hindering the revitalisation of tensions and conflicts by supporting local authorities in the reconstruction of parts of Marawi City
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In the context of the tri-national Heart of Borneo (HoB) Initiative the project will develop and implement a green economy model for the Kapuas Hulu district in Indonesia and Sarawak in Malaysia. Demonstrating the business case for a green economy model in the transboundary region has great potential for replication in other districts. New networks of stakeholder on policy, community and business level will be established leading to new synergies and cooperation which will increase the economic dynamics in the area without disturbing nature conservation goals. The long term establishment of a drinking water protection area can be seen as pilot model for other regions globally. The project contributes to the HoB Action Plan as endorsed by the Governments of Malaysia and Indonesia - Transboundary management, sustainable resource management, eco-tourism and capacity-building. All results and innovative approaches will be reflected in the HoB Initiative and multiplied on a broad level.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Dialogue platform Geneva - predictions based financing mechanisms for humanitarian adaptation to climate change
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In the framework of this small-scale project the Embassy supports the local NGO Disabled Child Foundation (DCF) in expanding their computer and printing learning centre for visually impaired persons in Dhaka, Bangladesh. Visually impaired persons generally suffer from a lack of opportunities on Bangladeshi labour market. Through computer and printing trainings, DCF aims to improve their chances on the local labour market.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to help survivors of acid attacks in Bangladesh who generally are stigmatised in the country. In the framework of this small-scale project, the Embassy supports the local NGO Acid Survivors Foundation (ASF) in order to build up a learning centre for the survivors of acid attacks in Dhaka. ASF is planning to offer different trainings for the survivors of acid attacks, such as computer, handy craft or confectionary trainings. The main goal of the project is to provide a good training for the survivors of acid attacks, which improves their chances on the labour market to which most of the survivors do not have access. Trainings are open to survivors country-wide.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The NGO  Association for Welfare Guria (Ozurgeti, Georgia) was founded in 1998 and has 750 members, 220 of them children. Since 2006 it has been operating a day-care center with a staff of 15 carers for 40 children and adolescents with handicaps. They are shuttled between their homes and the day-care center with an overaged minibus which is neither roadworthy nor operationally reliable anymore. It is planned to acquire a replacement with built-in wheelchair lift which will be driven by a chauffeur. This will make the organization and its beneficiaries independent from insufficient public and private transport.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project will help to provide a phaco surgery unit to an eye care centre in New Delhi, India. Phacoemulsification is a cheap, safe and simple surgery method to treat cataracts. The hardened, milky lens is extracted and replaced by an artificial lens. After provision of the surgery unit, up to 300 patients will be treated in a year. The eye clinic is run by the NGO for years and only underprivileged people are treated for free or minimum costs. The surgery unit will finally help to treat cataracts, which lead to blindness if untreated and which actually have been effectively treated all over the world for the past decades.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Renovation of the roof of the association Samal building's roof. The association is a center for disabled children, mostly girls, and a point to turn to for help. association is situated in Pawlowdar. The building is 44 years old and need urgently a renovation in order to maintain the association's current business.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Support for the establishment of an office for the Maldivian NGO Maldivian Democracy Network in Colombo in an acute crisis situation
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to strengthen and restore the resilience and livelihoods of the populations affected by the floods and landslides in the Sagaing region and in China State. Through a participatory, multi-stakeholder approach, which focuses strongly on the integration of local civil society structures, measures are implemented in three of the four funding areas of transitional aid.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Securing the primary health care in the sector of Maternal, Newborn and Child Health for refugees and local population in Peshawar

Long Description: Strengthened referral systems and preventive networks for counselling women with gender-specific experiences of violence in refugee shelters and host communities in the project regions (Duhok, Erbil and Sulaimania/Germian provinces) through qualification, strengthening and networking of local state and civil society structures.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The aim of the project is to support the return process in the provinces of Diyala and Kirkuk and to improve the resilience of the population by rebuilding local structures and strengthening communities. This is achieved through access to varied nutrition, safe drinking water supply and wastewater disposal. The livelihoods and income opportunities, especially for women, have been improved (cash for work), and local state and civil society structures have been strengthened and improved.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Improving precarious living conditions, in particular child protection, and strengthening the resilience of 5,000 children and young people in four refugee camps and five communities plus inclusion measures. In the course of the project, 25 psychologists trained in Iraq will be trained as trauma therapists and 5 therapists already practicing in Dohuk and Erbil. (Jiyan Foundation) In Erbil, 3,200 children receive informal school and language lessons to prepare them for integration into the school system.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: A network of five rehabilitation centers in North Iraq (Erbil, Halabja, Kirkuk, Mosul, Sulaymaniyah) will offer gender-specific and age-adapted medical and psychological assistance as well as legal counselling to 2000 survivors of human rights violations, including an estimated 1000 women and 600 children. Services will include medical diagnostics and rehabilitation services, including assessments, free medication, as well as general medical, physiotherapeutic and orthopedic treatment. It will also includepsychological trauma diagnostics, individual and group psychotherapy, psychiatric treatment and consultation as well as psychoeducation. In addition it will also offer pediatric services, child and youth psychotherapy, as well as family counseling and education regarding effects of trauma and children's needs and rights and legal counseling regarding remedies and reparation.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: 1) Raise awareness about the implications of climate change on security and stability in the Middle East. 2) Investigate the geopolitical implications of climate change and water insecurity in Jordan, Israel and Palestine. 3) Formulate policy recommendations to advance climate security in the region through means of water diplomacy.

Long Description: The development of noncommunicable disease health services in Gaza, which have so far been predominantly reactive and treat diseases late, aims to further develop a model that focuses more on prevention, early detection and, above all, cheaper treatment because it takes place earlier and is carried out locally. The project thus strengthens local capacities, which are of national relevance in view of the supply situation in the area of noncommunicable diseases in Gaza and will serve as a model.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The overall objective of the project is to strengthen the resilience of needy Bedouins and pastoral communities in the West Bank and Palestine. To achieve this goal, in a first step (Goal 1) the shepherds improved their livestock-based livelihoods. In a second step, shepherds have improved the protection of natural resources (Goal 2).
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Supporting the school in implementing secondary classes by procurement of furniture for classrooms and science labs as well as creating a safe and happy learning environment for mentally strained and stressed children in the Gaza strip.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Strengthening of women's human rights associations in the Gaza strip, Workshops for victims of gender based violence, Local awareness campaigns, Advocacy for changes in legislation
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project supports subnational governments in Mexico (Baja California, Yucatán, and Jalisco), India (Chhattisgarh, Telangana), Brazil (Pernambuco) and South Africa (KwaZulu-Natal) to contribute to NDCs by overcoming MRV capacity gaps. The regions are at different stages in the MRV process, with variable levels of knowledge on GHG inventories, completeness of existing inventories and implementation of systems for the MRV of mitigation actions. The project will thus provide regions with tailored technical assistance to establish sustainable and robust MRV systems. The project will also identify further mitigation opportunities and support their implementation. In-country multi-governance policy and strategy dialogues between national governments, sub-national governments and selected local governments will be organized to promote vertical integration of climate action. The Under2 Coalition network will be leveraged to disseminate lessons learned between states and regions globally.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project aims to support selected large cities in Indonesia, the Philippines and Viet Nam to establish strong local climate action plans through concrete targets, enhanced multi-stakeholder engagement and integrated strategies. The project will be implemented in close cooperation with Seoul Metropolitan Government (SMG), which in 2015 has published the Promise of Seoul, an unprecedented mitigation plan. City Promises (city's low emission development strategies) will be developed in three model cities and their implementation will be outlined and initiated. Throughout the project period, each local government will design locally appropriate targets and action plans on the basis of their condition framework and priorities. The respective national government will also benefit from the project as it will enhance the implementation of their Nationally Determined Contribution (NDCs) through collective actions taken by cities.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: SOVA (Center for Information and Analysis) is designed to collect data and improve communication among Special Monitoring Mission (SMM) staff. The Geneva International Centre for Humanitarian Demining (GICHD) has agreed to correct all reported errors within one year of the handover date.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The purpose of the project is to develop the capacity of the national environmental authorities and local farmers in the Amazonian regions of Peru and Colombia with the aim of reducing greenhouse gas emissions and advancing efforts to adapt to the impacts of climate change. To achieve this, it is supporting the development and implementation of sustainable land use measures that help to preserve carbon sinks such as forests in selected pilot regions (Yurimaguas in Peru and Caquetá in Colombia).
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: To generate an interactive cultural map of water bodies, linking their socio-spatial dynamics contextually at varying scales, including at regional and individual sites. Various components and themes pertinent to waterbodies will be creatively displayed in the final interactive cultural map. The intent is to interpret and represent Chennai and its environs in the context of its changing waterscape in both its natural and reconstructed forms. Chennai has all the ingredients to support green urbanity, and a combination of these resources in just the right proportion to sustain urban life, but the collective waterscape imagination of the city appears to be fragmented and under-explored. An interactive map could potentially generate new ways to reconnect people with stories of what the city's waterscapes were, how rich they still are in spite of negligence, and what a thoughtful and sensitive approach to safeguard them may turn out to be.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Collaborative project - Sensor-based security and emergency system for underground transport (SenSE4Metro) - Sub-project - Sensor network for an integrated security system - Technological research and development, Knowledge Transfer

Long Description: The agricultural Haa-Valley Cooperative in Western Bhutan manufactures dairy products (butter, yoghurt, cheese) by hand, which is very time-consuming and the cooperative only has old and inefficient machinery for the production. The young farmers would like to sell their products in the hotels in the capital Thimphu and the city of Paro (where the only international airport is) to create a sustainable livelihood for themselves and their families. With the support from the embassy they can purchase modern machinery for the dairy production, which will help them to have a regular production, meet quality standards and guarantee a safe and constant delivery of the products. The cooperative will be able to close new supply agreements and create a least 10 new jobs. This will lead to an improved livelihood for the farmers in the Haa district and help to prevent rural migration in Bhutan.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

The project is based on the results of the project young expertise I. In December 2017 a 10-day international workshop (international network- and exchange meeting) took place in Solingen. The objectives of the seminar series were raising of awareness for sustainable waste management and the associated climate mitigation features in Nigeria, as well as the facilitation of networking between Nigerian and German actors in the field.

Long Description: The seminar series serves to raise awareness for renewable energy and relevant issues, and connect Nigerian and German actors in the field. It entails three seminars in Lagos, which take place similarly in Abuja. The topics of the seminars are energy efficiency, renewable energy financing, and photovoltaic/solar. Speakers and participants from German and Nigerian institutions take part in the seminars. Reasons for the organisation of the seminar series are the enormous lack of energy and the great rising need thereof in the future in Nigeria.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

The implementation of the Lima Action Plan (2016-2025) is of high importance.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: To expand cultural collaboration with Africa and to intensify cultural exchange is one of the objectives determined in the coalition agreement of the new German government. It intends to achieve this goal by advancing a critical engagement with German colonialism with and in the concered countries and by supporting the development of cultural infrastructure in Africa. In ligth of this, the Ethnographic Museum in Hamburg is hosting a first gathering of international experts to discuss this agenda. These conversations are response to ongoing public debates concerning the engagement with colonial heritage and to the demands for the temporary or permanent return of cultural property.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Start-up Night! Africa on 20 March 2018 offered a networking platform to well-established German companies and start-ups from Africa and Germany. African start-ups had three minutes each in which to pitch their business model to well-established German companies and to network with German start-ups. German start-ups also had the opportunity to pitch and thus to build up contacts with African stakeholders. A poster session enabled the established companies and multipliers to present themselves. The Start-up Night! Africa was part of the Pro! Africa Initiative of the  Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy. The initiative covered the travel and accommodation costs of the participating start-ups from Africa. These expenses are categorised as ODA payments.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy

A hospital was selected for the implementation of a pilot project with the aim of demonstrating the advantages of energy efficiency technologies. Long Description: Bonn and Ramallah are currently working on the development of the project Garden of Senses. With the involvement of as many different people as possible, a barrier-free meeting place is to be created that, through its design with artistic objects, enables intensive seeing, hearing, touch, smell and taste. The aim of the joint project is to create an awareness of the equal participation of all people in the political, cultural and economic life and to promote mutual understanding. The project idea as well as the first drafts of the Sinnesgarten were further developed within the framework of the dialogue platform Connective Cities under the title Including Cities - Urban and Social Development for All in May 2018 in Bonn.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Together with representatives from Bonn, representatives of the city administration of Lautoka / Fiji and the City of Bonn are exploring possibilities for cooperation on the topic of civil protection, early warning and climate adaptation. For this purpose, a corresponding professional program consisting of talks and visits or excursions will be developed. The Resilient Cities conference in Bonn will be used as a discussion and cooperation platform. The aim is to explore possibilities for cooperation and, if necessary, to develop follow-up activities or joint project ideas.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: The 2015 UNFCCC (United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change) Conference in Paris set the world on course for a new global climate policy. But how do we take it from here? Global Solutions tracks the Road from Paris and reports on people, projects and activities in developing and industrialising countries that are helping to achieve the ambitious international goals to limit global warming, adapt to climate change and conserve biodiversity. Its reporting focuses on projects that are financed by the International Climate Initiative. DVD recordings of the documentaries can be used as teaching material by schools and other educational facilities. The documentaries, background papers, picture galleries and audio-visual slide-shows will be readily available from an online multi-media platform in multiple languages.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: In addition to the city of Bonn, five other municipalities from Europe, Argentina and Japan are participating in the project. As part of the project, Bonn's know-how and experience in implementing the SDGs will be brought into international exchanges, as well as an in-depth analysis of local activities.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Partnership between Freie Universität Berlin an the Al-Quds .  scientists from Germany and Palestina are trained together.

Long Description: The Freedom Online Coalition (FOC), founded in The Hague in 2011, is an informal coalition of 30 states from five continents that is working for human rights online. The background of the coalition is the fact that authoritarian governments have responded to the emergence of new freedoms on the Internet with increasing state control and surveillance. The FOC is trying to counter this with its efforts to protect the right to freedom of opinion, privacy and freedom of assembly. The annual conference, chaired by Germany, was held in Berlin in 2019. Approximately 350 participants from 90 different countries took part. Among the 90 countries, 35 were ODA-eligible countries (ODA = Official Development Assistance).
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Framework programme for the Berlin Energy Transition Dialogue 2018 (BETD) in Berlin. Due to the framework programme new thematic focuses of the conference have been picked up, existing dialogues on political and economical basis have been strengthened and new cooperations were initiated. The project consist of sightseeing programmes, business-to-government dialogues and professional workshops. The German Energy Agency (dena) made the concept and coordinated the framework programme as well as it has been organised essential parts of the event. The public relations and the thematic and content related follow up was done by dena. Only the proportion of the share for the developing countries is recorded here.

Long Description: In the water and wastewater sector, Serbia has a considerable deficit in terms of future EU accession, especially in the area of capacity building at the municipal level. A training course based on this will introduce further water companies in Serbia to the topic of applying for EU funding.

Long Description: Organizing a three-day youth conference in Port Elizabeth, South Africa, where student representatives from more than 25 high schools, principals and teachers, as well as representatives from the South African police and the Ministry of Education and Social Affairs jointly discuss security-related issues and initiate awareness-raising campaigns. Through activation workshops, pupils at participating high schools present self-initiative ways to make schools and their living environments safer. Nomination of particularly active and exemplary young people (Local Heroes of Safety), who form the citywide Local Hero Network and are invited as representatives of their schools to the Youth Conference. Establishment of sustainable and long-term education programs to make the living and learning environment of children and young people safer and thereby increase the educational and equal opportunities for children and adolescents in South Africa.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Hesse

Long Description: Organisation of a five-day human rights film festival in Guatemala City including debates, a four-day documentary film workshop on human rights issues and a mobile festival in several rural areas of Guatemala in order to create a platform for discussion and exchange about relevant national and international political, social, economical and cultural issues for all levels of society and generations and to promote further dialogue between film makers, civil society and the audience. The project could therefore contribute to strengthening civil society and national reconciliation and raise awareness for human rights.

Long Description: As part of strengthening Viet Nam's opening to market economy in the transition process from planned economy to market economy, the Vietnamese-German- (VGU) offers a variety of joint Bachelor and Master programs in cooperation with partner universities from the State of Hessen (TU Darmstadt, Goethe  Frankfurt, Frankfurt  of Applied Sciences). By its 11 courses of studies, the VGU offers in cooperation with its respective partner universities courses in engineering as well as in economics. The graduates receive both a BA and a MA degree certificate from the VGU and the partner university. The measure aims to secure the training of 18 high-performing students from poorer families by a sur place grant of ? 1,000 each, thereby contributing to the development of free-market structures. Preference is given to female students.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Hesse

Long Description: The aim of the project is to preserve the biodiversity of alpine meadows in the Kara-Kujur Valley of the Tienschan Mountains of Kyrgyzstan. In order to achieve this objective, the following measures are envisaged - 1. Investigating the natural capital of high alpine meadows in the Naryn region for its capacity and develop management plans and self-commitments to maintain and control them. 2. Building environmental education structures in the form of an environmental education center, publishing a practice book, conducting a study tour and an Internet presence. 3. Analysis of market structures to prepare investment in the processing and marketing of organic yak products from the Naryn region.

Long Description: Preparation, organization and conducting of the event REN21 Renewables Academy 2018 (19-21 November 2018 in Berlin). The Renewables Academy will focus on the use of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector and in the transport sector in 2018. The results of the Renewables Academy will be communicated to the international public through an article in the quarterly published REN21 newsletters. The results also contribute to the development of REN21's three-year strategy and action plan.

Long Description: The Climate Breakfast is a development policy education programme that combines the themes of climate change and nutrition and shows with reference to everyday life that anybody can be a climate protector. The participants (school children as well as groups with little awareness such as employees in Berlin administration offices) are made aware of the consequences of climate change and encouraged to identify individual and joint options for action that protect the climate. In 2018, the influence of climate change on migration movements will be highlighted. Goal 1 - Raising the awareness of children, adolescents and adults of the global context of nutrition and climate change. Objective 2 - Raising awareness among children, young people and adults of the global context of climate change and migratory movements. Objective 3 - To promote the participants' capacity to make an active contribution to climate protection.
Donor Agency: City State of Berlin

Bremen has already campaigned for the SDGs in the past, for example with the conference on the implementation of the SDGs at the municipal level in 2016. The WeltWeitWissen conference was used to approach this question in order to jointly address the question of education to solve current global challenges.

Long Description: Agenda 2030 - The Chance for Berlin is a long-term development education programme in Berlin. In addition, non-governmental organisations are supported in improving their development education work. They are to implement the ideas of Agenda 2030 as an organisation as well.

Long Description: The SODI project acting with rage wants to understand refugees as responsible actors who, together with the SODI project staff, develop and implement measures and activities of exchange along the needs of their communities and to communicate global connections and tension between fleeing and migration. In this context, we would also like to further develop our methods with the involvement of the refugees and make them available to other educational institutions. Together, the actors with rage and the refugees identify problems and topics that are important to them and then share them creatively with the public or develop educational concepts that address the causes of flight and the realities of the lives of refugees and implement them in Berlin schools. Goals - 1. empowerment, 2. knowledge transfer, 3. exchange, 4. qualification, 5. change of perspective, 6. articulation of positionings, 7. possibilities for action.

Long Description: Research, teaching, training and further education as well as consulting and health care in the fields of infectious and tropical medicine. The BNITM is Germany's largest institution for research, treatment and training in the field of tropical diseases and new emerging infections. As a member of the Leibniz-Association and as a research institute of national importance, the Institute is jointly funded by the  Government, the Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg and the other federal states. Research topics include clinical studies, epidemiology and disease control as well as the biology of pathogens, their reservoirs and vectors. The current scientific focus is on malaria, haemorrhagic fever viruses, immunology, epidemiology and clinical studies of tropical infections as well as on the mechanisms of the viral transmission by mosquitoes. For the handling of highly pathogenic viruses and infected insects, the Institute has laboratories of the highest biosafety level (BSL-4) and a BSL-3 insectary. The Institute's health care services include specific laboratory diagnostics of tropical diseases and other rare infections, close cooperation with the German  Defence Forces concerning medical care for military deployments in the tropics as well as the consultation of the scientific community, politics and the general public, which essentially contribute to the Institute's national reputation. The Institute has been appointed by the  Ministry of Health as the National Reference Center (NRC) for the detection of all tropical pathogens as well as by the WHO (= World Health Organisation) as Collaborating Center for arboviruses and haemorrhagic fever viruses. In collaboration with the Ghanaian Health Ministry and the  of Kumasi the Institute has been operating a modern research and training center in the West-African rain forest for over ten years, which is also available to external research groups. The teaching activities comprise a three months full-time course on all aspects of tropical medicine for physicians as well as a training program for PhD students at the Institute and a number of activities on continuing education in topics related to travel medicine and international health. Numerous scientists of the Institute are involved in student teaching as appointed professors of the  and the  Hospital of Hamburg.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Health

Long Description: Tanzania's electricity system requires rapid addition of generation capacity to cope with grid extension and industrialization efforts. Its location in the East African Rift System implies a significant potential for tapping into geothermal energy to diversify the electricity mix and balance power generation geographically. Thus, BGR (=  Institute for Geosciences and Natural Resources) supports Tanzanian lead institutions to improve the framework conditions and implementation capacities for the sustainable use of geothermal energy in the country. The programme aims to strategically integrate geothermal energy into the national energy planning, and to build related capacities in the responsible institutions. Besides this strategic and policy support, BGR assists the national lead agency Tanzania Geothermal Development Company Ltd. in geothermal exploration at the Northern Tanzanian Prospect Mt. Meru and to build a cost-effective project pipeline.

Long Description: Financial contribution shall secure an environment- and resource-friendly, as well as hygienically safe disposal of solid waste in the governorate Ramallah/ Al Bireh (AM).
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: After the climate conference in Paris, Germany has defined 2050 pathways in line with the Climate Action Plan 2050 (greenhouse gas neutrality). Target of 95% leads to new challenges. Fossil fuels must also be replaced in sectors where no technological alternatives are available. In aviation and maritime transport or in the chemical industry, fuels cannot easily be replaced. Since biofuels are not available to a sufficient extent, electricity-based fuels produced on the basis of hydrogen, to which carbon is enriched (methanisation or Fischer-Tropsch process) are an option. Large quantities of renewable electricity are needed to recover hydrogen and in chemical processes. The technologies are not yet marketable, but represent currently the most promising option in selected sectors. Although these (expensive) options are considered in the current decarbonisation scenarios only after the year 2030/35, it is necessary to start testing and preparing the technology paths today.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: This global project is jointly implemented by GIZ, GRID-Arendal, IUCN und UN Environment and is dedicated to the conservation and sustainable use of marine biodiversity (GIZ = Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH, GRID-Arendal = Global Resource Information Database / Arendal, IUCN = International  for Conservation of Nature, UN Environment = United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP)). The project identifies and disseminates successful on-the-ground solutions that concern a wide range of marine topics. In addition, it contributes to capacity development by the means of training courses and different exchange formats. The project also collates results of exchanges and advises on how to integrate approaches into national and regional strategies as well as into planning processes. In this way, the project supports partner countries to contribute to implementing one of the key areas of activity of the Convention on Biodiversity (CBD).
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Production of the talk show 'Stay Fair' as media support for the transformation process in the Arab countries and dialogue platform for the European-Arab exchange with the current developments in the Arab world. Topics of great social relevance will be selected, which are discussed controversially in Arab countries, but which are not or only little served by established media channels. The broadcast in discussion format is produced in Berlin and in countries of the Arab world. The format is intended to appeal to decision-makers on political opinion-forming in the Arab world.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The support of the project should be achieved to provide additional opportunities for freedom of expression in Arab countries and promote open discussion. Selected topics of great social relevance, which are discussed controversially in Arab countries, but which are not or only little served by established media channels. The broadcast in discussion format is produced in Berlin and in countries of the Arab world. The format is intended to appeal to decision-makers on political opinion-forming in the Arab world.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: German positions for Shaping and Implementing international REDD Initiatives are integrated in International REDD Programmes, the Germany, Norway, UK (GNU)-Initiatives and in bilateral Development cooperation programmes.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The project aims to increase the effectiveness of forest-related climate finance and to increase capacity in partner countries to reduce emissions in the forest and land-use sector. For this purpose, three lines of action are pursued. First, the strategic positioning of the issue shall be improved internationally and progress in mobilizing private climate finance shall be achieved. Secondly, the coordination of relevant actors for the effective implementation of forest-relevant climate financing and for the achievement of the goals of the New York Declaration on Forests shall be supported. Thirdly, the implementation of climate finance shall become more effective through selected measures in partner countries. Improved coordination of key donors of climate finance and knowledge transfer from project activities in international initiatives shall strengthen ambitious climate protection through forests.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project's task is to advise  Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development in matters of fisheries and aquaculture development policy. Fishers and fish farmers in partner countries adopt sustainable practices and enhace their foodsecurity.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The project aims to increase the practical use of representative actions in China and Brazil in the context of consumer protection. For this purpose, on the one hand, advice will be given on the legal structure and practical aspects, and on the other, the legal awareness of consumers and knowledge of this instrument will be raised. Furthermore, consumer associations will be trained through targeted capacity building in dealing with suitable consumer complaints by way of representative action. In October 2019, all issues have been discussed on a final conference in Berlin with the two partners.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Justice and Consumer Protection

Long Description: Financing of the Intelligent Transportation System in Huainan, Anhui
Donor Agency: Kreditanstalt für Wiederaufbau

Long Description: The Agrotechnical and Technology College (ATTC) in Harar, in eastern Ethiopia, will be equipped with modern teaching materials and machines, so that its students may receive a practical education. In 2019, the library will be expanded and new books for the subjects agriculture, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering as well as IT and reference works will be purchased. In 2020 the workshops will be equipped with new machines and computers.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Bavaria

Long Description: The project will restore and protect forest and mangrove ecosystems in the coastal county of Kwale. It will address major threats from recent large scale economic developments and an increasing demand for wood-fuel energy. This will be done through public-private-people partnerships. Coastal forests constitute important carbon sinks, biodiversity hotspots and are crucial for community livelihoods. The project will work with communities, authorities and stakeholders on ecosystem restoration, sustainable management of resources and the integration of ecosystem values in policies and plans. The project will also address new drivers for ecosystem destruction from the private sector, by promoting energy and water efficiency and by strengthening and applying environmental and social safeguards at the national and the local level. Thus, the Kenyan government will be supported to implement Aichi target 15 and the National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan, objectives 1, 3, 6 and 10.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: For some years now, the parish 'Zum Guten Hirten' has been supporting the Laboratory College in Bashanet. In the meantime, four intakes have successfully completed the two-year training. In the future, however, a three-year laboratory training with the degree 'Diploma' will be offered. This measure, which requires considerable investment, is necessary because the state no longer supports the two-year training course with the certificate. The Laboratory College aims to remedy or alleviate the great shortage of laboratory workers for hospitals and medical wards in the Mbulu diocese and beyond. This can improve and ensure medical care for the almost entirely poor population in this rural area.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Baden-Württemberg

Long Description: Construction of a residential building for the local employees of the orthopedic workshop in Mukono, Uganda, which is located in the immediate vicinity.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Hesse

Long Description: Creation of a lab in an existing infirmary in the 'El Capotillo' slum. This will prevent patients from transferring to hospitals in other parts of Santo Domingo to verify diagnosis.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Humanitarian Preparedness in the departments Chalatenango, San Vicente and San Salvador in El Salvador
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The economic situation of the coffee farmers on the Finca Neuva Candelaria is characterized by a rapid decline in the harvest, due to the rust fungus, which has affected approximately 30% to 50% of the coffee plants on the finca. This fungal disease has afflicted all of  and South America and is a disaster for coffee farmers, since coffee earnings are their main source of income. The coffee farmers live in very simple conditions and are not in a position to finance the renewal of their coffee plant stock or the purchase of urgently needed fertilizers. The support from Padre Pedro Guatemala-Hilfe e. V. helps them to build a stable economic livelihood again. Extensive new coffee plantations are planned for 2019-2021. In order to gradually replace the existing coffee trees with plants that are resistant to rust fungi, it is planned to replant 40,000 coffee trees annually, i.e. around 400 trees per coffee grower.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Baden-Württemberg

Long Description: Grant from the city of Solingen for development policy projects of the Jinotega Development Association in Solingen and the educational institution La Cuculmeca in Jinotega (Nicaragua)
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Follow-up financing for a Montessori pre-school in León
Donor Agency: City State of Hamburg

Long Description: Nicaragua is one of the poorest countries in Latin America and musical education plays a subordinate role in such a country. Musical life usually takes place on the streets in the form of small folklore groups or for a few in upper social circles. Música en los Barrios started here, and began teaching recorder lessons in Managua's mostly poorer neighborhoods. Over the years, Música en los Barrios became more popular and developed. Música en los Barrios now has over 400 children and is now represented in nine quarters of Managua. This year, a grant is requested for a well-suited video camera that has become necessary for the work of Música en los Barrios. With the help of the camera, lessons and samples are to be recorded in order to further improve methodology and didactics and to document the lessons.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Baden-Württemberg

Long Description: School program for reduction of gender-based discrimination in El Alto and La Paz provinces in Bolivia
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project seeks to support the implementation of Colombia's Low Carbon Development Strategy (since 2012) towards the achievement of a less carbon-intensive economy. After diagnosis, prospective and planning phases and setting up a goal (iNDC = intended nationally determined contributions), there is a need to start effective execution of actions in different sectors and regions, to demonstrate the feasibility of the low-carbon approach. The project will carry out demonstration initiatives on greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions reductions covering industry, agriculture, energy and housing sectors in particular regions. Yet, the project also recognizes the need to work on policy development, which has a huge potential to facilitate the transition to a low carbon economy, as well on building capacities in the public and private sectors at the local level, through different means, including communication. The project seeks to contribute to the deviation of trends in emissions and to prepare the country for the implementation of the Paris commitments.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Basic health care, nutrition and psychosocial care for internally displaced persons and Venezuelan refugees in Antioquia and Córdoba, Colombia
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Implementation of the Colombian Peace Agreement and reconciliation in the 10 departments Antioquia, Atlantico, Bolivar, Caqueta, Cesar, Guajira, Huila, Magdalena, Santander, Sucre.

Long Description: Forecast-based Financing - Closing the Gap between Disaster Preparedness and Emergency Assistance (Peru and Ecuador)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: TransJakarta, the first and longest Bus rapid transit (BRT) system in . The Institute for Transportation and Development Policy (ITDP) has been asked to help physically integrate it with the new , optimize its services, improve NMT (non-motorized transport) access, and help the city reform new zoning and parking regulations in the city. A goal is to upgrade TransJakarta to Gold Standard BRT and change zoning and parking regulations to be consistent with Gold Standard transit oriented development.ITDP has also been asked by the Mayor of Medan to develop a conceptual plan for the first full BRT outside Jakarta.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Hindering the revitalisation of tensions and conflicts by supporting local authorities in the reconstruction of parts of Marawi City
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In the context of the tri-national Heart of Borneo (HoB) Initiative the project will develop and implement a green economy model for the Kapuas Hulu district in Indonesia and Sarawak in Malaysia. Demonstrating the business case for a green economy model in the transboundary region has great potential for replication in other districts. New networks of stakeholder on policy, community and business level will be established leading to new synergies and cooperation which will increase the economic dynamics in the area without disturbing nature conservation goals. The long term establishment of a drinking water protection area can be seen as pilot model for other regions globally. The project contributes to the HoB Action Plan as endorsed by the Governments of Malaysia and Indonesia - Transboundary management, sustainable resource management, eco-tourism and capacity-building. All results and innovative approaches will be reflected in the HoB Initiative and multiplied on a broad level.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: In the framework of the small-scale program the Embassy is supporting the local NGO 'Prime Development Trust' by building up and equipping two schools in remote Thakurgaon and Bogra, Bangladesh. Since 2012, PDT has been implementing similar projects with the support of the German 'Domino Foundation'. In the whole country, PDT has thus enabled children whose families could not afford to send their children to go to school to do so. The goal of the project is to equip two more schools in order to provide good school education to more than 615 pupils -regardless of their family or religious background- from 2020 on. PDT is hoping that many of their pupils will be able to attend university afterwards. In order to prevent corruptive structures, PDT is offering special trainings for teachers. Computer trainings aim to make classes more modern. Girls and women (e.g. guards) are given sewing trainings, which represents an additional income possibility for them.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In the framework of this small-scale program, the Embassy is funding a project of the local NGO ' Power in Social Action' (YPSA) aiming to expand their computer training centre for visually impaired persons in Chittagong, Bangladesh's second biggest city. YPSA is planning to provide professional trainings for more than 100 visually impaired persons annually from 2020 on. At the end of these trainings, the students will be able to work with computer programs such as Excel, Word, Power Point etc. Thus, they will have better chances on the labour market. YPSA is also planning to support the participants to look for a job. More generally speaking, the goal of the project is to raise awareness and understanding for visually impaired people within the Bangladeshi society.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Bangladesh is far from providing school education for all children and vocational trainings for all youths, namely in slum areas. The project consisting in the construction and equipment of education centers in Dhaka, Borguna and Jamalpur started at the beginning of 2018 and will run until the end of 2022. Trainings in the Dhaka center are about to start. Due to high demand, GBSKS would like to expand the centers in order to provide more trainings and classes. The aim is to better educate children and youths to allow a better professional future.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: With the help of the Embassy the dental unit of the Anchal Comprehensive Health Centre is going to be fully equipped. The objective of the project is to provide dental care to the underprivileged population of Delhi that is in need of such services. The dental unit is expecting to treat 50 - 80 patients, who have to pay a symbolic amount of 30 INR, per day.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The main objectives of the TARA homes are education, empowerment and health care for the Children. All the children visit schools in Delhi and are supported with their homework and while studying. Due to the limited number of children in every home, every child can be supported individually. Learning the Englih language is crucial with regard to the future prospects of the children. Regular health checks and a balanced nutrition are provided to every child. The support will finance the needed carpentry work, electrical equipment and fixed assets to improve the living conditions of the children in the TARA homes. It will also help to furnish the new Outreach Centre.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Olshas Suleimenov is a rehabilitation center for orphans and disabled children in the city of Semey in East Kazakhstan. The institution was founded 23 years ago and is currently offering shelter for 32 people who have a point to turn to after their time in the orphanage. The planned rehabilitation center will help among disabled children to rebuild their muscles and with that center an important pillar in the rehabilitation process could be created. This is why the embassy wants to support this sustainable project.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to strengthen and restore the resilience and livelihoods of the populations affected by the floods and landslides in the Sagaing region and in China State. Through a participatory, multi-stakeholder approach, which focuses strongly on the integration of local civil society structures, measures are implemented in three of the four funding areas of transitional aid.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The St. Michael High School, Sacred Heart Girls High School and St. Gabriel Primary School in Quetta, which are all headed by the Catholic Board of Education, will be equipped with new computers. The computers available before the project started were outdated and partly broken and no longer repairable. By equipping it with modern devices, IT lessons can again take place at an adequate level.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Promoting primary education for underprivileged children in Sukkur (Sindh).
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Strengthened referral systems and preventive networks for counselling women with gender-specific experiences of violence in refugee shelters and host communities in the project regions (Duhok, Erbil and Sulaimania/Germian provinces) through qualification, strengthening and networking of local state and civil society structures.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The aim of the project is to support the return process in the provinces of Diyala and Kirkuk and to improve the resilience of the population by rebuilding local structures and strengthening communities. This is achieved through access to varied nutrition, safe drinking water supply and wastewater disposal. The livelihoods and income opportunities, especially for women, have been improved (cash for work), and local state and civil society structures have been strengthened and improved.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: A network of five rehabilitation centers in North Iraq (Erbil, Halabja, Kirkuk, Mosul, Sulaymaniyah) will offer gender-specific and age-adapted medical and psychological assistance as well as legal counseling to 2000 survivors of human rights violations, including an estimated 1000 women and 600 children. Services will include medical diagnostics and rehabilitation services, including assessments, free medication, as well as general medical, physiotherapeutic and orthopedic treatment. It will also includepsychological trauma diagnostics, individual and group psychotherapy, psychiatric treatment and consultation as well as psychoeducation. In addition it will also offer pediatric services, child and youth psychotherapy, as well as family counseling and education regarding effects of trauma and children's needs and rights and legal counseling regarding remedies and reparation.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Contribution to an improved resilience of refugees and host municipalities in the district Baalbek, governorate Baalbek-Hermel (Lebanon) by strengthening the Lebanese health system.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Basic health care and making NFI (non food items) and WASH (water, sanitation and hygiene)available to conflict-affected internally displaced persons and residents in the Idlib and Aleppo regions
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Winter Relief for Internally Displaced Persons in Idlib and Aleppo, Syria
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Ensuring basic needs of vulnerable groups through food and hygiene distribution, winter assistance and psychosocial activities, Aleppo
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Humanitarian assistance to communities affected by the civil war and internally displaced persons in the provinces of Aleppo and Idlib in Syria
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The overall objective of the project is to strengthen the resilience of needy Bedouins and pastoral communities in the West Bank and Palestine. To achieve this goal, in a first step (Goal 1) the shepherds improved their livestock-based livelihoods. In a second step, shepherds have improved the protection of natural resources (Goal 2).
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Strengthening of psychosocial support and emergency health care in Gaza and Westbank
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Psycho-social services for children in Gaza and Westbank
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The development of noncommunicable disease health services in Gaza, which have so far been predominantly reactive and treat diseases late, aims to further develop a model that focuses more on prevention, early detection and, above all, cheaper treatment because it takes place earlier and is carried out locally. The project thus strengthens local capacities, which are of national relevance in view of the supply situation in the area of noncommunicable diseases in Gaza and will serve as a model.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The project 'Barenboim-Said Music Center Ramallah - Filasteen  Musicians Orchestra (FYMO)' serves the objective to support young talented musicians of the Palestine Territories in their musical development and to open up a professional perspective for them. Moreover, it is intended to sustainably raise the quality of young musicians in the Palestine Territories by means of workshops, concerts and donations of musical instruments.  musicians from the region will be sustainably and systematically promoted with a long-term goal to increase the number of Palestinians being admitted to the Barenboim-Said Academy in Berlin.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Capacity building for the security forces in regard of human rights and international agreements which Palestine signed. Raising awareness among citizens for the importance of the right of assembly as democratic means of forming of opinion. Strengthening the right of free expression in media about the right to peaceful assembly
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Improved communication between human rights defenders and youth peer groups and decision makers. Raising awareness for human rights violations in Palestine, especially in cases of young people and women.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) and food security in the governorates of Taiz and Ibb
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project supports subnational governments in Mexico (Baja California, Yucatán, and Jalisco), India (Chhattisgarh, Telangana), Brazil (Pernambuco) and South Africa (KwaZulu-Natal) to contribute to NDCs (nationally determined contributions) by overcoming mesurement, reporting and verification (MRV) capacity gaps. The regions are at different stages in the MRV process, with variable levels of knowledge on GHG inventories, completeness of existing inventories and implementation of systems for the MRV of mitigation actions. The project will thus provide regions with tailored technical assistance to establish sustainable and robust MRV systems. The project will also identify further mitigation opportunities and support their implementation. In-country multi-governance policy and strategy dialogues between national governments, sub-national governments and selected local governments will be organized to promote vertical integration of climate action. The Under2 Coalition network will be leveraged to disseminate lessons learned between states and regions globally.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project aims to support selected large cities in Indonesia, the Philippines and Viet Nam to establish strong local climate action plans through concrete targets, enhanced multi-stakeholder engagement and integrated strategies. The project will be implemented in close cooperation with Seoul Metropolitan Government (SMG), which in 2015 has published the 'Promise of Seoul', an unprecedented mitigation plan. 'City Promises' (city's low emission development strategies) will be developed in three model cities and their implementation will be outlined and initiated. Throughout the project period, each local government will design locally appropriate targets and action plans on the basis of their condition framework and priorities. The respective national government will also benefit from the project as it will enhance the implementation of their 'Nationally Determined Contribution' (NDCs) through collective actions taken by cities.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Community Stabilization Initiatives in Northern Niger (Agadez and Kawar area)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Combat illicit small arms, light weapons and ammunition trafficking in Latin America and the Caribbean through activities i.a. in the private security sector and on SDG 16. Project locations are Costa Rica, El Salvador, Colombia, Guatemala, Peru, Jamaica, Dominican Republic and Trinidad and Tobago. The share for Trinidad and Tobago is not included as it is not ODA eligible.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The evaluation of the research lab AidData, settled at the college of William and Mary, in co-operation with DEval, shall show how the German development cooperation is noticed from a partner perspective.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Advisory services for the de-facto administration in Tiraspol of an harmonization with the EU and the European market.

Long Description: Secondment of civil experts to International Peace and Election Observation Mission through conclusion of work or secondment contracts by the Centre for International Peace Operations (ZIF)

Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: International student mobility and the Bologna process (Bologna macht mobil) - Higher education, scholarships for students from the developing country
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

The implementation of the 'Lima Action Plan (2016-2025)' is of high importance.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The  Government's coalition agreement set the goal of expanding cultural cooperation with Africa and strengthening cultural exchange. It is to be achieved, in particular, by a reappraisal of German colonialism with and in the countries concerned and by developing local cultural infrastructure. Against this background, a workshop will be held at the MARKK Museum in Hamburg in 2019 and the next collaboration of international experts will take place in 2020, during which this agenda will be discussed. The talks are also to be understood as a reaction to public debates about the colonial heritage and to the demands for the temporary or permanent restitution of cultural assets.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The 2015 United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) Conference in Paris set the world on course for a new global climate policy. But how do we take it from here? 'Global Solutions' tracks the 'Road from Paris' and reports on people, projects and activities in developing and industrialising countries that are helping to achieve the ambitious international goals to limit global warming, adapt to climate change and conserve biodiversity. Its reporting focuses on projects that are financed by the International Climate Initiative. DVD recordings of the documentaries can be used as teaching material by schools and other educational facilities. The documentaries, background papers, picture galleries and audio-visual slide-shows will be readily available from an online multi-media platform in multiple languages.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Participation in the OECD project 'A territorial approach to the SDGs' (OECD = Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development, SDGs = Sustainable Development Goals). In addition to the city of Bonn, five other municipalities from Europe, Argentina and Japan are participating in the project. As part of the project, the know-how and experience of the city of Bonn in implementing the SDGs will be brought into international exchange and an in-depth analysis of its own activities will be carried out on site. In 2019, the annual OECD conference was held in Bonn.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Framework programme for the 'Berlin Energy Transition Dialogue 2019' (BETD) in Berlin. Due to the framework programme new thematic focuses of the conference have been picked up, existing dialogues on political and economical basis have been strengthened and new cooperations were initiated. The project consist of sightseeing programmes, business-to-government dialogues and professional workshops. The German Energy Agency (dena) made the concept and coordinated the framework programme as well as it has been organised essential parts of the event. The public relations and the thematic and content related follow up was done by dena. Only the proportion of the share for the developing countries is recorded here.

Long Description: The Ruta de Amistad are 22 large open-air sculptures in Mexico City in the style of Modern Art, created in 1968 by renowned artists on the occasion of the Cold War Olympic Games. The concept for the Ruta de Amistad comes from the renowned German-Mexican artist Mathias Göritz. The goal is the preservation of historically and artistically valuable cultural objects, which explicitly aim at international understanding. The names of the sculptures and the club they receive are the Route of Friendship.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office
