Long Description: As part of strengthening Viet Nam's opening to market economy in the transition process from planned economy to market economy, the Vietnamese-German  (VGU) offers a variety of joint Bachelor and Master programs in cooperation with partner universities from the State of Hessen (TU Darmstadt, Goethe  Frankfurt, Frankfurt  of Applied Sciences). By its 11 courses of studies, the VGU offers in cooperation with its respective partner universities courses in engineering as well as in economics. The graduates receive both a BA and a MA degree certificate from the VGU and the partner university. The measure aims to secure the training of 18 high-performing students from poorer families by a sur place grant of ? 1,000 each, thereby contributing to the development of free-market structures. Preference is given to female students.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Hesse

Long Description: The aim of the project is to preserve the biodiversity of alpine meadows in the Kara-Kujur Valley of the Tienschan Mountains of Kyrgyzstan. In order to achieve this objective, the following measures are envisaged - 1. Investigating the natural capital of high alpine meadows in the Naryn region for its capacity and develop management plans and self-commitments to maintain and control them. 2. Building environmental education structures in the form of an environmental education center, publishing a practice book, conducting a study tour and an Internet presence. 3. Analysis of market structures to prepare investment in the processing and marketing of organic yak products from the Naryn region.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Voluntary contribution for the IRENA Innovation and Technology center (IITC) which represents the German branch of the international organisation focuses on research in the area of renewables in this case for the project Global Energy Transformation (GET) Report 2019. The IITC in Bonn wants to develop scientific scenarios for promoting renewable energies throughout the world, with a special focus on developing and emerging countries. Long Description: The Free State of Saxony offers Georgius-Agricola-Scholarships for foreign students at universities in Saxony to support the scientific and economic collaboration. Student services of Leipzig is responsible for the process of administration of these scholarships. In 2019, Leipzig  of Applied Sciences (HTWK Leipzig) was able to support three exchange students of our Ukrainian partner university National Technical  of Ukraine, Kyiv Polytechnic Institut, with these scholarships. Each student received in total 2.250 Euro (450 Euro/month) for the period 1 October 2019 until 29 February 2020. The aim of the Georgius-Agricola-Scholarships is to strengthen the bilateral cooperation between HTWK Leipzig and the partner institution in Ukraine by supporting exchange students for a study semester (non-degree) in Leipzig.

Long Description: Climate protection is one of the central themes of the city and project partnerships of the city of Bonn. To raise awareness of this even more in public, the City of Bonn is now bringing the Climate Tram on the rails together with the 'City services Bus und Tram', 'Engagement Global gGmbH - Service for Development Initiatives', the Bonn Climate Ambassador Foundation and the cartoonist 'Özi' mobile advertising media for climate protection (www.engagement-global.de/pressemitteilung/klimaschutz- comes-in-fahrt.html). The Tram provides information about the partnerships of the city of Bonn and in particular about the climate protection activities in this context. The typical landscapes or prominent sights of twin towns of Chengdu (China), Cape Coast (Ghana), Bukhara (Uzbekistan), La Paz (Bolivia), Minsk (Belarus) and Ulan Bator (Mongolia) are illustrated there.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: The KENAKO Africa Festival takes place from July 4-14, 2019 at Alexanderplatz in Berlin. All events are free of charge and open to all. The festival consists of four major elements, each of which represents a different event format in order to involve the largest and broadest possible audience. Global learning - in the big tent there will be panel discussions, lectures, etc., which are intended to bring about a transfer of knowledge / cultural programme - in addition to music, we will be staging various formats such as info talks and interviews with speakers to give visitors an understanding of our content / Exhibition of bridge-builders - during one weekend, various associations and organisations with a link to Africa present their projects / African market place - place for exchange and discussion, with many interactive games and learning activities for the visitors. We would like to give the participants new insights into African topics and show their global relevance and own commitment.
Donor Agency: City State of Berlin

Long Description: In Bremen 'Made in Africa' is rarely seen on the shelves of supermarkets. Many of the owners of Afro shops and restaurants have to have their products delivered from Holland or France. This is how an initiative came about to solve these problems - The 'KAYA-KAYO' wholesale market project. The aim of this project is to import the food products to Germany and to offer them for sale in supermarkets and restaurants. Through the 'Fish and Fine' fair, this initiative aims to organize contact with African manufacturers and future customers. This is how the food products are presented at the fair and also the ways in which these products have to go before they reach the store are displayed.
Donor Agency: City State of Bremen

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. The inclusive resource center in Petrikivka was opened in 2018. 60 children with special needs (mostly visual, speech and articulation disorders) attend this center. But the center hasn't had special equipment to organize effective therapy, correction and training for children with such disorders. This project allows to buy some special medical, sports and game equipment to improve the therapy process and learning conditions, as well as to increase the number of children attending the center up to 150.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. The city of Popasna is located near the contact line. The Community center Popasna is one of the few organizations that, despite the difficult situation, continue to engage in children's development and education, in the organization of leisure and children's activities. But the Community center has not had a specially equipped room. The project allowed to buy furniture, sports and play equipment and to equip the children's playroom.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Aim is to create an easily accessible and secure civil society / culture event space in Alexandria, which is appropriate and suitable to further cultural exchange and participation, to enable hosting events stimulating the cultural scene as well as to offer trainings in specific cultural areas. A team of young artists will receive culture management mentoring and the opportunity to directly apply knowledge an developed competences in the context of creating and managing this event and function room.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Support in elicitation phase to build up a contact point and exchange spot for people interested in German culture and language in Tripoli. A cooperation agreement shall be signed with a partner institution, which can offer facilities. Part of the elicitation phase is developing a concept for the spot, which comprises frame and safety conditions in adjustment to the place of location, logistics and media base stock. The project aims at opening up a civil society space for discussion and exchange of views in Libya and in a first attempt towards renewed cooperativeness with regard to culture putting down a mark for normalization/pacification.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Aim of the project is conveying application and impact of rules of social behaviour to young people from a socially deprived area of Casablanca throughout a joint big band project and several trainer modules, which shall establish/ improve leadership competences. By means of a joint workproject in a large group of young people, which contains on the onehand preparing a repertoire of 16 pop and rock songs for two concerts in a big-band-setting and on the otherhand qualifing about 40 participants in four trainermodules to be capable of fulfilling leadership and trainer functions, social behaviour and organizational skills of the participants will be improved. Opportunities of social participation will be demonstrated by using the instrument of music education.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Support civil society participation throughout financial, technical and logistic assistance for the implementation of participatory creative urban design and development initiatives in Tunis as well as providing for additional and need-based trainings for participants (e.g. sustainable financing, sponsoring)

Long Description: It is a new-developed project, the aim is to strengthen the funding of young entrepreneurs in the economic region Kumasi and to promote innovative business models. The project contributes to the promotion of economic situation, innovation and employment in Ghana.

Long Description: The aim is to solve the waste disposal problem in the city of Manjakandriana to ensure cleanliness, environmental protection and pandemic prevention. The profit from the sale of the mother earth transformed from the garbage will finance the follow-up costs of the waste incineration plant. Recycling the compost from the mother earth will also increase the yield of the farmers
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Improving the socio-economic conditions of agropastoral and pastoral budgets in the face of socio-economic crises in selected areas of the Gao and Mèneka regions.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Humanitarian assistance of the Community of Sant'Egidio for the victims of Cyclone Idai in Beira and the surrounding area through the distribution of relief supplies and food

Long Description: reorganisation waste management in Corinto

Long Description: In 2019, the city of Solingen decided that part of the prize money from the difu competition 'Climate active municipality 2018' should be donated to the twin city Jinotega in Nicaragua. The entire sum of 12,500 Euro was invested in the procurement, construction and installation of eco-friendly stoves and biogas plants as well as in the accompanying training of young people in the proper handling and maintenance of the plants.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Module objective - The national system of Quality Infrastructure is strengthened for the demand of services in the area of energy efficiency. Core problem - Many of the voluntary and mandatory energy efficiency standards cannot be tested in the country because the relevant testing services are not available. Due to the insufficient testing of the quality of products with reference to established standards it is impossible to test and label whether products imported or produced in Ecuador comply with national standards. Thus, products of higher quality, which are more efficient but may be more expensive to purchase, are unable to compete against cheap products. Target groups - The target group are consumers of energy, especially private households, and users of quality infrastructure services in the area of energy efficiency, especially small and medium-sized enterprises. National manufacturers of electrical household appliances also benefit from the services, as they can make use of improved services for conformity assessment in the field of energy efficiency. The national institutions of the quality infrastructure, in particular the National Metrology Institute INEN, calibration and testing laboratories, the accreditation body SAE and conformity assessment bodies serve as intermediaries. Methodological approach (including instruments) - The methodological approach consists of the project coordination in Braunschweig and the assignment of an intermittent short-term expert with international expertise in the field of quality infrastructure for energy efficiency. Additional short-term experts will be contracted for special topics. If the technical expertise allows it, experts from the region are given preference to implement workshops and trainings in order to promote skills in the region. Key outputs - The project works in four outputs - 1) Conformity assessment, 2) metrology (focussing on luxmeters, temperature, humidity), 3) cooperation within the system, and 4) sensibilization of consumers and political stakeholders.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Reinforcement of staff of the German Embassy in Caracas in order to support project work.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: 1. Aims of cooperation - By implementing the Lima Action Plan for UNESCO's Man and the Biosphere (MAB), Programme and its World Network of Biosphere Reserves (2016-2025), the State Office of Environment of the  State of Brandenburg (Germany) and the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Conservation of the Republic of the  of Myanmar in accordance with their responsibilities for the Biosphere Reserves intend to support each other, in a) conserving and further developing biodiversity, b) restoring and enhancing ecosystem services, c) fostering the sustainable use of natural resources, d) facilitating biodiversity and sustainability science, e) education for sustainable development and capacity building, f) supporting mitigation and adaptation to climate change and other aspects of global environmental change and g) promoting sustainable tourism. 2. Forms of cooperation can be - Exchange of experience, transfer of knowledge and mutual information exchange on issues regarding the topics mentioned under section 1, - Personnel exchange and mutual visits to qualify staff and to transfer knowledge of the biosphere reserve administrations, the rangers and representatives of important stakeholders and NGOs (= Non Governmental Organisations) in the regions in the sense of education for sustainable development, - Initiation of research projects on issues of interest regarding the topics mentioned under section 1 in cooperation with national and international organizations and programs, universities, research institutes and scientists, - Joint development of projects and raising of resources from public and private funds to solve the challenges set out in section 1, - Joint activities on topics of mutual interest to the subjects mentioned under section 1 3. Financial arrangements - The realization of activities should be subject to the availability of funds. Within the framework of the budget available on each side, both sides may come to the understanding to financially support activities in the partner areas. For the cooperation with the Indawgyi-lake Biosphere Reserve in Myanmar, the Brandenburg State Office of Environment receives federal funding. The working hours of the Brandenburg state officials who contribute to the project are the own contribution of the funding. In 2019 there were three working visits in this cooperation (2 from Myanmar in Germany, 1 from Germany in Myanmar), which were supervised by Brandenburg state officials of the administrations on about 57 working days and the content of which was developed.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Brandenburg

Long Description: Promoting tourism in Bethlehem region
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: The project aims to improve the economic resilience and social cohesion of the population of East Jerusalem, especially for vulnerable young adults.

Long Description: The projects shall contribute to public awareness raising for the current discrimination of LGBTQI people and the promotion of tolerance and acceptance and enable a better protection through the law courts and adequate jurisdiction (LGBTQI = Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transsexual/Transgender, Queer, Intersexual).
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in Eastern Ukraine. This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass and the insufficient state support for people in need. Myronivskyi in the Donetsk region is located close to the contact line between the government controlled and non-government controlled areas. Public services work very poorly, they are not supported sufficiently by the government. 260 children attend this school. The school and its windows are already 65 years old. Because of the military actions the windows have become completely unusable. In the cold season the students have to wear their warm jackets all day long and in winter snow often falls through cracks on the windowsills. The new windows result in more convenient learning conditions for the students and reduce the risk of getting a cold. And, last but not least, the consumption of heat and electricity is strongly reduced.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. Financial support of educational institutions is also not a priority of the Ukrainian government and the authorities. The need for support is especially urgent in villages. Since the opening of the kindergarten, the bathroom has never been repaired, the sanitary facilities are very old, water supply and sanitation systems need to be repaired. The low hygienic level led to a high risk of disease for the children. Due to this project new bath and toilet equipment was be bought and facilities were renovated.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General in Donetsk in its consular district - 5 regions of Eastern Ukraine. This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbas, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. Sartana in the Donetsk region is located close to the contact line between the government controlled and non-government controlled areas. Public services work very poorly, they are not supported sufficiently by the government. Despite the difficult situation, people do not leave their place of residence. 272 children attend the music school in Sartana. Moreover the music school constantly organizes additional activities to make children feel comfortable and to encourage them to progress despite the military conflict. Until now the school has not had a wardrobe. This project of the Consulate General allows to renovate the room and to buy the necessary furniture.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General in Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). It is funded as part of the technical cooperation in 2019. On Ukraine's way to Europe the Eastern Ukraine is a 'swing region'. This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons, corruption and the insufficient state support for people in need and social agencies. The project 'Mattresses for the regional center of palliative medicine in Kharkiv' gives the possibility to buy special medical mattresses to improve the living and treatment conditions of disabled people in the center of palliative medicine. The local project implementer is the NGO East-West Foundation.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General in Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). It is funded as part of the technical cooperation in 2019. On Ukraine's way to Europe the Eastern Ukraine is a 'swing region'. This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. Almost 80% of the patients of the specialized orphanage 'Sonechko' in Zaporizhzhia have psycho-neurological disorders. But this institution has no equipment for diagnosing these disorders. This project gives the possibility to buy an Electroencephalograph with basic equipment. The project makes it possible to improve the treatment conditions for children with disabilities. The local project implementer is the charity fund 'Schastlyva dytyna' (Happy child).
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: For twenty years now a tuberculosis epidemic is going on in Ukraine. Ukraine was ranked second in Europe in tuberculosis incidence in 2018 (according to the Ministry of health of Ukraine). At the same time in Ukraine there are not enough possibilities for tuberculosis treatment. Hospitals do not have modern equipment and technologies to diagnose and treat tuberculosis. The TB dispensary Zaporizhzhia, like many other hospitals in Ukraine, uses outdated equipment produced in the days of the Soviet . The project makes it possible for the TB dispensary to buy a modern Medical x-ray processor which is going to improve and speed up the diagnostic process, as well as to reduce the consumption of electricity and water (at the moment 500 litres per day), previously required for the development of x-rays. This project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk. The local implementer of the project is the charity fund 'HELPUS'.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Support to international election observation missions under participation of Centre for Monitoring and Research (CeMI) and European Network of Election Monitoring Organization (ENEMO) in Ukraine on the occasion of Presidential elections in March and Parliamentary elections in October 2019.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to improve the nutritional situation of the Sahrawi refugees in the Laayun camp near Tindouf, southern Algeria, through their own efforts. The project promotes the inclusion of camel milk as a foodstuff by setting up a micro-dairy. At the same time, the quality of the camel milk is improved and adapted to modern hygienic standards.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Saxony

Long Description: Reaching out to more than 1300 prison inmates through film screenings in prisons during the international film festival 'Journées Cinématographiques de Carthage' (JCC) in Tunisia.

Long Description: Supporting local project organizations directly through the German Embassy Tunis in the fields of democratization and political participation of civil society.

Long Description: District project for the integration of local mixed communities. 'Future Laboratory' is a project that was implemented successfully in Bremen (Germany) and shall now be established in Tunisia. The aim is to improve social cohesion, strengthen self confidence and to open new perspectives in socially disadvantaged city districts. By 'residential community' of a music ensemble in a school and joint project work of ensemble and school like music shows, city district operas, e.g., students, teachers and the city district profit altogether.

Long Description: For the health station in Kpakpavissa/Savalou, a multi-purpose room with office and storage room will be built, which will serve as a waiting room and storage area for the inhabitants of the village and the villages up to 7 km away.

Long Description: Better working conditions for fisher in Obock, including Yemenit fisher by better preservation possibilities of the catch, Job creation for women with disabilities with the aim of poverty and prejudice reduction and integration

Long Description: The 'Vovo Berta' project should continue to be supported. The project started in 2010 in Matola on the initiative of Berta Nhatave with the advice of the missionary couple Kierner. The goal is to support orphaned and disadvantaged children without tearing them out of their environment. The activities of the project take place directly in the poor district in Matola - Santos, so that the children are looked after and accompanied where they live and their everyday life takes place. The project has developed excellently in the past few years, as could be seen on several visits.

Long Description: The prisons in Mozambique are in a precarious state and are often overcrowded. With this measure the sanitary facilities in the men's prison in Tete, will be rehabilitated and equipped in a way so that there is at least one toilet in each cell, each of them for about 80 inmates. In addition, the kitchen is adapted to the minimum hygienic standards.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The preschool is located in a district of Windhoek, which is not yet connected to the urban electricity supply. A solar power system will be purchased to simplify the preparation of food (feeding program) and allow the purchase of a refrigerator for the storage of food. In addition, the classrooms can be supplied with light in the winter months and thus be used more efficiently.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project entails the construction of mobile diversion toilets for families in Ifelodun, Lagos, where families are in danger of being evicted from their homes. Due to physical and geographical restrictions, these families also lack access to sanitation facilities. The construction of the toilets is expected to improve the sanitary condition, reduce the environmental stress in the area and the health risks of the inhabitants.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to bring legal aid to women and other vulnerable members of rural communities in four local government areas in Kano state of Nigeria through the use of mobile legal aid clinics. The project focuses on community legal education and free legal aid service provision to women to increase knowledge of laws and rights to seek redress and to ensure access to legal aid services.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project seeks to train 35 unemployed and underemployed young persons (male and female) in smart city vegetable production, poultry and business practice. The rationales for this project are the high youth unemployment in Nigeria (15 to 35 years) of around 55%, and the need to work toward food security in Lagos, where about 20 million people live. Therefore, the project is expected to give employment opportunities, and contribute to food security in Lagos.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Grant of the City of Solingen for development policy projects of the Thiès Development Association

Long Description: The project will include the following activities - construction of 6 armouries and the provision of appropriate storekeeper and armoury manager training in Kismayo. Armoury compliance assessments across 26 past infrastructure interventions funded by the German Government.

Long Description: Organization of two five-day leisure camps (summer camps) for 100 South African pupils from 3rd up to 12th grade and 20 supervisors from the Walmer Township, a poor district of the South African port city of Port Elizabeth. During the summer camps, various workshops, group work and outdoor activities are offered to strengthen community awareness and improve social behavior.

Long Description: Funding for the Hokisa Children's Home, which takes care of (black) orphans in one of the oldest townships in Cape Town and gives them a family-like home. Hokisa takes special care of children with HIV / AIDS. One of the main tasks is to create a stable and comfortable environment for the minors - and in doing so promoting their social development. Much emphasis is also placed on education - All children of school age shall attend school. Therefore, i.e. transport and participation in events is ensured. Additionally, there is a medical practice on the premise rounding off the project in terms of health care.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Providing first aid and child protection services in the UN POCs in Juba and Yei City (UN-POC = United Nation Protection of Civilians)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Construction of a well and installation of two water tanks and a solar pump to ensure the drinking water supply for the approx. 5.000 residents of Makuyuni in the Monduli district in north-eastern Tanzania. The 900 pupils of the neighboring primary school are to be granted a special right of use with free water access.

Long Description: Broaden the portfolio of activities of the magic ecological park. Sensitization for upcycling / sustainable use of plastic bottles. Broaden training opportunities for adolescents in Doumasséssé (Lomé)

Long Description: Improving working structures and conditions of seamstresses in Dapaong, Togo

Long Description: Cultural workshops for 25 street kids in Lomé.

Long Description: Achieving economic independence for women in rural areas in the Tororo district. Creation of jobs through the production of sanitary pads. Provision of low-cost, reusable sanitary pads for low-income women and girls in Tororo. Participation of girls and women in socio-cultural life through the provision of affordable hygiene articles made of local materials and the improvement of hygienic conditions in schools/educational institutions as well as through sensitisation and anti-discrimination work.

Long Description: Assistance for sick bedridden persons and their families in the provinces of Santiago de Cuba, Camaguey, Matanzas and La Habana
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Endowment of a catholic kindergarten in Santiago which is used by families in need

Long Description: Installation of converters and turbines with the objective of an efficient use of the natural resources in the region of Matanzas and the finca of the Centro Cristiano de Reflexion y Dialogo (CCRD) in Cardenas which produces vegetables and fruits and distributes it to schools and hospitals amongst others.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Sustainable production of at least 3 local healing plants by 20 local families from the indigenous Mby'a Guaraní Chapaí Community of San Ignacio. Infrastructure will be provided for the processing (storage house). Development of practical and technological abilities. Empowerment of women through leading roles in transmition of knowledge and management. Raising awareness and education on sustainable production for biological diversity and use of natural medicines.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Basic health and hygiene courses for schoolchildren are to reduce the caries rate and diseases among children in Tarija. The caries rate among children in Tarija (2008 study) is 97.8%. Likewise, the rate of children affected by parasites is 92%, with adolescents aged 10 to 14 being most affected. The aim of these measures is to improve the health of 650 pupils.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In rural communities and outskirts of Cochabamba, various agricultural products are grown in a traditional way, for example without the use of pesticides or other chemical substances. Excess production is marketed under unfavourable conditions since the production sites are isolated from the large cities and their inhabitants do not have the means to market their products themselves and are therefore dependent on intermediaries. There is no direct contact between producers and consumers, so intermediaries buy products at very low prices and sell them at much higher prices. The aim of the project is to create a physical space where farmers can market their organic products directly at fair prices. This will help to improve their income considerably. Therefore the purchase of materials to set up a street market is planned, as is training and advising farmers on marketing.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Crocodile Meat Association was consolidated as a company for sustainable management of biodiversity. The 60 families that are part of the association process crocodile meat for later consumption and marketing. Most of the workers are women who have sanitary certificates and a health registration issued by the responsible authorities. The project involves the purchase of the necessary equipment (vacuum packaging machine, accessories and freezer) for a vacuum packaging system for the sustainable commercial use of crocodile meat and to improve the quality of the marketed product.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The San Juan Psychiatric Clinic is a project of the San Juan de DIos Hospital Order, which is dependent on the Catholic Church in Bolivia. This center receives patients from all over the department of La Paz, both urban and rural. In the building for acute patients are patients with severe mental disorders that require strict and constant monitoring. Unfortunately, the Institute does not have sufficient staff or resources for this purpose. Therefor safety accesories shall be installed.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The aim of the project is the construction of a recycling plant for plastic waste on the Banda Islands. A pyrolysis plant will be used to convert plastic into petrol and diesel, and a second plastic reduction machine will be used to process PET, which will then be transported to large recycling plants in Surabaya and sold there. The project will significantly improve the life quality of the population on the Band Islands.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Job creation and income-generating measures for women from Quezon City
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The House of Hope (HoH) is a charitable institution supported by the German Red Cross in Yerevan. The installation of solar panels on its roof is intended to cover energy consumption through renewable energies. The saved money for energy costs will be invested in the soup kitchen of the HoH. As a model project, it aims to raise awareness of environmental issues and stimulate further investment in renewable energies in Armenia.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In the framework of this small-scale program, the Embassy is funding the local NGO 'Need for Life Society' (NFLS) by providing sewing machines, ring-wells, latrine ring slabs and solar panels for poor tribal families in the remote hilly area of Rangamati, Bangladesh. Most people living in this area strongly depend on agriculture. (Drinking) water has to be collected at far-off tube-wells, work that mostly is done by women and children at the expense of their health and education. Besides, most families in this region are cut off the electricity grid. That is why NFLS considers necessary the purchase of solar panels. Through the project, NFLS aims to make access to clean water and safe energy sources for light generation easier. NFLS is hoping to thus relieve women and children who could then do a different work or go to school instead. Plus, solar-powered light that is also working during night increases security and allows the people to continue working and learning in the evening.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In the framework of the small-scale program the Embassy is funding a project by the local NGO 'Christian Service Society' (CSS) aiming to expand their ambulatory service for eye patients in three southern districts of Bangladesh (Bagerhat, Sathkira, Pirojpur). Especially in poor rural areas people are lacking both awareness and financial means for proper eye health and hygiene. In this context, CSS built up a hospital with separate eye clinic in Khulna in 1998. The eye clinic also provides ambulatory treatments in the surrounding districts. Through the current project, CSS is aiming to expand the ambulatory service of the eye clinic. The goal is to offer more treatments for the poor population, above all for children and elderly people, in order to prevent serious eye sicknesses. At the end of the project, 3200 persons should have access to a first eye check-up, 320 persons suffering from cataract should have undergone surgical treatment.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Know-how on how to deal with fake news campaigns and information on the background of the European Neighbourhood Policy will be shared with young journalists from Georgia and Germany. For that purpose, field trips and networking conferences will take place in Tbilisi (Georgia) in October and December 2019 and in Berlin in November. These conferences include methodological workshops and an exchange of ideas among the participants and representatives of the political sphere and of media NGOs. Furthermore, the participants will create their own articles which will be published through the online-platform Myth Detector. This platform will allow journalists to network, share and pool information and shares contents meant for public information in English.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: It is intended to purchase furniture for a school 160 km away from Bangalore where children from socially weak families are educated. The current furniture doesn't meet the requirements of the over 200 students anymore.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The aim of the project is to provide and equip the personnel and staff with the ability to deal with injuries at the work place and in everyday life in an emergency situation. The Foundation's goal is to train 1850 medical personnel, police staffs and school students in Yangon. This three-month project supports hands-on courses with an introduction to First Aid (Beginner / Advanced), Cardiopulmonary resuscitation (Beginner / Advanced) and the operation of automated external Defibrillators (Beginner / Advanced). The '247 EMS Foundation' needs the necessary medical equipment for this first aid training.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Renovation and upgrade of Medical equipment of a family planning clinic near Kathmandu.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Creation of an app which indicates the accessibility of institutions, restaurants, shops, and places. The creation process will take place in Peshawar, the app will be used in the whole country.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Qualified service structures for gender pedagogical and therapeutic offers for psychological stabilisation and school (re-)integration of 3000 children and adolescents have been established in Ramadi, Falluja, Kirkuk, Mosul.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The project seeks to abolish disadvantages of the population of Palestinian neighbourhoods in East Jerusalem in view of access to and quality of emergency medical services.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project's goal is to analyse best practice examples on how to integrate people with disabilities on the first job market and to make use of strategies to adapt those practices with regard to the countries of the Eastern Partnership. In doing so, human rights and human dignity get bolstered. In the course of seminars, German partners teach the participants. In September 2019 a common conference of the DISEMEX (International Conference 'Disability Employment Expert') partners will take place in Düsseldorf. The project results will be published spread at the regional conferences in Ukraine (Kiev), Armenia (Gyumri), Georgia (Tbilisi) and Russia (Yekaterinburg). In December 2019 an online conference will be held to spread the project's results and facillitate a deepened future cooperation.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Promote the education, protection and reintegration of boys and girls returning from Dadaab to Kismayo
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Emergency aid for vulnerable internally displaced persons and host communities through cash transfer, securing livelihoods and WASH activities in South- Somalia and Mandera
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Unprecedented growth in African cities is resulting in traffic congestion and uncontrolled sprawl, leading to rising greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, local air pollution, urban poverty, and climate vulnerabilities. The project aims to avoid this trajectory and deliver GHG reductions from the transport sector by promoting and improving public and non-motorized transport. The project will focus on Kenya, Rwanda, Tanzania, and Uganda, all of which mention transport as part of their NDCs (nationally determined contributions). The project will implement 'shift' strategies that introduce low carbon mobility options as well as 'avoid' strategies that reduce the need for trips. The project will support the implementation of high quality mass rapid transit systems in Nairobi, Kigali, and Kampala and the expansion of the existing BRT (bus rapid transit) system in Dar es Salaam. The project seeks to complement rapid transit through better access for pedestrians and cyclists and regulations to facilitate the intensification of land uses along rapid transit corridors.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Strengthening the capacities of the Port Control Units and the Bijaca landborder, the harbor of Durres and the harbor of Bar and the Air Cargo Control Unit at Tirana International Airport
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Domestic Animal Diversity Information System (DAD-IS) is a global communication tool supporting strategies for animal genetic resources (AnGR) management, with a role as clearing house mechanism and early warning tool for AnGR. This global system is managed by the Animal Production and Health Division (AGA). It provides National Coordinators for the Management of AnGR (NC) nominated by countries with a secure means to control the entry, updating and accessing of their national data. Throughout the existence of DAD-IS, population data have been lacking for many breeds. This information is critical for guiding the national management of AnGR and the calculation of SDG Indicator 2.5.2 (SDG = Sustainable Development Goals, SDG 2.5.2 = Proportion of local breeds classified as being at risk, not-at-risk or at unknown level of risk of extinction), for which AGA is the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) focal point. As of March 2018, across the world, when excluding extinct breeds, 67 percent of local breeds are classified as of unknown risk status, 26 percent as at risk, and 7 percent as not at risk of extinction. The main reason for the data gap is lack of population data on country level. Livestock censuses, if carried out at all, are expensive and thus not sufficiently frequent relative to the annual SDG reporting. Moreover, they usually do not provide information on breed level. Therefore, countries need cost efficient solutions allowing them to estimate regularly the population sizes of their AnGR. The project will update a document describing the methodology and adjust a simple data entry tool (access data base tool) allowing estimating the breed population at country level. Remark - All project countries can be found on the DAC list. Therefore, 100 % of the project budget is allocated to ODA.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: Improving the capacity to apply green port principles. Large ports in the Caspian Sea, such as the ports of Baku (Azerbaijan) and Turkmenbashi (Turkmenistan), but also neighbouring seaports, such as Aktau (Kazakhstan), expect to be able to significantly increase their trading activities. The port of Baku (Azerbaijan) was the first port in the region to commit itself to becoming a green port. The  Port Principles commit to reducing the ecological and energy footprint of goods distribution, including materials management, waste management and physical distribution. This includes best practices in energy, waste management, water and air quality and sustainable business practices.  port principles can help reduce air pollutants and greenhouse gases, increase energy security and open up economic opportunities.  ports are safe, sustainable and economic, offering best practices for sustainable trade and transport. The integration of renewable energy and energy efficiency in port operations is a key element in this endeavour. While these challenges exist, ports face a knowledge, capability and technology gap when it comes to integrating renewable energy into their operations as part of the green port principles.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. The village of Novomykhailivka is located near the contact line. The school, which has 102 pupils, tries to organize a normal educational process to make children feel comfortable despite the close war. Thanks to the project ten ordinary and one digital whiteboard could be purchased in order to better visualize the educational material.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). The DSD-school No. 19 (a member of the 'Schools - Partners for the Future' initiative with the German language diploma) is located in Donetsk (non-government controlled area). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbas and of completely missing state support. The school continues to work despite the war. Every year its students go to other cities of Ukraine, where they successfully pass the DSD-exams. Thanks to the project the escape route will be renovated with incombustible materials, that will save children's life in case of fire or shelling.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. Financial support of educational institutions is also not a priority of the Ukrainian government and the authorities. Many Ukrainian schools are still equipped with furniture, kitchen and sanitary equipment of the 70-90s years of the 20th century. The gymnasium Nr. 3 in Izium was founded in 1985 and still has the equipment of that time. Toilets work only partially, water supply and sanitation systems need repair, and there is no hot water. All that leads to a low sanitation level and together with this to an increased danger of falling ill. This project allows to buy new toilet equipment and to renovate the WC facilities.

Long Description: The project aims to develop a solar cooling-drying system for fish. The project will introduce a containerised, stand-alone solar technology package consisting of a hundred percent off-grid cooling and drying system among mariculture farmers. Mariculture is becoming increasingly important in Kenya as natural fish stocks (e.g. tilapia in Lake Victoria) shrink. Farmers on the coast of Kenya currently produce Milkfish (Chanos chanos Forskal) in ponds. Fishermen also harvest a local sardine called Kimarawali (Stolephorus delecatulus) along the banks of rivers in the Kwale and Kilifi counties. The seasonal nature of fishing yields and the lack of suitable processing technologies force fishermen to sell their products as long as they are fresh - often below price. Unsuitable processing and handling technologies also deny access to high-end markets. The German and Kenyan partners develop a technology package to process and add value to Milkfish and Kimarawali. The technology will include the latest advances in photovoltaics (PV), phase change materials (PCM) and modelling technologies. For cooling technology, PCM cold storages or use of electrical battery, or a combination, will be optimised to guarantee stable and reliable cooling operations. Drying will be coupled to the cooling system and heat remissions will be used to supplement drying. For the production of high-quality dried fish (first-class nutritional value, texture and taste), dehydration takes place through optimised temperature and humidity control. The fishermen are trained in processing and quality assurance. Fraunhofer Institute for Solar Energy Systems ISE (Fraunhofer ISE) and Innotech cooperate with the Kenyan Industrial Research and Development Institute (KIRDI), the Kenya Marine and Fisheries Research Institute (KMFRI) and the Mombasa  of Technology (TUM) to design, develop and transfer the proposed technology package.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: Collaborative project - EVAR - coastal upwelling areas. The Benguela upwelling system under climate change, sub-project - Variations in upwelling intensity and in the sedimentation regime in the Benguela upwelling system during the Holocene and late Pleistocene periods - Viable technologies to protect resources (water, Integrated Water Resources Management (IWRM), land, forests, settlements) and eco-technologies in the developing country
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

The required sports equipment will de donated to South African schools afterwards, so the materials can be used for school sport lessons.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Thermo-chemical conversion of silica-rich biomass residues for the production of heat and power, and the combined generation of mesoporous biogenic silica for material application (A+BiOx). The project proposal will establish a close scientific cooperation between DBFZ (Deutsches Biomasseforschungszentrum) and Stellenbosch  in order to investigate the efficient use of silica-rich agricultural residues in South Africa for bioenergy and material applications. It focusses on the chemical pretreatment of biomass residues from food production and its combustion and gasification characteristics for combined heat and power production. Furthermore, material use of the biogenic silica is considered. The comprehensive, innovative approach addresses aspects of climate change, efficiency and sustainability of agricultural production, soil degradation and new transformation processes of the agricultural production. Therefore, the proposal is highly relevant as an initial step for the effient use of agricultural resources but also for DBFZ as it allows enhancing one of the core research topics with essential input.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: This project on urban farming (UF) aims to contribute to the improvement of urban food security, nutrition and food safety. Possible means to increase availability, consumption and marketing of diverse, safe and nutritious foods through improved production and marketing of crops and animal products in disadvantaged communities of Maputo and Cape Town are investigated. The operational framework for UF shall be improved and research on UF and the sustainable application of the project results from grass root to upper policy levels strengthened. Objectives 1) study food habits, consumer behaviour and current systems of UF, explore value-adding options through improving and diversifying the UF systems, 2) investigate benefits and risks to human health and food safety of crop and animal UF. 3) extend the current agricultural research of the partner universities to the area of UF for all Mozambican, South African and German project partners. 4)sustainable implementation of project results.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: The annual interdisciplinary conference on research in tropical and subtropical agriculture, natural resource management and rural development (TROPENTAG) is jointly organised by the universities of Berlin, Bonn, Göttingen, Hohenheim, Kassel-Witzenhausen, Hamburg, ZALF e. V. (Leibniz Centre for Agricultural Landscape Research), ETH Zurich (Switzerland), Czech  of Life Sciences Prague (Czech Republic), BOKU Vienna (Austria) ( of Natural Resources and Life Sciences) and the Council for Tropical and Subtropical Research (ATSAF e. V.) in co-operation with the GIZ Advisory Service on Agricultural Research for Development (BEAF). The Tropical Day has become the most important international conference on development-oriented research in the fields of food security, natural resource management and rural development in central Europe and provides a unique platform for scientific and personal exchange for students, junior and senior scientists, development experts and funding organisations from several countries together with their international partner institutions. The Tropical Day is held annually at different host sites. Tropical Day 2019 will take place in Kassel, Germany, 18 to 20 September 2019. This year's theme is 'Filling gaps and removing traps for sustainable resources management'.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: The total livestock populations within Uganda and Kenya affected/threatened by Brucellosis are estimated at 30.4 million cattle, 42.3 million goats, 21.1 million sheep and 5.3 million pigs, most of which are kept by resource poor farmers. These livestock are pivotal resource providing food security, promoting livelihoods, accounting for 20 to 30% of gross domestic product, and employ about 70 to 80% of the population. Main objectives 1. Develop capacity at College of Veterinary Medicine, Animal Resources and BioSecurity (CoVAB), Makerere , and Faculty of Veterinary Medicine,  of Nairobi (UONBI) for diagnostic and typing of Brucella spp. 2. Build capacity and train local field veterinarians, local doctors and laboratory technicians to diagnose, detect and conduct surveillance of brucellosis using applied diagnostics. 3. Main Target of the German Contribution - (i) Isolation, characterization and genotyping of Brucella outbreak strains infecting wildlife, domestic ruminants and humans, (ii) determination of temporal and regional distribution of genotypes, (iii) determination of sources and routes of spread of infections. 4. Prevention by conjunctival vaccination Questions to be dealt with '1) What is the status of brucellosis in various livestock reared in the E. African regions?', '2) Correlation between outbreaks in Animals and humans.', '3) What Brucella biovars/genotypes are involved in the causation of brucellosis in livestock and humans?', '4) Efficacy of conjunctival vaccination', '5) What infrastructural/human capacities are needed for sustainable brucellosis management?', '6) Education of people on Brucellosis, Hygiene and infection risks - how to close the gaps?'.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: Subproject 2. Erfurt  of Applied Sciences (EUAS) is a project partner of FRUVASE project (Fruits and vegetables for all seasons...), led by  Göttingen, with partners in Tanzania, Uganda and Kenya, which engages in developing processing technologies for selected fruits and leafy vegetables to prolong shelf-life and generate and commercialize new products. Task of EUAS is to embed the developed technologies in a resource-efficient, energy-autonomous cyclic systems approach (water-energy-waste-food nexus), considering renewable energy generation and use (biomass, photovoltaic - PV), cyclic processes including organic waste management and water purification and re-use.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: Brazil's new government' - this was the title of the joint discussion event of the Cologne-Rio City Twinning Association and Department of International Affairs. The following experts took part in the discussion - a) Igor Birindiba Batista, Cooperation Brazil e. V. (registered association) /  of Duisburg-Essen, b) Thomas Fatheuer, former director of the Heinrich Böll Foundation in Rio de Janeiro, sociologist in Berlin, c) Dr. (Doctor) Carola Saavedra, writer, and from April at the Portuguese-Brazilian Institute of the  of Cologne, e) Astrid Prange de Oiveira, journalist and presenter of the evening.

Long Description: Research, teaching, training and further education as well as consulting and health care in the fields of infectious and tropical medicine. The Bernhard Nocht Institute for Tropical Medicine (BNITM) is Germany's largest institution for research, treatment and training in the field of tropical diseases and new emerging infections. As a member of the Leibniz-Association and as a research institute of national importance, the Institute is jointly funded by the  Government, the Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg and the other federal states. Research topics include clinical studies, epidemiology and disease control as well as the biology of pathogens, their reservoirs and vectors. The current scientific focus is on malaria, haemorrhagic fever viruses, immunology, epidemiology and clinical studies of tropical infections as well as on the mechanisms of the viral transmission by mosquitoes.
Donor Agency: City State of Hamburg

Long Description: Research, teaching, training and further education as well as consulting and health care in the fields of infectious and tropical medicine. The BNITM is Germany's largest institution for research, treatment and training in the field of tropical diseases and new emerging infections. As a member of the Leibniz-Association and as a research institute of national importance, the Institute is jointly funded by the  Government, the Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg and the other federal states. Research topics include clinical studies, epidemiology and disease control as well as the biology of pathogens, their reservoirs and vectors. The current scientific focus is on malaria, haemorrhagic fever viruses, immunology, epidemiology and clinical studies of tropical infections as well as the optimization of control measures against tropical infectious diseases in resource-poor countries and the mechanisms of virus transmission by mosquitoes.For the handling of highly pathogenic viruses and infected insects, the Institute has laboratories of the highest biosafety level (BSL-4) and a BSL-3 insectary. The Institute's health care services include specific laboratory diagnostics of tropical diseases and other rare infections, capacity building as well as the consultation of the scientific community, politics and the general public, which essentially contribute to the Institute's national reputation. The Institute has been appointed by the  Ministry of Health as the National Reference Center (NRC) for the detection of all tropical pathogens as well as by the WHO as Collaborating Center for arboviruses and haemorrhagic fever viruses. In collaboration with the Ghanaian Health Ministry and the  of Kumasi the Institute has been operating a modern research and training center in the West-African rain forest for over twenty years, which is also available to external research groups.The teaching activities comprise a three months full-time course on all aspects of tropical medicine for physicians as well as a training program for PhD students at the Institute and a number of activities on continuing education in topics related to travel medicine and international health. Numerous scientists of the Institute are involved in student teaching as appointed professors of the  and the  Hospital of Hamburg.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Health

The varied products of the GLF support the global spreading of holistic scenery attempts on politically and more strategically and implementing level.

Long Description: Contribution to the Secretariat of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) for the organization and implementation of the intersessional meetings in Bonn (meetings of the UNFCCC subsidiary bodies) attended by all Parties (here only share for developing countries - in 2020, only virtual events and reallocation of funds due to Covid-19 to improve IT infrastructure and Internet connectivity for developing countries). In particular, expenses for the organization, implementation, documentation, information and service at events with all UNFCCC Parties, especially the intersessional meeting in Bonn are covered by the Bonn Fund and serve the social and economic development of developing countries (2020 by providing funds to improve IT infrastructure and internet connectivity for developing countries).Due to the  pandemic, the purpose of the Bonn Fund for 2020 was redirected and used for the following expenditures at UNFCCC - Strengthening the delivery of UNFCCC conferences (integrating innovation and virtual resources) through - Developing and improving conference-related IT systems, - Revising the website to improve features and usability, - Virtual participation/digital engagement/support for developing countries with connectivity challenges. Addressing institutional needs - Implementation of INSPIRA, the United Nations Staffing System, and - Furnishing the new UN campus building. Only virtual participation/digital engagement/support for developing countries with connectivity problems, the development and improvement of conference-related IT systems are ODA-eligible. This was taken into account in the amount paid.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The financing of biodiversity conservation is a key issue in the implementation of the CBD. Most countries lack reliable information on the actual costs that are needed to effectively implement their biodiversity strategies, nor do they know where the necessary funds can be sourced and how they can be used to implement their strategies. The BIOFIN initiative, meanwhile active in 37 countries, is a global partnership that supports its partner countries by addressing these knowledge gaps. Financing solutions are being developed and implemented in a second step. BIOFIN Phase II, which is financed through the IKI  Response Package, focuses on four signature solutions - 1.) Support countries to deal with the impacts of COVID-19, 2.) Results based and effective budgeting for biodiversity, 3.) Reducing harmful subsidies and expenditures, 4) Greening the financial sector.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Ukrainian residential buildings still have a lot of potential where energy efficiency is concerned - and this applies to both old and new buildings, with the result that the construction sector today accounts for around 40% of energy consumption in the country. The project showed how energy can be saved and climate-damaging emissions reduced using a model construction complex in Kiev. Equipped with modern technologies like high-insulation windows, heat pumps and a ventilation system, the renovated part of the complex serves as a showcase for the planning, construction and operation of an energy-efficient and environmentally friendly building. The project shared its experience with the Ukrainian construction sector and universities with the aim of integrating energy efficiency more intensively into the training of construction specialists. In addition, the project worked to improve the framework conditions for energy-efficient construction in Ukraine.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The objective -  The reliability of consumption measurements and quality tests in the drinking- and wastewater sector, were improved through the strengthening of the services of the Bolivian Institut of Metrology (IBMETRO = Instituto Boliviano de Metrología) . Indicators - 1. At least two accredited laboratories exist for the 5 (five) basic parameters of the NB 512 (besids EPSAS La Paz, EPSAS = Empresa Pública Social de Agua y Saneamiento). 2. IBMETRO carries out 6 (six) bilateral comparisons with EPSAs, for control their drinking water meters. 3. IBMETRO offers Proficiency Testing for 10 (ten) waste water parameters.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The project contributes to biodiversity conservation, reduction of GHG emissions and climate change adaptation in the Mata Atlântica. Areas located in the back country of Rio de Janeiro, in the southern part of the state of Bahia, and in the coastal region between the states of Sao Paulo and Paraná are protected and interlinked. The project works together with local communities to register small-scale landholders in a rural environmental land registry. It further provides advisory support to state environmental authorities on establishing reference centers to support the restoration of degraded areas. Development scenarios including climate change, its impacts and vulnerability analyses help identify ways in which the sustainable use of ecosystems can contribute to GHG reductions and climate change adaptation. The project disseminates lessons learned which can be incorporated into policy approaches and fed into concrete measures for protecting and restoring the Mata Atlântica.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Colombia has a robust institutional and policy framework for climate change and biodiversity management, including its Biodiversity Action Plan, National Adaptation Plan (NAP) and Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC), which has goals for mitigation, adaptation and means of implementation. Sectorial and territorial climate change plans (PIGCC) are under development. Unsustainable territorial development has however hindered Colombia's efforts for sustainable development. Transformative models are necessary to connect urban and rural economies and natural systems, recover biodiversity and strengthen local resilience. Huila, Santander and Cordoba departments are highly vulnerable regions. Local stakeholders show strong commitment to integrate biodiversity and climate change in their management. These selected regions have strategic ecosystems such as coastal wetlands, dry forests, and paramos - the perfect setting for testing sustainable and scalable territorial development models.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The multidimensional resilience of the vulnerable population in the regions Caaguazú and Caazapá is strenghtened.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The measure is designed to improve the electronic service provision of Palestinian communities in terms of quality and consideration of user needs and to strengthen instruments for citizen participation. Improvements should also be explicitly achieved for citizens in the C area and in Gaza. The access of women, young people and disadvantaged groups to e-services is to be strengthened.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Forests are complex ecosystems, which fulfil many functions. They also have a major global role to play as carbon sinks. The project improves the effectiveness of climate financing approaches that have a positive impact on forest conservation. Capacities are also being increased in partner countries to reduce emissions from forest and land use. The project pursues three active approaches aimed at achieving more climate protection through the strengthening of the forests - At the international level, the issue of climate financing is better positioned and more private involvement in this area is encouraged. The cooperation of the stakeholders is also improved, with the result that forest-relevant climate financing is more effectively implemented and the goals of the New York Declaration on Forests are achieved more effectively. In addition, donors are better coordinated and are responsible for climate financing and the transfer of knowledge from project activities.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Triangular Cooperations between Latin American and Caribbean partner countries and Germany strengthen public policies for sustainable development in the Partner Countries.Triangle cooperation between Germany and Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Costa Rica, Mexico and Uruguay and recipient partner countries Bolivia, Columbia, Cuba, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Ghana, Guatemala, Honduras, Indonesia, Nicaragua, Peru, Paraguay and Tunesia.

Long Description: Extension of the existing safe-hub model. In the target community of Tembisa (Gauteng Province, South Africa), a Local Economic Development (LED) Zone is to be created as part of a safe-hub. A number of small and medium-sized enterprises, created and run by the local population, will be located directly at the Safe-Hub Campus. The main focus of the project is therefore either to select existing companies for the project or to support founders in the process of setting up a company in order to become one. All economic activities at the Safe-Hub are to be coordinated in a superordinate manner in order to a) generate corresponding energy effects and b) ensure that the offer is adapted to the needs of the local population. In the long term, the LED Zone sees itself as an incubator for local start-ups that boost the local economic cycle.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Bavaria

Long Description: Promoting resilience by strengthening agricultural production, agricultural skills and nutritional awareness of vulnerable small farmers and students in Jubek State, Juba, South Sudan.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Purchase of 57 new mattresses and mattress covers for the Santa Teresa Jornet nursing home in Tarija, Bolivia.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project seeks to support the implementation of Colombia's Low Carbon Development Strategy (since 2012) towards the achievement of a less carbon-intensive economy. After diagnosis, prospective and planning phases and setting up a goal (iNDC), there is a need to start effective execution of actions in different sectors and regions, to demonstrate the feasibility of the low-carbon approach. The project will carry out demonstration initiatives on GHG emissions reductions covering industry, agriculture, energy and housing sectors in particular regions. Yet, the project also recognizes the need to work on policy development, which has a huge potential to facilitate the transition to a low carbon economy, as well on building capacities in the public and private sectors at the local level, through different means, including communication.The project seeks to contribute to the deviation of trends in emissions and to prepare the country for the implementation of the Paris commitments.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Basic health care, nutrition and psychosocial care for internally displaced persons and Venezuelan refugees in Antioquia and Córdoba, Colombia
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Non-technical investigations and humanitarian Mine and ordnance clearance in Balboa (Cauca) and Urrao (Antioquia), Colombia

Long Description: Supporting the Peruvian state and civil society organisations in establishing a National Remembrance Policy by promoting a National Remembrance Policy in the regions of Ayacucho, Junín and Huánuco and providing technical assistance for the construction of the  La Hoyada  memorial. Furthermore, processes of remembrance and reconciliation at public universities in Ayacucho, Junín and Huánuco are to be promoted and the capacities of state and civil society actors in Ayacucho, Junín, Huánuco and Lima to implement a reparations policy that includes human rights, gender and intercultural aspects are to be strengthened.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to increase the legal situation of migrant workers through legal advocacy and legal assistance in Beijing and Shenzhen. Through activities such as legal consultation, labor dispute mediation, legal aid, online legal knowledge training and offline visiting and legal advocacy etc. legal awareness and ability to rights protection of migrant workers should be improve and strenght.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: TransJakarta, the first and longest bus rapid transit (BRT) system in , was initiated by Jakarta with support from ITDP. Today, it forms the backbone of Jakarta's transport system. If properly integrated with the new  and improved pedestrian and bicycle access, daily ridership could increase from 330,000 to 1 million. With ITDP support, TransJakarta has been converted into an autonomous public authority with a chance to greatly improve its operations. ITDP has been asked to help physically integrate it with the new , optimize its services, improve NMT access, and help the city reform new zoning and parking regulations in the city. A goal is to upgrade TransJakarta to Gold Standard BRT and change zoning and parking regulations to be consistent with Gold Standard transit oriented development. ITDP has also been asked by the Mayor of Medan to develop a conceptual plan for the first full BRT outside Jakarta.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Hindering the revitalisation of tensions and conflicts by supporting local authorities in the reconstruction of parts of Marawi City
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Philippine government is seeking to increase the proportion of renewable energies and use them to reduce energy costs and greenhouse gas emissions. The project supports these goals by further developing the financing and integration of renewable energies in the city of Butuan. Various urban stakeholders are working together in a Planning Group for Energy Development (PDP) with the aim of developing an inclusive, cost-effective and sustainable energy solution. A master plan for urban energy development ensures that domestic, renewable resources are used in line with the development goals, and to achieve this, the stakeholders complete a workshop series on various aspects relevant to planning in the energy sector. Armed with this newly-acquired knowledge, they can then technically and financially evaluate the proposals for energy development. The project also develops and disseminates a financing product that contributes to the implementation of the master plan.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The day care centre provides care for socially disadvantaged children from large families, families at risk or who have been victims of domestic violence. Socially disadvantaged senior citizens also receive free medical and dental services, warm clothing and food from the day care centre. By purchasing their own minibus, the needy can be brought to the day care centre more easily in collective transports. In addition, the people receiving care can be offered more leisure activities outside Tbilisi, which will improve the quality of care.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to strengthen and restore the resilience and livelihoods of the populations affected by the floods and landslides in the Sagaing region and in China State. Through a participatory, multi-stakeholder approach, which focuses strongly on the integration of local civil society structures, measures are implemented in three of the four funding areas of transitional aid.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Improving the resilience of communities in Yangon and Mandalay through disaster risk reduction and management in hospitals, expansion of coordination mechanisms and strengthening of the communities to ensure continuous, inclusive care for the population affected by disasters.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Strengthened referral systems and preventive networks for counselling women with gender-specific experiences of violence in refugee shelters and host communities in the project regions (Duhok, Erbil and Sulaimania/Germian provinces) through qualification, strengthening and networking of local state and civil society structures.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Humanitarian (multi-sectoral) emergency and disaster assistance for measures for the protection and survival of people in response to the acute emergency in Beirut, Lebanon
