Long Description: Humanitarian assistance to communities affected by the civil war and internally displaced persons in the provinces of Aleppo and Idlib in Syria
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The overall objective of the project is to strengthen the resilience of needy Bedouins and pastoral communities in the West Bank and Palestine. To achieve this goal, in a first step (Goal 1) the shepherds improved their livestock-based livelihoods. In a second step, shepherds have improved the protection of natural resources (Goal 2).
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The development of noncommunicable disease health services in Gaza, which have so far been predominantly reactive and treat diseases late, aims to further develop a model that focuses more on prevention, early detection and, above all, cheaper treatment because it takes place earlier and is carried out locally. The project thus strengthens local capacities, which are of national relevance in view of the supply situation in the area of noncommunicable diseases in Gaza and will serve as a model.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: To contribute to reducing sexual violence against women and children within the Palestinian society, specifically in Nablus and Hebron districts in Palestine
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Integrated water, sanitation and hygiene measures, food security and protection measures to the most vulnerable conflict affected people in the governorates of Taiz, Ibb and Amran in Yemen.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) and food security in the governorates of Taiz and Ibb
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: MRV for transparency is an important foundation for policy-making within the framework of the Paris Agreement, one which also applies at subnational levels. The project supports state governments in Brazil (Pernambuco), India (Chhattisgarh, West Bengal), Mexico (Baja California, Yucatán and Jalisco) and South Africa (KwaZulu-Natal) in closing MRV capacity gaps and implementing climate change mitigation measures. Offering technical support to the regions for the development of sustainable MRV systems, it identifies further mitigation potential and supports its implementation. The project also organises cross-national dialogues between national, subnational and local governments to achieve the vertical integration of climate protection measures. The network of the  Under2 Coalition  is used to disseminate the experiences gained.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The implementation of the Paris climate targets largely depends on the provision of the necessary financial resources. The project supports the mobilisation of private investments for the implementation of nationally determined contributions and low emission development strategies (LEDS) in the partner countries and advises public and private stakeholders to this end. Climate-friendly investment plans are being developed and existing plans improved in selected sectors. In parallel, the project also addresses investment barriers by supporting partner countries in drawing up political and regulatory frameworks and financial instruments. The conditions for private investment in NDC implementation are improved by reducing investment risk and designing incentive mechanisms. The LEDS Global Partnership also provides a forum for stakeholders to share their learning experiences and replicate successful approaches.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project aims at creating a study on the existing instruments of media accountability in the region. Afterwards, the results of the study shall be discussed in a strategic workshop in Amman, where stakeholders shall establish a network and develop a roadmap for future projects relating to media accountability. Finally, the results will be presented to a wide range of audiences and future projects in the field of media accountability shall be developed.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This project aims to gauge initial responses from the foreign policy establishment in Brussels to potential future evolutions of the EU's external role in promoting peace and stability, in particular through its involvement in mediation.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Several Southeast Asian countries have long experienced rapid economic growth and urbanisation - and large, fast-growing cities contribute significantly to greenhouse gas emissions. The project supports selected cities in Indonesia, the Philippines and Vietnam in developing local climate change mitigation plans, which are characterised by specific goals, holistic strategies and the involvement of various stakeholders. Implementation is being carried out in cooperation with the government of the Seoul metropolitan region, which published an unprecedented reduction plan in 2015 - the  Seoul Promise . Low-emission development paths for cities ( City Promises ) are developed in the project cities and their implementation is also supported. Each regional government develops locally adapted climate change mitigation targets and action plans, which are tailored to the individual framework conditions and priorities.In this way, the project also contributes to the implementation of the partner countries' NDCs .
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project creates capacity for ambitious NDC revision and implementation, advancing Paris programs, decisions & mechanisms, and the 2018 Facilitative Dialogue through an innovative methodology coupled with coalition building. Structured engagement between civil society, experts, negotiators, policy makers, partnerships and UN bodies helps participants learn while acting together to deliver climate action projects that develop national plans and advance multilateral rules in line with long-term Paris Agreement goals. Solutions exploit synergies between a) domestic and international policy, b) mitigation and adaptation, and c) existing projects, building NDC support and negotiation capacity. Participants gain knowledge with which they support leaders and peers for further action delivering ambitious implementation. Experiences are shared with project countries, while collective experience is discussed in multilateral contexts.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The  United Nations Innovation Technology Accelerator for Cities  (UNITAC) is intended to contribute to placing cutting-edge technologies as part of Agenda 2030 and thus sustainable development. The SDG 11 relevant for UNITAC Hamburg is - to make cities inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable.  It is a United Nations initiative financed by voluntary funds. Implementation is carried out by the UN Secretariat, a local partner and other UN organisations. The Hamburg facility is managed by UN Habitat.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Advisory services for the de-facto administration in Tiraspol of an harmonization with the EU and the European market.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Secondment of civil experts to International Peace and Election Observation Mission through conclusion of work or secondment contracts by the Centre for International Peace Operations (ZIF)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims at educating cultural institutions on inclusive work in their field. At the same time artists with Down Syndrome have the chance to participate in an German-Ukrainian residency program. During the project a studio for artists with Down Syndrome is going to be established in Kiev.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to improve the quality of Namibian mobility and logistics actors. This should happen through know-how transfer of different Bremen actors.
Donor Agency: City State of Bremen

Long Description: Support for the African Institutes for Mathematical Sciences ( AIMS ) initiative through an internationally advertised research chair at the AIMS Centre in Tanzania. Due to the lack of financial support from the Tanzanian government, AIMS-Tanzania has not been active since 2018. The research chair was therefore transferred from the AIMS Center in Bagamoyo/Tanzania to the AIMS Center in Cape Town/South Africa in mid-2019. - Capacity building in the field of education and research / knowledge transfer
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: Support for the African Institutes for Mathematical Sciences ( AIMS ) initiative through an internationally advertised research chair at the AIMS Centre in Tanzania. Due to the lack of financial support from the Tanzanian government, AIMS-Tanzania has not been active since 2018. The research chair was therefore transferred from the AIMS Center in Bagamoyo/Tanzania to the AIMS Center in Cape Town/South Africa in mid-2019. - Capacity building in the field of education and research / knowledge transfer
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: The  Government's coalition agreement set the goal of expanding cultural cooperation with Africa and strengthening cultural exchange. It is to be achieved, in particular, by a reappraisal of German colonialism with and in the countries concerned and by developing local cultural infrastructure. Against this background, a workshop will be held at the MARKK Museum in Hamburg in 2019 and the next collaboration of international experts will take place in 2020, during which this agenda will be discussed. The talks are also to be understood as a reaction to public debates about the colonial heritage and to the demands for the temporary or permanent restitution of cultural assets.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The  Government's coalition agreement set the goal of expanding cultural cooperation with Africa and strengthening cultural exchange. It is to be achieved, in particular, by a reappraisal of German colonialism with and in the countries concerned and by developing local cultural infrastructure. Against this background, a workshop will be held at the MARKK Museum in Hamburg in 2019 and the next collaboration of international experts will take place in 2020, during which this agenda will be discussed. The talks are also to be understood as a reaction to public debates about the colonial heritage and to the demands for the temporary or permanent restitution of cultural assets.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: CLIENT II China - Continuation of the BMBF's Clean Water Project Office in Shanghai - Viable technologies to protect resources (water, IWRM, land, forests, settlements) and eco-technologies in the developing country
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: In Indonesia there is a need of sustainable solutions to reduce the amount of municipal waste that is dumped on its landfills. In cooperation with the city of Banjarmasin and a German recycling expert, a technology concept for sorting and utilizing municipal waste shall be developed.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The general goal is to digitally preserve important Syrian cultural heritage and to impart knowledge. The project makes an important contribution to the cultural policy focus and funding policy goal Preservation of cultural heritage worldwide. The specific purpose of the 2020 project is to process the previously collected data from the database in a targeted manner, in particular data from important damaged buildings in Homs, Raqqa and the Idlib region. The aim is to provide a reliable data basis for future reconstruction in Syria.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Syrian Heritage Archive with its collection of traditional houses, comprising several thousand photos, together with the evaluation of research work and Internet materials (e.g. drone and satellite images) form the basis of the planned documentation activity. The aim of the project is to use the data from the Syrian Heritage Archive Project and further research to create a district study of the Judayda district in Aleppo. Since the district of Judayda has a particularly high density of historical houses of different sizes, special attention is paid to the documentation of the historical shape of the courtyard houses and the building materials used. This is to create a sound data basis for the district and guidelines are to be developed in preparation for a future reconstruction of the neighbourhood in question.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: training and equipment assistance - Rise of the efficiency of border police authorities with border security, support of rule of law and democracy, development and rice of the efficiency of border managment - Project Office Ramallah
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of the Interior, Building and Community

Long Description: The course was set for a new, global climate policy at the UN Climate Conference 2015 in Paris. Now the crucial question is,  What happens next?  The Global Solutions project follows the  Road from Paris . In emerging and developing countries, it uses web and video reports to document actions, people and projects that contribute to global warming limitation, adaptation to the consequences of climate change and the conservation of biodiversity. One focus of the reporting is on projects supported by the International Climate Initiative. Schools and educational institutions can use DVDs with these reports as teaching material. The reports are available 24/7 in several languages on a multimedia platform, together with background articles, picture galleries and audio-photo shows, and various learning packages are already available online in German, English and Spanish.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Binational universities - long-term transnational education projects - German  in Cairo - GUC, German  of Technology Oman - GUtech, German Jordanian  - GJU - Higher education, scholarships for students from the developing country
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: Framework programme for the  Berlin Energy Transition Dialogue 2019  (BETD) in Berlin. Due to the framework programme new thematic focuses of the conference have been picked up, existing dialogues on political and economical basis have been strengthened and new cooperations were initiated. The project consist of sightseeing programmes, business-to-government dialogues and professional workshops. Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: India's cities are faced with the complicated task of meeting the infrastructure requirements of rapidly growing regions. Water scarcity, inadequate wastewater treatment, as well as lack of access to and knowledge of technological solutions pose major challenges for India's water management. At the same time, many German actors have knowledge and specialised technologies that can make a contribution to mastering these challenges achieving sustainable goals with high environmental benefits. However, the often specialised and decentralised companies find it difficult to gain a foothold in the market. In AQUA-Hub, so called Water Innovation Hubs are being realised in two Smart Cities, Coimbatore (Tamil Nadu) and Solapur (Maharashtra), and are accompanied by pilot measures of German measuring technology for water quality monitoring.The project AQUA-Hub addresses the needs of the local water sectors identified in previous projects, as well as the challenges of the German water sector to build projects, relationships and business in the Indian market. A local presence is of great importance for the relations and information exchange between German and Indian actors. Besides networking activities and the mediation of business partners, the hubs fulfil the function of project centres for the realisation of demonstration projects and increase the exposure of Indian partners with technologies  Made in Germany . The piloting of German measurement technology for water quality monitoring, as planned in the project, thus offers the opportunity to meet these needs with manageable investments and risks and to create the basis for both better data availability on site as a starting point for measures to meet environmental goals and a connecting point for subsequent technology transfer.The further development of the Water Innovation Hubs is advised by a project advisory board consisting of the main institutions of country cooperation. Additional services of the hubs are being developed to create a sustainable, financially viable and transferable format that can be used in other regions. At the same time, the technological adaptation needs of German measurement technology will be determined. AQUA-Hub creates the basis for strengthening Indo-German cooperation, contributing to the solution of water-related challenges and increasing the export opportunities of German companies.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project aims to use the limitations of the CORONA PANDEMIE and to transform them into positive development strategies for our development education work. The main target group are seminar teachers, multipliers and participants of our educational programs in Berlin. Despite the reduced seminar work, they should be given the opportunity to form an opinion on global issues and to become involved in development policy, especially in view of the global and societal challenges posed by the pandemic. Through innovative digitally prepared interactive seminar methods, they should learn to recognize and question their own role with regard to the topics of global justice, racism and sustainable development.

Long Description: The project  Celebrating with intelligence  project focuses on the cultural differences around the world, in particular on growing up.When do girls grow up and what consequences does this have for attending schools and further education. The projcet is an activity of development.related information, education and public relations in Germany and thus a contribution to the development cooperation guidelines of the federal state of Saxony-Anhalt fom March 12, 2019.

Long Description: The  Aktionsbündnis Fairer Handel Berlin  is a voluntary cooperation of organizations and individuals who - without legal obligation - are willing to share elements of their taking place Fair Trade activities with others in order to promote Fair Trade in Berlin as a whole. This alliance is guided by the internationally agreed declarations of principle on Fair Trade and pursues the overarching goal of strengthening Fair Trade in Berlin by building a long-term structure of cooperation and action. Critical processes are to be taken up and worked on, and positive developments are to be carried forward and expanded. Also, many initiatives, actions, actors and points of view, which have not been represented in the Fairtrade Town campaign so far, should develop their effects and be made visible through the Action .
Donor Agency: City State of Berlin

Long Description: The project is aimed at development associations, facilitators, and actors in Berlin. The goal of the educational program is to raise awareness of the topic of digitization and its facets in Berlin's development policy. Berlin organizations and multipliers are strengthened in their digital media competence and in the consideration of digital methods in the field of global learning. Furthermore, digitalization as a development policy issue and for the communication of development policy content should be more strongly perceived, considered and applied. In addition, actors will be sensitized to secure and legally compliant digital communication and service structures and appropriate structures will be provided.

Long Description: The project  Bremen - City of Human Rights  is devoted over three years to the priorities  Sustainable Development  and  Human Rights  with specific reference to the local level. The following services are to be provided within the framework of four measures - Annual specialist conferences on maritime and Bremen topics / Conception, implementation and nationwide dissemination of a  Certificate course for the National Action Plan for Business and Human Rights  / Activities in the Garden of Human Rights / Exhibition  Bremen - City of Human Rights . The project aims to link existing activities and develop them further. New forms of civil society and entrepreneurial engagement are to be developed so that they mutually reinforce one another and generate synergies.
Donor Agency: City State of Bremen

Long Description: The nationally active One World promoters are committed to improving knowledge about global interrelationships among the general public, but also in local politics and in local business enterprises. They qualify, network and mobilize people who work for global justice, for ecological justice, for ecological sustainability, for decolonization and for democracy. 4 full-time equivalents were requested for Bremen.
Donor Agency: City State of Bremen

Long Description: The coordination group Fair Week Bremen participates in the annual nationwide Fair Week with various activities to bring the topic of fair trade even more to the Bremen public. For the Fair Week 2020 the (nationwide) motto is Fair instead of more - # Fair trade for a good life. The overarching project goal is to make fair trade - its goals, products and the way they work in Bremen - even better known and to lobby the topic of transparent supply chains and a supply chain law.
Donor Agency: City State of Bremen

Long Description: Berlin is a Blue Community. With the project  Resource equity now! water for everyone!  we want to bring life to commitment. By looking at water through the lense of ressource equity, the project outlines the cross-connections between water and other sustainability goals. This results the following pairs of themes which will be addressed - climate crisis and water, (rain) forests and water, agroecology and water, buen vivir and water. The active reference to solution approaches from living environments in the Global South will raise the awareness of the public and target groups will learn courses of action for an equal and peaceful use of water as a ressource. In this way, the project contributes to global ressource justice and the achievement of the global Sustainability agenda.
Donor Agency: City State of Berlin

Long Description: Strengthening of development policy awareness in compliance with the development guidelines of the State of Bremen
Donor Agency: City State of Bremen

Long Description: The donation supports the realisation of projects and activities with developing countries and promotion of fairtrade labels in the town of Neuss. The city administration of Neuss and Neuss marketing use respectively sell fairtrade products like  Neuss-Café .
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Implementing Development Policy as a Cross-Section  is an educational program for the city of Berlin and its development policy associations, it is also aimed at multipliers (especially teachers and educators) and decision-makers in Berlin politics and administration. The political field of development policy is becoming increasingly important at the Berlin state level and is backed up by measures such as political resolutions and motions. It is also of great importance for Berlin's urban society, as shown by two representative opinion polls commissioned by BER on the topics of global learning and fair trade, as well as movements in Berlin (sustainable small businesses, start-up scene, collective enterprises, Fridays for Future, etc.).The educational program aims to reflect on Berlin discourses in terms of development policy, to sensitize target groups to the impact of Berlin's actions on the Global South, especially in the areas of global learning, decolonization and climate justice, and to strengthen competencies of NGOs so that their development education work becomes more effective. The program is a pool of 9 measures with activities that build on the work of BER in recent years. In its implementation, BER builds on its expertise and experience and cooperates with civil society partners and Berlin's education and business administration.
Donor Agency: City State of Berlin

Long Description: Module objective - The national system of Quality Infrastructure is strengthened for the demand of services in the area of energy efficiency. Core problem - Many of the voluntary and mandatory energy efficiency standards cannot be tested in the country because the relevant testing services are not available. Due to the insufficient testing of the quality of products with reference to established standards it is impossible to test and label whether products imported or produced in Ecuador comply with national standards. Thus, products of higher quality, which are more efficient but may be more expensive to purchase, are unable to compete against cheap products.Target groups - The target group are consumers of energy, especially private households, and users of quality infrastructure services in the area of energy efficiency, especially small and medium-sized enterprises. National manufacturers of electrical household appliances also benefit from the services, as they can make use of improved services for conformity assessment in the field of energy efficiency. The national institutions of the quality infrastructure, in particular the National Metrology Institute INEN, calibration and testing laboratories, the accreditation body SAE and conformity assessment bodies serve as intermediaries.Methodological approach (including instruments) - The methodological approach consists of the project coordination in Braunschweig and the assignment of an intermittent short-term expert with international expertise in the field of quality infrastructure for energy efficiency. Additional short-term experts will be contracted for special topics. If the technical expertise allows it, experts from the region are given preference to implement workshops and trainings in order to promote skills in the region. Key outputs - The project works in four outputs - 1) Conformity assessment, 2) metrology (focussing on luxmeters, temperature, humidity), 3) cooperation within the system, and 4) sensibilization of consumers and political stakeholders.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The rapid growth in African cities leads to traffic jams and uncontrolled urban sprawl - and the consequences are rising greenhouse gas emissions, air pollution, urban poverty and climate vulnerability. The project helps to avoid this and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the transport sector at the same time by supporting public & non-motorised transport and urban planning in the target countries. It also supports the implementation of high-quality public transport systems in Nairobi, Kigali and Kampala and the expansion of the existing bus rapid transport system in Dar es Salaam. The integration of public transport with cycling and walking is being improved and urban development along transport corridors addressed. The project also promotes policy frameworks at urban and national levels, accelerating changes in the transport sector through quality standards, improved financing and other policy measures.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Poaching, as well as the unsustainable use of wildlife meat, is a significant cause of endangerment for species protected under the Bonn Convention (UNEP/CMS). At the Conference of the Parties (CoP 13) to CMS in India in February 2020, a decision was therefore made to the Secretariat (Decision 13.109), according to which an analysis of the direct and indirect impacts of the taking (e.g. hunting), trade and consumption of wild meat (so-called bushmeat/wild meat) of terrestrial species and bird species protected under CMS is to be prepared and, on the basis of the analysis and with the involvement of other international institutions, the issue of the unsustainable taking of wild meat from the wild is to be addressed more strongly at international level. In addition, there is also an interest in the implementation of the decision related to the  pandemic.As the example of the animal market in Wuhan has shown, markets where wild meat is traded can be a central cause for the spread of human pathogenic viruses - so-called corona viruses. Trade control and regulation of wild meat use therefore also has a preventive aspect in avoiding zoonotic diseases. In view of the current corona pandemic and its history, this study not only contributes to species conservation, but also contributes to a better understanding and awareness of zoonoses.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: In accordance with the resolution passed by the German Bundestag on February 20, 2002, the aim of the RES program is to represent the performance of German climate-friendly energy technologies abroad by setting up demonstration and reference plants and to contribute to local value creation. The public presentation of the reference projects and the demonstration that climate-friendly energy technologies can be used locally at economic conditions is a very important part of the program. Most important is the commitment of the German companies to train local partners on technology and maintenance as well as on the possible applications of the projects. Examples - Product training, training for future service providers (e.g. installation and maintenance), for customers and operators (operation management, plant monitoring, maintenance), training of the general public (e.g. importance of renewable energies, climate protection, etc.).The on-site services covered by the program (such as training, education with the aim of using local labor) directly benefit the respective countries. Accordingly, the ODA-eligible share of the RES was determined to be 25% and is listed here.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy

Long Description: The intent of the project is to train 30 teachers of the MISRAK General TVET Polytechnic College in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia in up to five vocational fields and in competency analysis, as well as train at least ten teachers in job placement, so that eventually 500 students can receive vocational training.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Bavaria

Long Description: The project aims to develop a solar cooling-drying system for fish. The project will introduce a containerised, stand-alone solar technology package consisting of a hundred percent off-grid cooling and drying system among mariculture farmers. Mariculture is becoming increasingly important in Kenya as natural fish stocks (e.g. tilapia in Lake Victoria) shrink. Farmers on the coast of Kenya currently produce Milkfish (Chanos chanos Forskal) in ponds. Fishermen also harvest a local sardine called Kimarawali (Stolephorus delecatulus) along the banks of rivers in the Kwale and Kilifi counties. The seasonal nature of fishing yields and the lack of suitable processing technologies force fishermen to sell their products as long as they are fresh - often below price. Unsuitable processing and handling technologies also deny access to high-end markets. The German and Kenyan partners develop a technology package to process and add value to Milkfish and Kimarawali.The technology will include the latest advances in photovoltaics (PV), phase change materials (PCM) and modelling technologies. For cooling technology, PCM cold storages or use of electrical battery, or a combination, will be optimised to guarantee stable and reliable cooling operations. Drying will be coupled to the cooling system and heat remissions will be used to supplement drying. For the production of high-quality dried fish (first-class nutritional value, texture and taste), dehydration takes place through optimised temperature and humidity control. The fishermen are trained in processing and quality assurance. Fraunhofer Institute for Solar Energy Systems ISE (Fraunhofer ISE) and Innotech cooperate with the Kenyan Industrial Research and Development Institute (KIRDI), the Kenya Marine and Fisheries Research Institute (KMFRI) and the Mombasa  of Technology (TUM) to design, develop and transfer the proposed technology package.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: Collaborative project - EVAR - coastal upwelling areas. The Benguela upwelling system under climate change, sub-project - Variations in upwelling intensity and in the sedimentation regime in the Benguela upwelling system during the Holocene and late Pleistocene periods - Viable technologies to protect resources (water, IWRM, land, forests, settlements) and eco-technologies in the developing country
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: Thermo-chemical conversion of silica-rich biomass residues for the production of heat and power, and the combined generation of mesoporous biogenic silica for material application (A+BiOx). The project proposal will establish a close scientific cooperation between DBFZ (Deutsches Biomasseforschungszentrum) and Stellenbosch  in order to investigate the efficient use of silica-rich agricultural residues in South Africa for bioenergy and material applications. It focusses on the chemical pretreatment of biomass residues from food production and its combustion and gasification characteristics for combined heat and power production. Furthermore, material use of the biogenic silica is considered. The comprehensive, innovative approach addresses aspects of climate change, efficiency and sustainability of agricultural production, soil degradation and new transformation processes of the agricultural production.Therefore, the proposal is highly relevant as an initial step for the effient use of agricultural resources but also for DBFZ as it allows enhancing one of the core research topics with essential input.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: The Project Humboldt Digital (ProHD) addresses itself as an interdisciplinary and intercultural pioneering project to a new generation of Cuban and German scientists who, with the help of digital humanities technologies and methods want to preserve, develop and explore the written cultural heritage of Cuba. It serves to build permanent local structures at the Havana site for the conduct of digital heritage research with a particular emphasis on 18th and 19th century Cuban literacy, e.g. from the estate of Alexander von Humboldt.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The annual interdisciplinary conference on research in tropical and subtropical agriculture, natural resource management and rural development (TROPENTAG) is jointly organised by the universities of Berlin, Bonn, Göttingen, Hohenheim, Kassel-Witzenhausen, Hamburg, ZALF e. V. (Leibniz Centre for Agricultural Landscape Research), ETH Zurich (Switzerland), Czech  of Life Sciences Prague (Czech Republic), BOKU Vienna (Austria) ( of Natural Resources and Life Sciences) and the Council for Tropical and Subtropical Research (ATSAF e. V.) in co-operation with the GIZ Advisory Service on Agricultural Research for Development (BEAF).The Tropical Day has become the most important international conference on development-oriented research in the fields of food security, natural resource management and rural development in central Europe and provides a unique platform for scientific and personal exchange for students, junior and senior scientists, development experts and funding organisations from several countries together with their international partner institutions. The Tropical Day is held annually at different host sites. Tropical Day 2020 took place as a virtuel conference. 2020 theme was  Food and nutrition security and ist resilience to global crisis .
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: The total livestock populations within Uganda and Kenya affected/threatened by Brucellosis are estimated at 30.4 million cattle, 42.3 million goats, 21.1 million sheep and 5.3 million pigs, most of which are kept by resource poor farmers. These livestock are pivotal resource providing food security, promoting livelihoods, accounting for 20 to 30% of gross domestic product, and employ about 70 to 80% of the population.Main objectives 1. Develop capacity at College of Veterinary Medicine, Animal Resources and BioSecurity (CoVAB), Makerere , and Faculty of Veterinary Medicine,  of Nairobi (UONBI) for diagnostic and typing of Brucella spp. 2. Build capacity and train local field veterinarians, local doctors and laboratory technicians to diagnose, detect and conduct surveillance of brucellosis using applied diagnostics. 3. Main Target of the German Contribution - (i) Isolation, characterization and genotyping of Brucella outbreak strains infecting wildlife, domestic ruminants and humans, (ii) determination of temporal and regional distribution of genotypes, (iii) determination of sources and routes of spread of infections.4. Prevention by conjunctival vaccination Questions to be dealt with  1) What is the status of brucellosis in various livestock reared in the E. African regions? ,  2) Correlation between outbreaks in Animals and humans. ,  3) What Brucella biovars/genotypes are involved in the causation of brucellosis in livestock and humans? ,  4) Efficacy of conjunctival vaccination ,  5) What infrastructural/human capacities are needed for sustainable brucellosis management? ,  6) Education of people on Brucellosis, Hygiene and infection risks - how to close the gaps? .
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: Goal of the project is the support of the culture community that has been directly affected by the devastating explosions in the Beirut Harbour on August 4, 2020. AFAC has already identified numerous culture institutions as well as individual artists and creative workers that became victims of the catastrophe. In the frame of the project, it is planned to give grants to up to 24 culture institutions amounting to 20,000 $ in average and to up to 123 individuals amounting to 3,000 $ in average for the restoring of the (material) basis such as office rooms and equipment in order to resume work. Moreover, AFAC collects data of the parties concerned and coordinates the work of aid initiatives for the culture community in Beirut.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of the Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbas, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. The medical institutions in the Ukraine are very poorly equipped. Even in big cities hospitals often do not have modern equipment and technologies. In the maternity hospital number 3 in Saporizhzhia more than 1,500 women give birth every year. More than 20% of them by cesarean section. The maternity hospital number 3, like many other hospitals in Ukraine, uses outdated equipment produced in the 1980s. The project makes it possible to buy two modern surgical tables and one surgical lamp, which will improve the quality of operational services
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The economic participation of the population, especially vulnerable groups, by the Sea of Azov, Ukraine, has improved.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of the Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbas, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. The COVID-19 pandemic aggravated the situation in the Donbas. Despite the lack of equipment, the Starobilsk hospital has become one of the most important hospitals for the treatment of COVID patients in the Luhansk region. But the hospital's capabilities allow treating only 30 patients at the same time. And the beds used were produced more than 40 years ago. Thanks to the project 15 additional beds and other medical equipment (4 medical monitors, 3 electrocardiographs) have been purchased, which significantly improve the treatment conditions in the hospital.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of the Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. The COVID-19 pandemic aggravated situation in the region. The Region AIDS center in Slavyansk was opened in 2016. The previous regional AIDS center was located in Donetsk (non-government controlled area). Despite the lack of equipment, the center has become one of the most important testing centers for COVID-19 in the Donetsk region. The center's capabilities allow 30-50 tests per shift, but the actual need is up to 300 per shift. Thanks to the project additional laboratory equipment has been purchased in order to cover this difference. This equipment will also be used for AIDS tests in the future.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Continuation and further development of the promotion and multiplication of inter-farm agricultural mechanisation according to the concept of the Bavarian machinery rings for Senegal with two digitalised MR offices and their staff from 14.12.2018 to 31.12.2020. The sustainable, smooth and fair use as well as the accounting of the old and new acquired machinery are core tasks in this project step. Establishment and sustainable continuation of two model machine rings (MR). This also includes advice and training of the partners in Kolda and Thiés by German experts as well as the additional acquisition of funding for adapted mechanisation in the machine rings on site by the project manager and his network.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Bavaria

Long Description: Third party monitoring services will be provided for the National Programme on the Treatment and Handling of Disengaged Combatants to help strengthen the programme's knowledge base and contribute to a consistent approach to rehabilitation and reintegration in Somalia. This will take place through quarterly monitoring visits to the rehabilitation centres in Baidoa, Kismayo and Mogadishu.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Finance

Long Description: Establishment of a community tree nursery in Kiel\'s partner region Moshi District in Tanzania
Donor Agency: Federal State of Schleswig-Holstein

Long Description: The project aims at protecting the banks of the Niger river in the region Koulikoro in Mali from erosion and comprises.
