Long Description: Emergency assistance for those affected by Hurricane ETA in Santa Bárbara a) Providing 800 families twice with basic food, b) Purchase of seeds and simple agricultural implements that enable the rebuilding of family and cooperative structures, c) Buying corrugated iron for particularly badly affected families, d) purchase of stone basins for water storage, e) Emergency psychological care measures for families and school children
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Panama Red Cross looks after the children's home in Panama City, where around 25-30 children aged 0-4 are accommodated and cared for at the same time. The children come from socially poor and neglected families from the panam. Authorities to the children's home for care and nursing and partly to be given up for adoption. The children's home urgently needs a new roof to prevent water damage and to ensure good hygienic conditions.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The purchase of a fibro-naso-pharyngoscope for the Alberto Cavalcanti hospital in the city of Belo Horizonte in Minas Gerais supports the examination and treatment of cancer patients from poor backgrounds in the state of Minas Gerais. Cancer patients are often immunocompromised and therefore belong to the risk group that is especially vulnerable to Covid-19. With the help of the equipment, the patients can be examined on site, thus receiving much faster their urgently needed diagnoses and treatment options.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The purchase of a Video-Colonoscope for the Mario Kroeff Hospital in the city Rio de Janeiro supports the examination and treatment of cancer patients from poor backgrounds. Cancer patients are often immunocompromised and therefore belong to the risk group that is especially vulnerable to Covid-19. With the help of the equipment, the patients can be examined on site, thus receiving much faster their urgently needed diagnoses and treatment options.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Improved medical care for CoVid patients with cancer in the hospital INEN (Instituto Nacional de Enfermedades Neoplásicas) in Lima
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Purchase of masks, protective equipment and information material for the Gyumri medical center to prevent and combat Covid-19
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The current COVID-19 situation has a strong negative impact on the vulnerable population groups in the remote regions of Kyrgyzstan. The village communities Ak-Suu, Tup and the city of Karakol are about 350-400 km away from the capital Bishkek. The corona virus cases were officially reported in all of these locations in April 2020. Accordingly, several security measures have been taken by the government, including the introduction of a state of emergency in several parts of the country. The introduction of the state of emergency in the country blocked almost all business activities and resulted in many people losing their income. Those who were employed in the low-wage sector are particularly affected. At the same time, the government, with the support of international donors and the private sector, took measures to supply the vulnerable population groups with the most important foods.These measures have been criticized in part because of their lack of transparency and delays. In this context, there is a great need among women, disabled people and children in the above-mentioned places for drugstore items that they cannot currently afford due to the lack of sources of income. The supply of personal care items reduces the risk of infection for various diseases, including the corona virus.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: As part of the implementation of economic reforms, local economic development in regions of Uzbekistan with a focus on Karakalpakstan, Fergana, Namangan and Andijan has been strengthened.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The main goal of the project is to support the Iraqi health system in the care of Covid19 patients and to create additional basic infrastructure for this purpose. To achieve this, up to five temporary prefabricated hospitals with 100 beds each, including 40 intensive care beds, are to be built and equipped. The locations identified are Baghdad, Mosul, Basra and Sulaimaniya as well as Anbar (BMZ preference) or Najaf. Each hospital is expected to be able to treat 1,800 patients (total number of patients 9,000).
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Deployment of a rapid rescue unit abroad as part of the EU civil protection procedure after the explosion in Beirut
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The global project makes a contribution to the international goals, up to the year 2020 to halve deforestation and end the destruction of natural forests by 2030 and to restore 350 million hectares of deforested and damaged forest landscapes. These are set out in Agenda 2030 (in particular SDG 15), the New York Forest Protection Declaration (New York Declaration on Forests, NYDF), the Bonn Challenge and the Parisian climate agreement correspond to the strategic objectives and plans of the Rio Conventions and the United Nations Forum on Forests.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The promotional loan shall be used to increase the power transmission capacity between Kampala and Entebbe to secure a reliable electricity supply in Entebbe.
Donor Agency: Kreditanstalt für Wiederaufbau

Long Description: Purchase of face masks, desinfection material, protective gloves and clinical thermometers for a social institution in Elbasan/Albania, which runs an orphanage and a kindergarten. The institution is not in the position to purchase these goods out of its own budget. It is important that children and staff maintain their health and that the institution fulfils the hygienic standards in times of Covid19.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project will provide combined food and hygiene packages for those most affected by the pandemic mainly in the northern communities of Plevlja, Berane, Petnica, Bijelo Polje, Rozaje, Andrijevica , Plav, Gusinje, and Niksic. Number of Parcels Food/Hygiene 1.100 In addition, the project will provide packages of primary school materials for primary school students (Roma and Egyptians and those from socially disadvantaged families). The school materials will be distributed through the Roma CSO network we work with and with the help of RE mediators. The focus is on students in grades 1-6 in the municipalities of Niksic, Berane, Bijelo Polje, Podgorica, Tivat, Budva, Ulcinj, Cetinje and Bar. School Material Parcels - 800
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Construction of adequate building and hygiene standards concerning the windows of the children's ambulatory in the municipal hospital in Malyn, Shytomyr oblast.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Strengthening the resilience of the communities and the local health system in Donetsk and Luhansk Oblast (GCA) through improved availability and access to high-quality multidisciplinary basic health services (including SRH and MHPSS) for the population affected by the conflict, with special attention to particularly vulnerable population groups.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: MeetDocs is a documentary film festival in Kharkiv (to be held in October) which focuses on the living realities in Eastern Ukraine. Apart from that, workshops and open master classes will be held in order to stimulate the national and transborder exchange among the participants. Furthermore, the project's aim is to strenthen the festival's meaning as a cultural institution in the region.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of the Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbas, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. The COVID-19 pandemic aggravated situation in the region. Mechnikov hospital has become one of the most important hospitals for the treatment of COVID-19 patients in the city of Dnipro and the Dnipropetrovsk region. According to the hospital, the capacity load is already 200%. At the same time the hospital laboratory is one of the 3 state testing centers for COVID-19 in the Dnipropetrovsk region. Today the laboratory's capabilities allow 2000 tests per shift. Thanks to the project 2 additional centrifuges will be purchased in order to increase the tests amount up to 6000 per shift.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Emergency investigations and humanitarian mine and ordnance clearance in the south of Tripoli, Libya
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Project for the journalistic training of young people from socially disadvantaged districts of the city of Tunis. Expansion of the association's media platform to enable the political participation of otherwise underrepresented social classes in the media
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Creation of a women's group for agricultural developpement in Kebili with the aim to tackle the problem of silting and desertifictation as well as to secure the food autonomy of the related families. A work place will be set up and equpped for the group.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Financing of procurement of protective materials for medical and paramedical staff of the public hospital Charles Nicolle in Tunis as well as training of the hospital staff regarding hygienic technics in the fight against Coronavirus.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Equipping the regional hospital of Kef, as well as the local hospitals in Sers, Tajerouine and Dahmani with protection material
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Installation of a Fab Labs in the Co-working space in Médenine, production of 400 in the 3D printing process and handover to medical staff in the Médenine governorate. Procurement of medical protective equipment for the Medenine hospital.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Emergency Shelter Support, Counselling, Target group - Strengthening of social rights of LGBTI Community in BWA (Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Intersex)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Willich/Zogoree- Working for a better future
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Fight against poverty and hunger through vegetable cultivation in the province of Kayanza/ Burundi.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Between July 2020 and December 2021, a 5-hectare area near the capital Gitega will be transformed according to permaculture principles. Permaculture is a sustainable and alternative concept for agriculture and horticulture based on observing and imitating natural ecosystems and cycles of nature. Core element of the Project will be the  AgriSocial Education and Training Centre , where multipliers such as teachers as well as farmers, students and, based on the principal of inclusion, disadvantaged persons will be educated and trained. Project objective - Establishment of a sustainable and self-supporting institution to teach various approaches of sustainable agriculture and healthy nutrition for physically and mentally handicapped as well as socially disadvantaged children, youth and women and all those interested in agriculture in the sense of  help for self-help .
Donor Agency: Federal State of Baden-Württemberg

Long Description: In order to improve the hygienic situation of about 135 marginalized children and adolescents as well as 35 refugee families of the orphanage HOTPEC (Lower Bokova near the city of Buea in the southwest region of Cameroon) up to 16 toilets and 14 showers will be installed. The required hot water will be produced by extending an existing photovoltaic system with a micro hydroelectric power plant. An energy management system will control the various components. In order to improve the food supply, some of the existing fish ponds will be extended to breed freshwater fish. The cooling of the fish will be ensured by refrigerators integrated into the energy system.Improvement of the hygienic conditions for the children and employees of the orphanage HOTPEC (Cameroon) by installing toilets and washing facilities with hot and cold water, provided by the use of renewable energy. As well as improvement of the food supply by extension of the existing fish ponds and appropriate cooling of fish, also provided by renewable energy.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Bavaria

Long Description: Support for elderly people affected by Covid-19, single parents and other needy people in Malabo with food aid
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: With this project, NRC aims to support the Ethiopian  Emergency Response Unit in preventing and fighting the Covid-19 pandemic. Essential ES/NFI kits will be provided from which 2,725 beneficiaries in the  Quarantine / Isolation / Case Management Unit in Addis Ababa and other regional case management units can benefit depending on the extent of the pandemic. The ES/NFI kits include 1 blanket, 1 sheet, 1 cup, 1 plate, 1 towel, 2 soaps, clothes, flip flops. Long-term objective/impact of the project - Rapid provision of life-saving NFI items to combat Covid-19 and its spread through a well-coordinated, effective and flexible response. Project objective (outcome) - Cooperation with Ethiopian health actors has improved access to health services for people affected by displacement. Immediate outcome (output) - Health facilities and quarantine stations are equipped with ES/NFI.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Bavaria

Long Description: Purchase of - 500 Re-Usable Face Masks, 500 Units Hand Sanitizer, 10 Thermometer, 50 Packages of Paper Tissue, 30 Victoria Buckets, 300 Face Shields - for the following places Breman Kuntanase, Ewusiem, Abehenase and Akurakese all in the Asikuma odoben brakwa district in Bono Region and Maranatha JHS, Sege Community JHS both in Ada.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Production and then supply of protection masks to the slum dwellers of Bissau
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Improvement of treatment options of COVID-19 patients in the rural surroundings of Lilongwe. Even in times when there is no pandemic, the health system in Malawi is not capable of dealing with all patients or diseases. This treatment centre by a private initiative will provide options for poorer patients and can help mitigate the pandemic.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Fighting the spread of COVID-19 in the Northern Region of Malawi by funding handwashing materials for local markets as well as sewing machines which will be used to produce community face masks for distribution to the population in Rumphi.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Covid-19 pandemic is particularly affecting the Kamubukwana district of Maputo, as this is the most populous but also one of the poorest districts in Maputo, with the main road including the bus transfer station to the north. In addition, the district is also home to the largest market in the country, which further increases the risk of infection. Through the distribution of food and hygiene kits, as well as practical training for the production of vegetables, the project aims to alleviate the precarious situation of vulnerable populations in terms of food insecurity and risk of infection in Kamubukwana.
Donor Agency: City State of Berlin

Long Description: The project presented here is based on an exploratory study of the extent of salinization in the peri-urban vegetable growing areas of Maputo. The main objective of the project is to make the existing fund of theoretical knowledge on the nexus  soil salinization and vegetable growing  tangible and to transfer it into practice. Practical (agronomic) salt management strategies, adapted to the structures of smallholder vegetable growing systems, are to be identified.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Hesse

Long Description: Provision of food parcels to families in particularly need in the municipalities of Witvlei, Gobabis and Okahandja.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Contribution to improving the socio-economic opportunities of the refugee, displaced and host communities in the Tilia department, in the north of the Tahoua region, Niger.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: People with disabilities are particularly disadvantaged in Nigerien society. In most cases, demand-oriented education and vocational training is not possible due to the lack of specialised training facilities. The project aims to improve the educational opportunities for blind children in Niamey. The provision of special learning materials improves their learning conditions and gives them the opportunity to receive a better basic education that meets their needs. The project will enable the purchase of braille machines for the production of Braille documents, a printer for printing Braille documents and the corresponding printer paper.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project is being implemented in a peripheral residential area of the capital Niamey. Women and girls occupy a disadvantaged position in Nigerien society. In most cases they are economically and socially dependent on their fathers or husbands. At the same time, most Nigerien households are extremely low-income and thus less resilient to external shocks. The project aims to purchase basic products (raw materials) for the production of cosmetics, as well as simple machines and equipment for their manufacture. In addition, training and further education of the members of the women's cooperative in the context of processing techniques for the production of cosmetic products will be provided, as well as organizational strengthening of the cooperative, especially with regard to central entrepreneurial skills (e.g. financial management, sales strategies, etc.).
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The awareness of the targeted population in Niamey and Maradi for the dangers of COVID-19 is increased and the understanding of possibilities for protection against infection and spread is improved. In addition, the provision of hygiene materials in selected medical facilities in Niamey and Maradi has been improved. Communication material on COVID-19 will be produced and distributed (flyers, posters, radio broadcasts, etc.), and gloves, face masks, disinfectants and hand washing equipment will be made available to six medical facilities (including mother-child centres) in Niamey and Maradi. Ten other local health stations in Maradi also receive smaller amounts of material donations.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Covid-19-Humanitarian assistance for Malian refugees, internally displaced persons and host communities in Tahoua, in the areas of CASH, WASH and food security and Covid-19 prevention activities
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Internally displaced youth in Garowe, Baidoa and Mogadishu have improved income opportunities and social participation
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Emergency feeding scheme to sustain poor population in need in the townships of Cape Town during lockdown (Covid 19 restrictions)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The townships and poor informal settlements in Cape Town harbour the danger that basic care for children - especially the protection from illnesses such as HIV, tuberculosis, and pneumonia - is not provided. As health care systems reach their capacity, newborns and children may lose their lives due to preventable causes. HOPE CAPE TOWN works with the ministry for health, the Tygerberg Hospital und municipal health facilities to maintain live-saving health services for mothers, newborns, and children. This means that pressing needs that resulted from the COVID-19 pandemic will be continuously met while still performing critical interventions in regards to health, upbringing, and social aspects. This ensures the survival and prosperity of children. Thus, this project aims to strengthen health care systems in the long term under consideration of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Saxony

Long Description: Goal of the project is to enable 25 persons with disabilities in the South Sudanese capital Juba, who would otherwise have to depend on begging and handouts, to start and set up small scale businesses for immediate self-employment with skills and knowledge acquired during the 5 months lasting project, thus enabling them to generate their own income to sustain their living. Participants will receive a business start-up kit, mentors will supervise and guide during the initial phase. Parts of the generated income will collected in a cooperative saving-fund that will be source for loans and financial aid in times with lower income. Objective is to enable 75% of the participants to build up a solid base of sustainable income.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Construction of an allotment garden as expansion of an already existing Urban Gardens-project in Mbabane and construction of 15 satellite gardens in and around Mbabane. People shall be trained to plant and grow their own fruit and vegetables in a sustainable way. The aim is food security and climate adaption.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to contribute to the creation and promotion of a framework for dialogue and consultation between the public and socio-economic and political stakeholders in Zanzibar in the run-up to the regional elections in late October 2020. This should create an atmosphere conducive to dialogue between the communities and the consolidation of peace in the country. This development of a strong and sustainable peace-building infrastructure will help to prevent electoral violence/conflict and thus strengthen conflict prevention and maintenance of peace in Zanzibar.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Constrution of well and irrigation system in the Bagamoyo region which is suurounded by monocultures. The aim is to build a polyculture of various fruits and to train and offer sustainable agriculture to underprivileged young people from Ukonga region.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Main aim of the project is to improve living conditions for small scale famers and their families in surrounding villages near Gulu by introduction of oxen teams. This will reduce the workload for women who do most of the agricultural work and enable them to cultivate more land and broaden their economic perspectives.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Improved access to water for 1000 people and improve the sanitation and hygiene by construction of 5 water points and 50 hand wash facilities in Mutunda Sub-county. Improve sanitation and hygiene in 20 hospitals / Health Care Centres and protection for health staff by provision of personal protective equipment. Overarching objective is to contain the Covid-19 pandemic in Masindi and Kiryandongo District.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Rising Star Primary School is a project of the NGO Vision&Hope and Ingenieure ohne Grenzen. Hopley is one of the poorest suburbs of Harare and lacks infrastructure. The school is far too small with over 600 pupils. New classrooms improve the learning conditions for the children and give them a better start in life.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Advancement of Design as part of Creative Industries between Germany, East- and West-Africa. (Lagos, Addis Abeba, Munich), Installation of Platforms and Networks in order to promote exchange of knowledge and establishing new common knowledge.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Advancement of Design as part of Creative Industries between Germany, East- and West-Africa. (Lagos, Addis Abeba, Munich), Installation of Platforms and Networks in order to promote exchange of knowledge and establishing new common knowledge.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Provision of a nutritious family bag and hygiene kits to 165 families in the municipality of San Juan Chamelco, Alta Verapaz. In addition to the precarious state of poverty, the community of San Juan Chamelco in Alta Verapaz is also affected by the effects of tropical storm Eta, so there is an increased risk of COVID-19.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Community Training Center  San Juan Diego  will be available to the inhabitants of 9 districts of the city  Somoto  and two surrounding rural areas with a population of at least 10,000, mostly young people. The hall will be built on the ground of the parish, specific as the 2nd floor above the parish rooms. It will be used as a training and meeting place for the approximately 1,200 young people to promote social and Christian values, to protect young people from entering gangs and to reduce migration to Managua and abroad. In addition, the center will also become a meeting point for the needy population of this area.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Construction of a water supply system for 35 families in the rural area los Cordoba, district San Rafael del Sur.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Der Verein  Aguas Bravas Nicaragua  arbeitet seit Jahren erfolgreich in der Betreuung und Beratung von Frauen, die in ihrer Kindheit sexuellen Missbracuh erlitten haben. Die Räumlichkeiten des Betreuungszentrums in Managua sollen um einen 2.Stock erweitert werden, um der gestiegenen Nachfrage Rechnung zu tragen. Damit soll eine adäqute Betreuung der Frauen garaniert und die Arbeitsbedingungen der Fachkräfte verbessert werden.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This project is primarily aimed for Nicaraguan Red Cross staff volunteers and helpers who have been involved in the transfer of suspected and confirmed patients with Covid 19 and other diseases in the country since March 2020. For all of them, it is a particularly challenging time, which is associated with additional stress at various levels. This action will help to reduce the risk of infection for the active Nicaraguan Red Cross staff and improve working conditions during the mission.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Coronavirus protective suits for the fire brigade and gravediggers of the Alcaldía in León. Purchase in Hamburg since out of stock locally, shipping to Nicaragua
Donor Agency: City State of Hamburg

Long Description: The co-operative  COMHORSA RL  will distribute food+hygiene packages to 232 families of their members in San Juan del Rio Coco. This will secure basic nutrition in times of economic distress and support the recipients in their efforts to prevent COVID infection.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: A photovoltaic system is to be built in the Guarani village of Yaboty Miri, which will provide a needs-based off-grid power supply. The project is part of the larger project  Construction of a primary school with sanitary facilities and the establishment of a hygienic drinking water supply . The components of the system are purchased from SOLARTEX in Buenos Aires. A tool shed will be built at the project site to accommodate the electronic controls and batteries. The site of the facility is protected by a fence.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Saarland

Long Description: Purchase of food and seeds to restore production capacity and food security to 899 families in 24 communities in the municipality of San Ignacio de Velasco
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Strengthen care and prevention measures that promote the protection and defense of the dignity and human rights of older adults in light of the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on the San Ramon nursing home
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: disinfection of the streets of the city of Tarija, purchase of above mentioned materials
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Medical oxygen is on the World Health Organization's list of essential drugs. In this context, it has been categorically proven that the use of oxygen concentrators is a practicable and cost-effective strategy for the administration of oxygen therapy, especially when the oxygen bottles cannot be permanently supplied, as is currently the case in La Paz and Bolivia. Oxygen therapy is an effective intervention to lower the death rate of patients with Covid-19. Therefore, the project aims to provide the isolation center created by GAMLP with 31 oxygen concentrators in order to relieve the health system. Seriously ill patients can be treated in the hospitals, while the lighter cases, which also require oxygen therapy, can be treated in the isolation center thus increasing the patient's chances of recovery.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to set up the Critical Patient Assistance Center of Covid 19 in pfm srl, La Paz, Bolivia, with coordinators at departmental level to provide an immediate response to the shortage of health workers to deal with this crisis, with the aim of organizing a 24/7 system of specialists and nurses. The project also aims to provide online training to doctors, laboratory technicians and nurses in critical areas, particularly in Beni, so that they can meet the enormous needs of patients. In addition to the traditional training, experts will be organised to answer questions and advise the doctors. It is also planned to acquire software for the collection, processing and management of data and the monitoring of patients in a network. In particular, the aim is to document data in order to centralise and store good epidemiological practices and general knowledge so that future system improvements can be made.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Addressing the basic needs of the poorest population groups in times of COVID-19 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Emergency assistance in the areas of basic health care, protection and hygiene to protect indigenous people from COVID-19 in the urban and rural areas of Manaus.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Addressing the basic needs of the poorest population groups in times of COVID-19 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Responding to selective population emergencies and addressing the basic needs of the poorest population groups in times of COVID-19 in Ceilândia (Brasília)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Responding to selective population emergencies and addressing the basic needs of the poorest population groups in times of COVID-19 in Sol Nascente (Brasília)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Addressing the basic needs of the poorest population groups in times of COVID-19 Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In the partner city of Cajamarca, the already existing vulnerabilities (severe to extreme poverty, poor schooling, illiteracy, unstable employment, malnutrition, domestic violence, no health insurance) are dramatically increased by the risk of corona infection and illness as well as by loss of income. These vulnerable people are children and young people from poor families, women lacking job security and senior people of rural areas. Lack of knowledge about the basic hygiene and health requirements for the prevention of corona infection - such as regular hand washing, correct use of protective masks and maintaining the distance or their incorrect application- lead to an increase in the risk of infection and the number of infected people, even in direct and indirect environment of member organisations in the partner cities.The following measures should counteract these impacts - A) Health awareness and education activities, B) production of mouth and nose protection, C) setting up vegetable gardens and organic cultivation of root crop and other vegetables.
Donor Agency: City State of Berlin

Long Description: The project aims to provide medical care for Covid patients in the Loreto region at the Micro-Red Bretaña care station.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Improvement of the intensive medical care of persons with CoVid in Lima
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Due to the COVID-19 nationwide lockdown since 13th of November 2020, the need to respond to support the most vulnerable parts of society is increasing rapidly. PIN Mongolia, with support from the German Embassy, aims to respond to the lockdown by assisting 1,550 students living in their dormitories, incl. a small LGBTI community in Ulaanbaatar and 300 people living with disabilities to cover their basic living needs by providing them with a food and basic essentials voucher, as well as a pharmaceutical voucher respective of their health status. The vouchers will be distributed through a selected retailer that will ensure alcohol and tobacco, will not be purchased under the programme
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Providing meals for children from underprivileged families in Mongolia. Since the end of January 2020 (until at least September 2020), schooling in Mongolia has been interrupted to prevent the spread of Covid-19 in the country. This interruption has a negative impact on the education and nutrition of many children. Many of the children from the poorest families receive an important part of their meals at school and now suffer greatly from the school closures and the resulting loss of school meals. Besides delivering necessary nutrition to the children, the aim of the project is to demonstrate to the responsible authorities in Mongolia that the supply of food to school children through their schools is essential for the adequate supply of nutrients to these children and should be continued in times of disaster. The children will be provided with nutrition, hygiene and education kits, a type of 'soup kitchen' will be established in two schools in Ulaanbaatar.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Conservation-Restoration of preserved buildings of the Phung Tien Temple site in the imperial city of Hué, Vietnam, with integrated courses and workshops on conservation of cultural heritage for students and pupils in 2020
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Gyumri is the second largest city in Armenia and very impoverished. The budget of the educational institutions is correspondingly low. The  Mankik  kindergarten does not have a sufficient heating system. In winter, the children have to keep their coats on, in some rooms small, mobile stoves are used. The installation of a heating system (sufficient for 240 square meters) will solve the problem.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Women with disabilities from Gyumri and the surrounding area will receive sewing courses, sewing machines and textiles in order to either become self-employed or to find employment in one of the region's textile companies and thus find their way back into working life and earn an income. The city administration of Gyumri is involved and will assist in the selection and later job placement of women.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The aim is to alleviate the social consequences of Covid-19 among vulnerable groups in Armenia. Food rations, hygiene articles and information flyers about the virus will be distributed to low-income earners. The target group will be selected by the NGO in cooperation with the Yerevan municipality and the Ministry of Social Affairs.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Acquisition of protective equipment for the hospital in Armavir (masks, gloves, protective clothing, disinfectants, pulse oximeter) to prevent Covid-19 infections.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The NGO Glory Bandhu-protim Samaj Kallayan Sangstha (GBSKS) has successfully established and is running 3 schools in Dhaka's slums. Most of the students' parents work in the low income sector, e.g. as rickshaw or van pullers. Because of the countrywide lockdown resulting from the current COVID-19 crisis, many of them have lost their job and are unable to provide their families with food and other essentials. The project aims to support the families of the 1,500 students in during the COVID-19 emergency situation and the lockdown through distributing packages of basic food items and soap.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Following the outbreak of COVID-19 in Bangladesh, the Bangladeshi government has announced a nationwide lockdown from 26.03.2020. Because of this lockdown, many slum inhabitants have lost their jobs and cannot feed them and their families anymore. Additionally, cyclone Amphane hit nine coastal districts in Bangladesh, Khulna included, on 20.05.2020. Hence, the project aims to support 700 families, 575 through the Embassy and 125 through the organisation Association for Development Activity of Manifold Social Work (ADAMS), in their current emergency situation due to the outbreak of COVID-19 and the consequential damages of cyclone Amphane by providing them with packages of basic food and medecine. A food package meets the needs of one family for 7 to 10 days.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Girls and women in the poorest districts in Delhi and surrounding cities know about their rights and have access to Government and other relief programmes. The numbers of inter-family sexual harassment and rapes, which have sharply increased since the COVID-19 outbreak, are reduced again.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The deepening and spreading of the corona crisis has strong negative effects and as a result is affecting the lives of vulnerable population groups. The procurement and supply of these people with the most important foods such as rice, sugar, flour, vegetable oil etc. as well as drugstore items enables timely targeted support for families with mentally handicapped children, old and handicapped people in the Ak-Ordo community near Bishkek. Ak Ordo is a very poor community that arose on the outskirts of the city without the necessary social infrastructure.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Since people in Nepal are unable to go to work and make money to make a living and make necessary purchases due to the corona crisis, some communities, especially low-income groups, desperately need help to survive. The non-governmental organization Platform for Children is handing over 500 standardized packages of food and hygiene materials to Kathmandu Metropolitan City (KMC) Ward No. 30 in Gyaneswor, Kathmandu. The KMC then distributes the packages to the needy families living in the community to support them during the corona pandemic.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Provision of food ration bags and hygiene articles to 600 vulnerable families in Hyderabad who have lost their income due to the Covid-19 related lockdown
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: 600 rations and hygiene kits for 600 families (among them widows and daily workers) in Sultan Park, Lahore, so that the beneficiaries can stay home and reduce the spread of the COVID-19.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In the context of the tri-national Heart of Borneo (HoB) Initiative the project will develop and implement a green economy model for the Kapuas Hulu district in Indonesia and Sarawak in Malaysia. Demonstrating the business case for a green economy model in the transboundary region has great potential for replication in other districts. New networks of stakeholder on policy, community and business level will be established leading to new synergies and cooperation which will increase the economic dynamics in the area without disturbing nature conservation goals. The long term establishment of a drinking water protection area can be seen as pilot model for other regions globally. The project contributes to the HoB Action Plan as endorsed by the Governments of Malaysia and Indonesia - Transboundary management, sustainable resource management, eco-tourism and capacity-building. All results and innovative approaches will be reflected in the HoB Initiative and multiplied on a broad level.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: There are plans to implement measures to mitigate the COVID19 pandemic and improve general hygiene in schools in Irbid, Jordan. More than 20% of Irbid's population are Syrian refugees, most of whom do not live in refugee camps but are integrated with the Jordanian population. Given the high numbers of refugees bringing additional students into schools, it is not surprising that Irbid Governorate has one of the highest numbers of schools with significant sanitation repair needs. The ten schools that are the subject of the requested COVID19 aid teach a large number of Syrian students who have fled to Jordan with their families.The following goals are being implemented in concrete terms - Sanitary facilities in ten schools are being improved. This includes small renovations and repairs / Reduction of the risk of infection by equipping the ten schools with basic hygiene articles / Strengthening hygiene awareness through training courses for teachers, who in turn pass on what they have learned to the students / Improvement of the income situation of Syrian refugees and socially disadvantaged Jordanians through  cash for work  measures as part of the renovation measures
Donor Agency: City State of Bremen

Long Description: Emergency support of hospitals (no further details) in the area north east Al-Euphrat and north west Aleppo
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Defence

Long Description: The overall objective of the Jerusalem Faith Equities Project is to contain the trends of religious radicalization in Jerusalem and to create pragmatic patterns of coexistence among the faith communities. The project will therefore provide decision-makers with necessary data relating to Jerusalem's holy sites, create a sophisticated data base accessible to the public (website and printed publication) and change the nature of interactions and discourse among faith communities by common events of stakeholders.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Strengthening of psychosocial support and emergency health care in Gaza and Westbank in relation to the Covid-19 crisis.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Local capacities and the resilience of the people and institutions in Aden, districts Al Mualla, Attawahi and Craiter affected by the long-lasting crisis have been strengthened.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: Against the background of the global COVID-19 pandemic and the effects that it has especially on the population of many countries in the Global South, the Senate of the Free Hanseatic City of Bremen has made additional funds available in the 2020 budget for international development cooperation. The funds will be used directly in countries in the Global South and will benefit the local population as   emergency aid . A part of these funds is available for projects of development initiatives of civil society and diaspora organizations from the state of Bremen. The projects are intended to combat pandemic, prevent health care and mitigate the consequences of the corona pandemic for the affected population and the local economy. Wherever possible, special attention should be paid to promoting and supporting women and people with disabilities.The BeN will allocate the requested funds with the involvement of a jury or a committee. Civil society actors and initiatives from Bremen that are related to countries in the Global South and already have (at least initial) experience with the successful implementation of projects should be eligible to apply. The involvement of or cooperation with local actors is imperative in order to guarantee the exchange with the local population and to achieve the most sustainable success possible.
Donor Agency: City State of Bremen

Long Description: Strengthening the capacities and resilience of smallholders, especially women and youth groups, in order to improve the nutrition and health situation for South Sudanese refugees and host communities in Adjumani (UGA) and the conflict-affected population in Marida and Ibba (SSD) by the end of the project. (LDC-Part)

Long Description: Improving the capacity to apply green port principles. Large ports in the Caspian Sea, such as the ports of Baku (Azerbaijan) and Turkmenbashi (Turkmenistan), but also neighbouring seaports, such as Aktau (Kazkahstan), expect to be able to significantly increase their trading activities. The port of Baku (Azerbaijan) was the first port in the region to commit itself to becoming a green port.

Long Description: The purpose of this project is to urgently prop, stabilise, consolidate and shelter a priority group of up this project is to urgently prop, stabilise, consolidate and shelter a priority group of up to 12 historicto 12 historic buildings that are at risk of collapse in the two urban districts of Rmeil buildings that are at risk of collapse in the two urban districts of Rmeil and Medawar, around the port. These interventions are also meant at waterproofing and Medawar, around the port. These interventions are also meant at waterproofing measures to prevent further damage from approaching autumn rains, while ensuring measures to prevent further damage from approaching autumn rains, while ensuring the reopening of the reopening of street circulation and the safety of inhabitants and passengers. street circulation and the safety of inhabitants and passengers.Based on the assessment of the damages that affected historic buildings, conducted Based on the assessment of the damages that affected historic buildings, conducted by the DGA on 31 August 2020, the subsequent study conducted by Beirut Built by the DGA on 31 August 2020, the subsequent study conducted by Beirut Built Heritage Rescue (BBHR) 2020 witHeritage Rescue (BBHR) 2020 with the support of the German Archaeological h the support of the German Archaeological Institute in Beirut (October 2020), as well as consultations held with DGA since then, Institute in Beirut (October 2020), as well as consultations held with DGA since then, five buildings have been identified in Rmeil and seven in Medawar, as follows - plot five buildings have been identified in Rmeil and seven in Medawar.

The following sub-goals contribute specifically to this (A) Contribution to the rehabilitation of the COVID-19 diagnostic unit of the CHU in Mahajanga, (B) Contribution to the establishment of SOPs for biosafety, (C) Training of laboratory staff with regard to biosafety.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Montessori School Jan Amos Comenius is located in Nueva Guinea, Nicaragua, approx. 300 km from the capital Managua. Since 2019 it has been recognized as a PASCH-School and offers children of rural population an alternative method of education. So far there is no teacher's room available for the 15 teachers. German classes are also taking place in different classrooms like common places, library, often in mixed groups. A two-story building should be built in the school. In the first floor would be the teacher's room and in the second floor the space for German lessons. Both of them can also be used for training/teaching activities and also for the storage of materials for German lessons.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The goal of the conference is to exchange views between the Brazilian institutions and companies (stakeholders) important for Minas Gerais and German institutions that can provide important input and proposals for structural change of the mining region in Minas Gerais. The initial situation is that there are currently no significant initiatives dealing with sustainable development for the Minas Gerais region, but the region is suffering from the mining-related dam collapse disasters (Rio Doce and Brumadinho) and the risks of future dam collapse disasters.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to preserve the traditional knowledge of boat building and fishing in the Afro-Colombian communities in the Tierra Bomba area of Cartagena area. In this way, on the one hand, the cultural heritage should be preserved, on the other hand, the living conditions of the communities should be improved by developing cultural initiatives. The Afro-Colombian community in Tierra Bomba is threatened by inadequate access to education and health care, as well as gentrification, which is being driven by tourism. The target group are socially disadvantaged young adults aged 18-28, especially young women.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The aim is to promote mobility and professional exchange at peer level between teachers and students. Long Description: This project delivered knowledge on renewable energies and grid integration to countries in North Africa and the Middle East. The target group was specialists in key institutions in the private and public energy sector. In the project frame, training curricula were developed and courses on wind and solar energy organized. About 140 experts participated in study tours and workshops in Germany. More than 340 participants completed webinars with a certificate. 16 exhibitions with information on grid integration in English, French and Arabic were organized in project countries. The final workshop took place in Tunis in October 2014.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Under the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, financial support was granted for the emergency aid of the implementing organization. In addition, the donation was used to procure hygiene articles and medical materials that were necessary for the organization to continue its work under pandemic conditions.

Long Description: In recent weeks, we have received a great number of inquiries requesting protective medical equipment, laboratory accessories and general auxiliary material based on the budgetary restrictions faced by many organizations at the end of the year. In detail, the requests were made by governmental and non-governmental organizations, laboratories and hospitals in Huehuetenango, Cobán, Quetzaltenango, Tecpán, Mixco and Antigua Guatemala. With the support of ??Asistencia Médica S.A., the required goods will be acquired and distributed.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Support of the Guatemalan health system and the Huehuetenango region during the current COVID-19 epidemic by providing respirators (including accessories for one month) to the Guatemalan Ministry of Health and the Huehuetenango  Hospital (request by Cardenal Ramazzini)
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Support for the population of Solentiname Island, taking into account local ownership, in Abolish non-reusable plastic products (especially plastic packaging materials, straws, bottles, containers and disposable cutlery) and introduce substitute products throughout the island by 2020. In addition to promoting environmental education, this measure should ensure the safe storage and transport of plastic waste. This action seeks to inspire others, like the associated municipality of San Carlos and other tourist centres, especially islands such as Ometepe and Corn Island.

The internet equipment should enable the theatre to reconnect with its audience and reach new audiences as well, in order to strengthen civil society.

Long Description: At the invitation of the association H.O.P.E. e.V., 20 young people from Tanzania between the ages of 14 and 35 will come to Kiel with their choir director and pastor for 16-17 days at the beginning of September. Several public concerts/events are planned in parishes, schools and other venues, accompanied by African literature. In addition to the musical embassy activities, the young people - together with their German hosts and partners - will address the issues of climate change and climate protection. With the acquisition of intercultural competence, the direct, immediate encounters open the view for global connections and local peculiarities. Prejudices and reservations in the attitude towards the supposed foreign/unknown are put into perspective. A view of global dimensions and effects such as sustainable purchasing and consumption behavior are influenced.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Schleswig-Holstein

For 60 participants in the educational program, new perspectives for the future are opened by founding their own socially oriented companies. The target groups of the project are potential entrepreneurs with social business ideas who are interested in founding companies with social impact.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The old economat of the Compagnie de Phosphat de Gafsa in Redeyef is being renovated and transformed into a cultural centre lead by young people. It will also be equipped so that it can be used as a place for artistic workshops
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Through the project, they also receive professional entrepreneurship training to enable them to become self-employed.

Long Description: The project is the Museum Night in Bishkek, which has been taking place for several years. In 2020 this event was held online due to the pandemic and had the motto - Fragile world and how can art counteract current problems (climate change, air pollution, etc.). There is an online event at which various artists are presenting their works of art and, for example, discussions on the topic.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: By upscaling its spatial and personnel capacities, the music school in Ramallah strives to enlarge its education offer and thereby meet the extensive demand for music education in the Palestine territories. Additionally, the repertoire of the school's Filasteen--Musicians Orchestra (FYMO) will be enriched and the number of concerts and workshops continuously increased to obtain more visibility and attraction for the project, also beyond Ramallah, to lay the fundament for internationally successful musicians as role models for the young generation in Palestine. Finally, young Palestinians shall be empowered through music to master their professional careers with more confidence and a strong basis of values.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The water-teaching-learning path (WLLP) invites Bremen citizens and guests into the countryside, on the trail of water. As part of a tour with thematic panels (and possibly interactive stations), visitors are informed and made aware of the resource-saving use of (drinking) water locally and globally. In addition to the local connection to Bremen, global challenges (virtual water) and examples (from the partner cities of Durban and Windhoek) are presented. Furthermore, the path shows alternative courses of action for a sustainable use of water and motivates people to participate. Visitors can experience the path independently. Outlook - The teaching-learning path could be the starting point for a variety of future projects and activities on the subject of  Sustainable use of water . Objective - Establishment of a project-specific network, development of a concept for the WLLP and coordination / Realization of the first implementation steps.
Donor Agency: City State of Bremen

Long Description: The aim of the project is hosting the international conference  Minsk Forum  in Minsk, Berlin and Warsaw. The conference focuses on regional neighbourhood between Belarus and its neighbours. The events forster EU neighbourhood policy and regional cooperations between Belarus and the EU. The project also focuses on the lastest developments in Belarus after the presidential elections.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The civil society networks in the respective countries should be expanded through media training, the production films and public discourse. In this year, the media dialogue focuses on the need to create pluralistic structures. Participants will be civil society organisations, journalists, journalism students, academics and cultural workers. During a one-week stay in Berlin, the participants will learn more about the structure of the German media system and its integration into the democratic-political system of Germany.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Together with the Brazilian project partners, suitable communities in the state of Rio Grande do Sul are to be identified. The representatives of the public administration and local companies will be trained in waste recycling and the use of renewable energies (capacity building). In Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania they will inspect the corresponding machines and systems. The project partners work together to develop measures and a list of priorities to improve waste management in the respective region. Options for financing and charging are also analyzed. Another focus of the cooperation is the planning, approval and control of thermal recovery plants in particular. A close professional exchange between the authorities in Brazil and Germany is planned.In emerging countries such as Brazil, around 90% of waste is landfilled, material or energy recovery is only used to a very limited extent, and secondary raw materials are hardly recovered. The raw materials economy is predominantly linear, there is no systematic, standardized circular economy for organizing the reuse of resources. The level of development of waste management in the municipalities is very different. Most of the landfills are not properly secured. The contaminated seepage water gets into the groundwater and thus has a negative impact on drinking water. This has serious consequences for the flora and fauna as well as for human health.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Mecklenburg-West Pomerania

Long Description: Program funding for the Institute for Environment and Human Security der United Nations  (UNU-EHS) in Bonn. The mission of the Institute for Environment and Human Security (UNU-EHS) is to carry out cutting edge research on risks and adaptation related to environmental hazards and global change. The institute's research promotes policies and programmes to reduce these risks, while taking into account the interplay between environmental and societal factors. Research areas include climate change adaptation and research is always conducted with the underlying goal of connecting solutions to development pathways. Beyond its research mandate, UNU-EHS is actively engaged in education.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Conference for students about the United Nations, Peacekeeping and SALW-control. United World College in Mostar, Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: SigN - System integration of low-temperature geothermal power plants - Energy technologies and energy efficiency
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: India's cities are faced with the complicated task of meeting the infrastructure requirements of rapidly growing regions. Water scarcity, inadequate wastewater treatment, as well as lack of access to and knowledge of technological solutions pose major challenges for India's water management. At the same time, many German actors have knowledge and specialised technologies that can make a contribution to mastering these challenges achieving sustainable goals with high environmental benefits. However, the often specialised and decentralised companies find it difficult to gain a foothold in the market. In AQUA-Hub, so called Water Innovation Hubs are being realised in two Smart Cities, Coimbatore (Tamil Nadu) and Solapur (Maharashtra), and are accompanied by pilot measures of German measuring technology for water quality monitoring.The project AQUA-Hub addresses the needs of the local water sectors identified in previous projects, as well as the challenges of the German water sector to build projects, relationships and business in the Indian market. A local presence is of great importance for the relations and information exchange between German and Indian actors. Besides networking activities and the mediation of business partners, the hubs fulfil the function of project centres for the realisation of demonstration projects and increase the exposure of Indian partners with technologies  Made in Germany . The piloting of German measurement technology for water quality monitoring, as planned in the project, thus offers the opportunity to meet these needs with manageable investments and risks and to create the basis for both better data availability on site as a starting point for measures to meet environmental goals and a connecting point for subsequent technology transfer.The further development of the Water Innovation Hubs is advised by a project advisory board consisting of the main institutions of country cooperation. Additional services of the hubs are being developed to create a sustainable, financially viable and transferable format that can be used in other regions. At the same time, the technological adaptation needs of German measurement technology will be determined. AQUA-Hub creates the basis for strengthening Indo-German cooperation, contributing to the solution of water-related challenges and increasing the export opportunities of German companies.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Collaborative project - Sensor-based security and emergency system for underground transport (SenSE4Metro) - Sub-project - Sensor network for an integrated security system - Technological research and development, Knowledge Transfer
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: The objective of the project is to train civil society stakeholders in techniques and tools of rhetoric, holding debates and mass communication. This will be done in three phases. Phase I and III consist of intensive seminars in Ramallah. In phase I, participants will learn different communication techniques as well as digital and media processing of the theoretical knowledge and the targeted use of social media. In phase II, they learn how to publish and spread videos. The creators of the best videos will be invited to participate in the concluding seminar (Phase III) and will be prepared for the final public competition.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Cooperation between the medical faculties of the LMU in Munich and Jimma  in Ethiopia has existed since 2002 and has led to foundation of the Center for International Health (CIHLMU). Together we have established 2 master programs and a PhD program. The graduates of CIHLMU in Ethiopia are the target group of the project. The aim is to create structures for professionalisation and networking of the target group. The following effects are intended - Strengthening the Ethiopian health system through - training in the field of mental health, - training for experts in medical didactics, - Networking and research funding. Annual conferences with the Ethiopian alumni of CIHLMU serve to professionalize and exchange examples of good practice. Research and teaching projects on development-related issues are intended to improve teaching and research in the faculties. Annual self-evaluations and an external evaluation in the last year of the 5-year project are used for quality assurance
Donor Agency: Federal State of Bavaria

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The project aims to improve sustainable transboundary management of marine biodiversity and natural marine resources in the Benguela Current by further developing the corresponding capacity of the Benguela Current Commission (BCC) and its member states. To this end, ecologically or biologically significant marine areas (EBSAs) are being identified and described, and the project partners are being advised on the establishment of an appropriate management regime. In addition, the project is institutionalising and implementing a regionally coordinated approach to marine spatial planning (MSP).
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety
