Long Description: The European Capacity Building Initiative (ecbi) is a consortium that has successfully supported international climate change negotiations for more than ten years. The initiative provides its support through a fellowship programme, a training and support programme and a publications and policy analysis unit. The project supports the leading ecbi members (the International Institute for Environment and Development (IIED) and Oxford Climate Policy (OCP)) in establishing an integrated training and support programme for developing countries. This helps to create a level playing field for the main negotiators from the world's weakest countries.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Taking stock of the situation five years after the Paris Climate Agreement was adopted at the interface between development and climate policy by means of a study with a focus on the relevance and contributions of the countries of the global south. Including deriving development policy options for action.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The current NDCs of individual countries vary greatly in form and content. The Climate Action Tracker therefore conducts independent, transparent studies on the national and global implementation of the Paris Agreement in over 30 countries. The project evaluates the reduction proposals and their implementation, assessing them in terms of their compatibility with the Paris Agreement. It also standardises the individual NDCs, enabling them to be compared with one other. The Climate Action Tracker also investigates the global effect of all NDCs and calculates a possible temperature increase resulting from all the activities, including the effects of international accounting rules - and this in turn enables the analysis of the differences between the actual greenhouse gas emissions and the emissions that are permitted for limiting the temperature rise to 1.5°C or 2°C.Through its work, the project identifies the best possible policy measures worldwide, both for countries and for individual sectors.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Loss prevention and safety promotion in the chemical process industries of the African region,  and Group of Latin American and Caribbean States (GRULAC) - Wuppertal Annual Course of Loss Prevention and Safety Promotion in the Chemical Process Industries for participants from developing countries.

Long Description: The Energy Trade Missions Program of the German-Energy -Solutions-Initiative helps SMEs to open up new foreign markets and to win local partners on site for their business. The core of the trade missions are talks with potential cooperation partners and customers abroad, which are organized individually for German companies by the German Chambers of Commerce Abroad (AHK) based in the target country. Over a period of two to three days, the companies visit potential business partners and establish personal contacts. In addition, German companies have the opportunity to present their products or services to representatives from business, associations, administration and politics in the target country at a one-day conference.Prior to the trade missions, the AHKs prepare a market analyses, which include a directory with profiles of the relevant market players and, in selected markets, a chapter on financing opportunities. These are publicly available on the website www.german-energy-solutions.de and thus also directly benefit the local players. In addition, any project that emerges from the support of the Energy Trade Mission Program of the German-Energy-Solutions- Initiative contributes to positive local economic and social development. The ODA-eligible share of 50% is considered in this report.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy

Long Description: The Berlin Development Education Programme has been held annually in November for 19 years. It offers a comprehensive range of educational opportunities for pupils in grades 3 to 13 on an annually changing annual theme. At the heart of benbi are 90-minute workshops on development policy issues related to the annual theme, designed by numerous NGOs. Further elements are a theme-related, interactive stage program, a cinema forum with short films followed by subsequent period of reflection, as well as a panel discussion for secondary school pupils. In addition, educators can receive further training on methods of global learning and receive accompanying information materials for their students to prepare and follow up on. Development policy exhibitions related to the respective annual theme round off the program for educators.
Donor Agency: City State of Berlin

Long Description: Basesd on the life cycle of cell phones, the participants become aware of the global consequences of cell phone consumption. Within the project days, they are introduced to the complex topic using global learning methods, a change of perspective is made possible and options for action for a sustainable use of cell phones are developed. For the first time, students can also make a sociopolitical contribution by creating a media piece. At the Berlin Development Education Program (benbi) 2020 on the topic of  Digitalization , they present their media contribution to students of the same age.

Long Description: Development policy project objective - The project  Sustainable Development in Practice  is intended to contribute to globally sustainable development in the sense of the SDGs by building up the One World Center Berlin in participatory processes in such a way that optimal conditions are created so that people from different backgrounds can actively work there for a socially responsible society in the globalized world and offer others information and participation opportunities for this purpose.

Long Description: BEI e.V. is the umbrella organization for more than 80 development-related associations and initiatives in Schleswig-Holstein. Through its regional network, it ensures a good exchange of information and promotes cooperation between the actors involved. The BEI supports development policy initiatives through advisory services, in particular on questions of financial project funding. In addition to these superordinate tasks of an umbrella organization, the BEI also carries out its own projects and campaigns on development issues. In the area of ??civil society development cooperation (DC), the BEI is the government\'s most important partner in Schleswig-Holstein. With its activities as a regional network, it contributes significantly to the popularity, quality and effectiveness of development cooperation, as well as to the dissemination and implementation of the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) in Schleswig-Holstein.

Long Description: The project  NGOs in schools - Global Learning in school development processes  KATE e.V. promotes the cooperation of about 20 Berlin-based NGOs with schools that want to anchor the learning area  Education for Sustainable Development/ Learning in Global Contexts  in their internal school curricula (SchiCs) and become model schools of Global Learning (GL) after the introduction of the new framework curriculum. Long Description: Module objective - The strengthened national quality infrastructure offers services that contribute to the reliability of consumption measurements and quality analyses of drinking water and wastewater. Core problem - Due to a lack of technical, professional and institutional capacities, the institutions of the quality infrastructure cannot provide the services necessary for the reliability of drinking water and wastewater analyses and drinking water consumption measurements.Target groups - Consumers of drinking water. Mediators - The national water utility ENACAL (Empresa Nicaragüense de Acueductos y Alcantarillados), the Ministry of Health (Ministerio de Salud, MINSA), quality infrastructure institutions. Executing agency - Ministry of Promotion, Industry and Trade (Ministerio de Fomento, Industria y Comercio, MIFIC). Methodological Approach - The module supports capacity building in quality infrastructure institutions. The focus of the interventions is on promoting the meso-level. The instrument deployment comprises PTB project staff (PTB = Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt) as well as local, regional and international short-term experts who take on subject-specific assignments and tasks in the field of Human Capacity Development (HCD).Key outputs - 1. the analytical capacities for drinking water quality have been expanded and improved, 2. the calibration laboratories relevant to the drinking water sector have improved their consumption measurements, 3. the testing laboratories in the wastewater sector have improved their measurement capabilities and the necessary standards for the wastewater sector have been developed and agreed.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The economic development of the Aral Sea region has improved across borders, taking into account ecological sustainability.

Long Description: A functioning metrology system is an important framework condition for the private sector to be able to do business successfully and is a prerequisite to participate in regional and global competition. Companies can only fulfil the requirements placed on their products if they can draw on reliable metrological services. The measure supports the development of the regional metrology system and regional economic integration by means of cooperation, division of labour and exchange within the CEMAC region (CEMAC = Communauté Économique et Monétaire de l'Afrique Centrale). These measures enable economic growth as well as revenue and employment opportunities for the local population. The project thus contributes to attaining the global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by contributing to ending poverty and furthering long-term, inclusive and sustainable economic growth.In addition, positive impacts on consumer protection are expected in various fields due to the support provided to the relevant national ministries for the elaboration of application proposals for measuring instruments.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The overall goal of this project is to share, communicate, and technically support companies in implementing the Forest Landscape Restoration (FLR) approach in their supply chains, thereby catalysing private sector investment to support the Bonn Challenge (BC). IUCN will apply the Restoration Opportunity Assessment Methodology in three supply chains in Peru, Tanzania and Ghana. Results will be used to develop business cases demonstrating the economic, social, and environmental benefits from FLR and identify ways, costs and benefits of integrating FLR in specific commodity supply chains and how it relates to Zero Net Deforestation (ZND). IUCN will also establish a Community of Practice on FLR in supply chains, based on the business cases and other learning experiences, with key private sector actors, to support companies with their FLR and ZND initiatives in support of the BC. Learning will be compiled into a Guide for Business to inform business initiatives and policy platforms.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project will support the Government of El Salvador in aligning public policies and incentives in the land-use sector with national objectives for the Ecosystem and Landscape Restoration Program (PREP) and REDD+. It will also support the Government to design a program of public incentives for the maintenance and expansion of agroforestry and restoration systems that will subsequently be used as one of the means of implementation of the PREP and the country's forestry policy. The project will i) examine the complementarity of public policies and incentives in the land-use sector and the objectives of the PREP, identifying avenues for their alignment and developing action plans for their implementation, ii) analyze the economics of agroforestry systems in El Salvador and financial and policy barriers to their adoption, and iii) design and implement a pilot package of public incentives to promote the maintenance and expansion of agroforestry systems.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The main objective of the project, implemented in collaboration with UNECE, is to strengthen national and regional capacities on implementation of the Protocol on Strategic Environmental Assessment (SEA) to the Espoo Convention as an essential tool for environmentally sustainable economic development and as a means for addressing specific environmental challenges, including climate change.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Latin American countries participating in the Bonn Challenge have committed themselves to ambitious FLR goals, which make an important contribution to the achievement of their NDCs. Public funds for FLR are limited, so private investment is needed for successful implementation and the project works directly with potential investors such as development banks, funds and intermediary institutions to this end. The project develops an FLR Impact Framework with methods and tools based on the open source approach, enabling monitoring and reporting on the environmental and social impacts of FLR projects. This framework is tested and applied on appropriate credit products as well as on a project pipeline and exemplary investments in the partner countries. A proposal for the  Climate Fund for the most promising pilot project is also developed in cooperation with the partner country. The project is part of the IKI  Response Package.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: external audit by Grant Thornton to audit Mayday Rescue and their projects to support Syria Civil Defense (White Helmets)

Long Description: Sustainable mobility is an important topic in MEX. The Conference on Sustainable Mobility of the Future is part of the series of  Sustainability Dialogues  of the Embassy. In keynotes, a panel discussion and thematic working groups on three to four key topics of sustainable mobility, we will investigate the question of what is required to start a decade of electro mobility in Mexico. In order to achieve the national climate protection goals and meet the obligations under the Paris Agreement, a reduction in greenhouse gases is essential. This will only be possible if we put our forms of mobility to the test and make progress in the area of electro mobility. This is particularly important in a country like Mexico. With this sustainability dialogue, we are contributing to the fulfillment of the Paris Agreement.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project  Food Security in Rural Zambia - Integrating Traditional Fruit and Vegetable Crops in Smallholder Agroforestry Systems  (FoSeZa) is intended to increase the food security in the Nchelenge District in Zambia. Local smallholders are supported in establishing agroforestry systems made of indigenous vegetables and fruit trees.The fruit tree species used for the integrated cropping systems and for the nutrient analysis will be selected in the beginning of the project. The aim of this task is to identify indigenous fruit trees common in the Nchelenge District in Zambia by interviewing inhabitants and by field surveys. In a second step, propagation and cropping systems will be developed and nutritionally relevant substances will be studied in naturally occurring genotypes of the selected fruits and vegetables. A chemical characterization of the individual plant components has to be made and respective quantitative analytical methods must be developed.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: The statistics on corona data describe the very sad situation regarding the infection of medical staff in Kyrgyzstan. Infection of the medical staff can be prevented by providing them with individual protective equipment. The production of the 750 sets of the individual protective materials in Kyrgyzstan will meet the demand of the regional doctors in Naryn Oblast. In addition, the measure ensures the high quality of the protective materials according to MoH standards, and thus the risk of infection with corona virus is reduced
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Southeast  is one of the fastest-growing developing regions in the world, with an energy demand forecast to rise by 70% by 2040. The partner countries are currently responsible for 80% of the region's energy consumption, which, according to current planning, includes the substantial use of coal. This makes the successful implementation of the Paris Agreement more difficult. The project therefore supports an energy transition with ambitious climate goals in this region. Together with the broad participation of relevant stakeholders, evidence-based solutions for key challenges are being developed aimed at reorienting the energy transition and the pertinent local dialogue. It also supports coordination in the energy sector in South East  and provides technical and political assistance. The project is developing a knowledge platform and it is also participating in the regional specialist dialogue as part of the South East Asian Energy Transition Partnership (ETP).The project is part of the IKI  Response Package.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

It revives endangered arts and crafts related to marble and stone work, bringing back ancient construction techniques with local building materials.

Long Description: The goal of the programme is to help countries channel investment flows into infrastructure projects compatible with the Paris Climate Agreement and the 2030 Agenda goals, in line with international environmental, social and governance standards. The programme will address a full range of intervention points in  and Southeast  - from upstream longterm visions, strategic planning, enabling policies and sustainable finance mobilisation, to projectlevel pilot activities. It will also work with governments, financiers and businesses in both recipient and origin countries, to strengthen sustainability standards in their cross-border activities and promote exchanges among stakeholders.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: A Plastic Waste Partnership was established under the Basel Convention. The projects applied for and selected are aimed at reducing plastic waste from land-based sources and its input into oceans. These can be in the areas of prevention and minimisation, collection, recycling and other recovery including financing. 188 proposals were submitted, of which 23 were considered eligible.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The objective of this programme, managed by UN Environment and FAO, is to support sustainable land-use planning in the biodiversity-rich Lac Tele/Lac Tumba landscape in the Congo Basin. To protect the invaluable natural diversity and carbon sinks, this programme, which runs until 2025, aims to support the RoC and DRC in climate and biodiversity-friendly development planning through informed cross-sectoral policy-making and ecological analysis & monitoring, including early warning system and spatial land-use planning tools. A participatory governance mechanism will include all stakeholders, such as local communities, NGOs, private sector and academia. Options for low-impact drainage-free land-uses and alternative community-based livelihoods, such as community-based ecotourism, sustainable fishing or wet agriculture, will be explored. A key pillar of the programme is to build capacity of civil society and government institutions to support integrated long-term environmental management.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The objective of this programme, managed by UN Environment and FAO, is to support sustainable land-use planning in the biodiversity-rich Lac Tele/Lac Tumba landscape in the Congo Basin. To protect the invaluable natural diversity and carbon sinks, this programme, which runs until 2025, aims to support the RoC and DRC in climate and biodiversity-friendly development planning through informed cross-sectoral policy-making and ecological analysis & monitoring, including early warning system and spatial land-use planning tools. A participatory governance mechanism will include all stakeholders, such as local communities, NGOs, private sector and academia. Options for low-impact drainage-free land-uses and alternative community-based livelihoods, such as community-based ecotourism, sustainable fishing or wet agriculture, will be explored. A key pillar of the programme is to build capacity of civil society and government institutions to support integrated long-term environmental management.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The main objective of the proposed project is for West African countries to be able to participate in inter-national carbon markets and to have access to results-based climate finance for the implementation of their national climate change contributions. The project will promote and support the active participation of West Africa. For example, West African delegates will participate in the UNFCCC negotiations on carbon market mechanisms and climate finance, gain access to market mechanisms and opportunities for climate finance at national and regional level. The West African countries should be assisted in the transition from CDM-related capacities and projects to the Paris Convention and assisted in pilot projects.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The implementation of ambitious NDCs of West African countries faces a large funding gap. In 2017, 16 countries have formed the  West African  on Carbon Markets and Climate Finance  to jointly tackle issues relating to accessing carbon markets and climate finance for NDC implementation. Building on the 's successful start, the project seeks to deepen sub-regional cooperation and enhance in-country readiness for Article 6 implementation. The member participation in international negotiations on Article 6 of the Paris Agreement ensures that African priorities are reflected in the design of the new carbon market approaches. Furthermore, the inception of carbon market projects is supported by a platform for networking between strategic partners (e.g. financiers, project developers). The development of institutionalized regional cooperation structures will increase awareness, transfer knowledge and stimulate replication in the region.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The implementation of ambitious NDCs of West African countries faces a large funding gap. In 2017, 16 countries have formed the  West African  on Carbon Markets and Climate Finance  to jointly tackle issues relating to accessing carbon markets and climate finance for NDC implementation. Building on the 's successful start, the project seeks to deepen sub-regional cooperation and enhance in-country readiness for Article 6 implementation. The member participation in international negotiations on Article 6 of the Paris Agreement ensures that African priorities are reflected in the design of the new carbon market approaches. Furthermore, the inception of carbon market projects is supported by a platform for networking between strategic partners (e.g. financiers, project developers). The development of institutionalized regional cooperation structures will increase awareness, transfer knowledge and stimulate replication in the region.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: MRV is an important foundation for policy-making within the framework of the Paris Agreement. The project is establishing a  Caribbean Cooperative MRV Hub (CCMRVH)  to create greenhouse gas inventories, assess climate mitigation measures and track progress towards national climate targets. The platform will bring together experts from different countries and create regional institutional prerequisites for the cross-national use of expert knowledge on MRV. National specialists are developing institutional structures, emission-relevant data structures and drafts for political strategies and international reporting. Specialist MRV knowledge is also being improved through training and the project is developing framework conditions for the dissemination and sustainable use of the  Hub .
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The aim of the project is to supply the Lowo Nyiphug Namdrol Norbuling Monastic School in Upper Mustang with electricity by installing solar systems.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The project aims to establish urban resilience as an integrating and holistic concept for a more effective combination of climate change adaptation, disaster risk management and sustainable urban development and to strengthen ASEAN as a multilateral organisation. In addition, the topic of urban climate resilience is to be given greater political significance and a major contribution is to be made to the implementation of the Paris Climate Convention and the global sustainability agenda.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Our programmatic approach - scaling up sustainable cooling -Cross-segment focus - refrigeration and ACs in residential & commercial buildings, -4-pillar, holistic approach based on (1) demand reduction/passive measures, (2) accelerated HFC phase-down, (3) replacement & safe disposal of inefficient appliances, (4) improved cooling appliance operation, training & awareness -Set up implementation-focused industry partnerships for all parts of the cooling value chain -Support efficiency strategies & NDC implementation with smart policy design -Facilitate technological change through viable business and financing models -Adapt & demonstrate technology in replicable settings, encourage upscaling through incentives -Build hands-on capacity for transition & training structures, prevent accidents which may undermine support for transition to low-GWP refrigerants -Create lessons to draw from -Coordinate efforts between Montreal Protocol, Kigali Amendment & Paris Agreement activities
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project aims at strengthening and connecting Moroccan women in rural areas and their civil society activities as well as increasing their creative participation in the commune and society. Therefore, seven intensive workshops of four weeks each will take place in the Souss Massa region with public events and presentations at the end. Furthermore, ongoing follow-ups, support and a final networking event will be carried out towards the end of the project.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The Welding Workshop in Dysselsdorp will be used to train young people through the Kolping Work Opportunity Programme. Until now, KSA has to use other Training Providers to do the Welding Training. With this investment of building our own Welding Workshop, KSA will save funds in the long term.KSA already has the Accredited Training Programme which is provided by our network partner,Thabiso Skills lnsitute and we will therefore be able to implement the training immediately. From the Welding Workshop,KSA also will manufacture items for sale to the public to make the project sustainable- to be able to fund training for young people in future.
Donor Agency: Federal State of Bavaria

Long Description: Goal of the project is the publication of a special edition of the Palestine-Israel Journal on UNSCR 1325 (women, peace, and security) in English and German as well as the publication of two supplements with summaries of the articles in Arabic and Hebrew. The edition will also be availabe online. The project will give voice to women and the awareness of the mostly male decision-makers for women's rights will be raised.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: ECOWAS member states' capacities to counter TOC are to be strengthened through training, dialogue and advisory activities. In particular, the project's objectives are the elaboration and adoption of a joint ECOWAS strategy to counter TOC as well as a follow-up document to the  Praia Declaration  in which, in 2008, ECOWAS, ECOWAS member states and the UNODC had adopted common political principles for the fight against TOC in West Africa. Project activities will thereby be clustered in five thematic areas (1) Strengthening of criminal justice systems, (2) Preventing and countering TOC and illicit trafficking, (3) Preventing and countering terrorism, (4) Preventing and countering corruption, (5) Improving prevention of drug abuse.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Finance

Long Description: ECOWAS member states' capacities to counter TOC are to be strengthened through training, dialogue and advisory activities. Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Finance

Long Description: Development of analytical methods in terms of origin, processing and authenticity of different Moroccan edible oils and characterization of by-products of oil processing residues to ensure sales opportunities in the global market. The aim of the study is to investigate the influence of origin of the plants and storage and processing of the raw material on the composition of oil obtained from fruits of argan tree (Argania spinosa), cactus pear (Opuntia ficus-indica), desert date palm (Balanites aegyptiaca), real date palm (Phoenix dactyliferous) or Ziziphus lotus as potential oil sources for cooperatives. In addition, the residues of oil processing should be investigated regarding their use as sources for bioactive phenolic compounds for the stabilization of food. Finally, methods should be developed to ensure the authenticity of the included oils on basis of the measurement of volatile or phenolic compounds as well as metabolites in general combined with statistical means.The results should motivate the rural population to grow robust plants that can be used for food production in order to improve the nutritional situation, the income and employment, the situation of the women and also fight against desertification by stabilizing the soil. This project is a continuation of two projects carried out at the MRI on argan and cactus oil quality together with the Mohammed-V- within the PMARS call, funded by the BMBF.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: The project entails the purchase of schoolbags, notebooks and mathematical sets for 269 needy schoolchildren from Doyisem  Academy and Mayom Wisdom Academy. The schools are located in Makoko, a large slum by the Lagos lagoon. The inhabitants live in very poor social conditions, and there is a huge lack of social services, including schools, which are poorly equipped, and a lot of their pupils lack basic school materials.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The NGO Springs of Life Zimbabwe resides in Epworth, a very poor part of Harare which is known for its prostitution in the so called booster area. The NGO takes care of children, the elderly and especially of the prostitutes. Approximately 350 prostitutes are part of the rehabilitation programm for an alternative lifestyle. This garment project will establish a sewing centre and train about 100 prostitutes. Good contacts in the community will guarantee orders for school and other uniforms. A shop has been donated by a company in Epworth.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Unprecedented growth in African cities is resulting in traffic congestion and uncontrolled sprawl, leading to rising GHG emissions, local air pollution, urban poverty, and climate vulnerabilities. The project aims to avoid this trajectory and deliver GHG reductions from the transport sector by promoting and improving public and non-motorized transport. The project will focus on Kenya, Rwanda, Tanzania, and Uganda, all of which mention transport as part of their NDCs. The project will implement shift strategies that introduce low carbon mobility options as well as avoid strategies that reduce the need for trips. The project will support the implementation of high quality mass rapid transit systems in Nairobi, Kigali, and Kampala and the expansion of the existing BRT system in Dar es Salaam. The project seeks to complement rapid transit through better access for pedestrians and cyclists and regulations to facilitate the intensification of land uses along rapid transit corridors.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Humanitarian Preparedness in the departments Chalatenango, San Vicente and San Salvador in El Salvador
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Support concerning the official twinning between the City of Moers and La Trinidad/Nicaragua. Main Focus - Education and Health.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Since 1938 the old folks home San Jose in Cochabamba is taking care of old people who are in difficult physicall conditions or in special need. The home is run by nuns who are taking the responsibility of looking after these people because Bolivia has no state welfare system for old homeless people whose family members cannot financially support them. Currently there are 140 old people in the home.  The new mattresses enable the home to maintain a minimum hygienic standard for sleeping. This gesture helps to improve the life in the old folks home.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: TransJakarta, the first and longest Bus rapid transit (BRT) system in . The Institute for Transportation and Development Policy (ITDP) has been asked to help physically integrate it with the new , optimize its services, improve NMT access, and help the city reform new zoning and parking regulations in the city. A goal is to upgrade TransJakarta to Gold Standard BRT and change zoning and parking regulations to be consistent with Gold Standard transit oriented development.ITDP has also been asked by the Mayor of Medan to develop a conceptual plan for the first full BRT outside Jakarta.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: A network of five rehabilitation centers in North Iraq (Erbil, Halabja, Kirkuk, Mosul, Sulaymaniyah) will offer gender-specific and age-adapted medical and psychological assistance as well as legal counselling to 2000 survivors of human rights violations, including an estimated 1000 women and 600 children. Services will include medical diagnostics and rehabilitation services, including assessments, free medication, as well as general medical, physiotherapeutic and orthopedic treatment. It will also includepsychological trauma diagnostics, individual and group psychotherapy, psychiatric treatment and consultation as well as psychoeducation. In addition it will also offer pediatric services, child and youth psychotherapy, as well as family counseling and education regarding effects of trauma and children's needs and rights and legal counseling regarding remedies and reparation.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Winter Relief for Internally Displaced Persons in Idlib and Aleppo, Syria
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Basic health care and making NFI (non food items) and WASH (water, sanitation and hygiene) available to conflict-affected internally displaced persons and residents in the Idlib and Aleppo regions.

Long Description: Contribution to climate protection, climate adaptability (SDG13) and the establishment of municipal partnerships. A sustainable network of people from European municipalities and municipalities of the global South is established. Within this network a regular exchange of knowledge and experience is taking place as well as the initiation of new common projects. The project is based on the results of the project young expertise I. In December 2017 a 10-day international workshop (international network- and exchange meeting) took place in Solingen. The results will be analysed till Spring 2018.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Finance

Long Description: The seminar series comprised two seminars in Lagos in 2018, which were similarly held in Abuja, both with speakers and participants from various Nigerian and German institutions. The objectives of the seminar series were raising of awareness for sustainable waste management and the associated climate mitigation features in Nigeria, as well as the facilitation of networking between Nigerian and German actors in the field.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The seminar series serves to raise awareness for renewable energy and relevant issues, and connect Nigerian and German actors in the field. It entails three seminars in Lagos, which take place similarly in Abuja. The topics of the seminars are energy efficiency, renewable energy financing, and photovoltaic/solar. Speakers and participants from German and Nigerian institutions take part in the seminars. Reasons for the organisation of the seminar series are the enormous lack of energy and the great rising need thereof in the future in Nigeria.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Bonn and Ramallah are currently working on the development of the project Garden of Senses. With the involvement of as many different people as possible, a barrier-free meeting place is to be created that, through its design with artistic objects, enables intensive seeing, hearing, touch, smell and taste. The aim of the joint project is to create an awareness of the equal participation of all people in the political, cultural and economic life and to promote mutual understanding. The project idea as well as the first drafts of the Sinnesgarten were further developed within the framework of the dialogue platform Connective Cities under the title Including Cities - Urban and Social Development for All in May 2018 in Bonn.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: Together with representatives from Bonn, representatives of the city administration of Lautoka / Fiji and the City of Bonn are exploring possibilities for cooperation on the topic of civil protection, early warning and climate adaptation. For this purpose, a corresponding professional program consisting of talks and visits or excursions will be developed. The Resilient Cities conference in Bonn will be used as a discussion and cooperation platform. The aim is to explore possibilities for cooperation and, if necessary, to develop follow-up activities or joint project ideas.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: The Freedom Online Coalition (FOC), founded in The Hague in 2011, is an informal coalition of 30 states from five continents that is working for human rights online. The background of the coalition is the fact that authoritarian governments have responded to the emergence of new freedoms on the Internet with increasing state control and surveillance. The FOC is trying to counter this with its efforts to protect the right to freedom of opinion, privacy and freedom of assembly. The annual conference, chaired by Germany, was held in Berlin in 2019. Approximately 350 participants from 90 different countries took part. Among the 90 countries, 35 were ODA-eligible countries (ODA = Official Development Assistance).
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Financing of travel costs for one activist from Serbia, Montenegro, Venezuela, Columbia and Argentina to participate at the Equal Rights Coalition Global Conference from August 5 to 7, 2018 in Vancouver in order to create a strong international network on LGBTI issues.

Long Description: Sponsorship of UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) event Global Festival of Action in Bonn, March 2018. Long Description: The aim is to develop scientific scenarios for promoting renewable energies throughout the world, with a special focus on developing and newly industrialising countries. The IRENA Innovation and Technology center (IITC) in Bonn wants to develop scientific scenarios for promoting renewable energies throughout the world, with a special focus on developing and emerging countries. It will work closely with the headquarters of the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) in Abu Dhabi to advance the global transition to resource-efficient technologies. The IITC's supports by technology and innovation analyses. Only the proportion of the share for the developing countries is recorded here.

Long Description: Research, teaching, training and further education as well as consulting and health care in the fields of infectious and tropical medicine. The BNITM is Germany's largest institution for research, treatment and training in the field of tropical diseases and new emerging infections. As a member of the Leibniz-Association and as a research institute of national importance, the Institute is jointly funded by the  Government, the Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg and the other federal states. Research topics include clinical studies, epidemiology and disease control as well as the biology of pathogens, their reservoirs and vectors. The current scientific focus is on malaria, haemorrhagic fever viruses, immunology, epidemiology and clinical studies of tropical infections as well as on the mechanisms of the viral transmission by mosquitoes. For the handling of highly pathogenic viruses and infected insects, the Institute has laboratories of the highest biosafety level (BSL-4) and a BSL-3 insectary. The Institute's health care services include specific laboratory diagnostics of tropical diseases and other rare infections, close cooperation with the German  Defence Forces concerning medical care for military deployments in the tropics as well as the consultation of the scientific community, politics and the general public, which essentially contribute to the Institute's national reputation. The Institute has been appointed by the  Ministry of Health as the National Reference Center (NRC) for the detection of all tropical pathogens as well as by the WHO (= World Health Organisation) as Collaborating Center for arboviruses and haemorrhagic fever viruses. In collaboration with the Ghanaian Health Ministry and the  of Kumasi the Institute has been operating a modern research and training center in the West-African rain forest for over ten years, which is also available to external research groups. The teaching activities comprise a three months full-time course on all aspects of tropical medicine for physicians as well as a training program for PhD students at the Institute and a number of activities on continuing education in topics related to travel medicine and international health. Numerous scientists of the Institute are involved in student teaching as appointed professors of the  and the  Hospital of Hamburg.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Health

Services will include medical diagnostics and rehabilitation services, including assessments, free medication, as well as general medical, physiotherapeutic and orthopedic treatment. It will also includepsychological trauma diagnostics, individual and group psychotherapy, psychiatric treatment and consultation as well as psychoeducation. In addition it will also offer pediatric services, child and youth psychotherapy, as well as family counseling and education regarding effects of trauma and children's needs and rights and legal counseling regarding remedies and reparation.

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. The city of Popasna is located near the contact line. The Community center Popasna is one of the few organizations that, despite the difficult situation, continue to engage in children's development and education, in the organization of leisure and children's activities. But the Community center has not had a specially equipped room. The project allowed to buy furniture, sports and play equipment and to equip the children's playroom.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General in Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of Eastern Ukraine). It is funded as part of the technical cooperation in 2019. On Ukraine's way to Europe the Eastern Ukraine is a 'swing region'. This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbass, the constant migration of internally displaced persons, corruption and the insufficient state support for people in need and social agencies. The project 'Mattresses for the regional center of palliative medicine in Kharkiv' gives the possibility to buy special medical mattresses to improve the living and treatment conditions of disabled people in the center of palliative medicine. The local project implementer is the NGO East-West Foundation.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Funding for the Hokisa Children's Home, which takes care of (black) orphans in one of the oldest townships in Cape Town and gives them a family-like home. Hokisa takes special care of children with HIV / AIDS. One of the main tasks is to create a stable and comfortable environment for the minors - and in doing so promoting their social development. Much emphasis is also placed on education - All children of school age shall attend school. Therefore, i.e. transport and participation in events is ensured. Additionally, there is a medical practice on the premise rounding off the project in terms of health care.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Assistance for sick bedridden persons and their families in the provinces of Santiago de Cuba, Camaguey, Matanzas and La Habana
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Installation of converters and turbines with the objective of an efficient use of the natural resources in the region of Matanzas and the finca of the Centro Cristiano de Reflexion y Dialogo (CCRD) in Cardenas which produces vegetables and fruits and distributes it to schools and hospitals amongst others.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The San Juan Psychiatric Clinic is a project of the San Juan de DIos Hospital Order, which is dependent on the Catholic Church in Bolivia. This center receives patients from all over the department of La Paz, both urban and rural. In the building for acute patients are patients with severe mental disorders that require strict and constant monitoring. Unfortunately, the Institute does not have sufficient staff or resources for this purpose. Therefor safety accesories shall be installed.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The House of Hope (HoH) is a charitable institution supported by the German Red Cross in Yerevan. The installation of solar panels on its roof is intended to cover energy consumption through renewable energies. The saved money for energy costs will be invested in the soup kitchen of the HoH. As a model project, it aims to raise awareness of environmental issues and stimulate further investment in renewable energies in Armenia.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: In the framework of the small-scale program the Embassy is funding a project by the local NGO 'Christian Service Society' (CSS) aiming to expand their ambulatory service for eye patients in three southern districts of Bangladesh (Bagerhat, Sathkira, Pirojpur). Especially in poor rural areas people are lacking both awareness and financial means for proper eye health and hygiene. In this context, CSS built up a hospital with separate eye clinic in Khulna in 1998. The eye clinic also provides ambulatory treatments in the surrounding districts. Through the current project, CSS is aiming to expand the ambulatory service of the eye clinic. The goal is to offer more treatments for the poor population, above all for children and elderly people, in order to prevent serious eye sicknesses. At the end of the project, 3200 persons should have access to a first eye check-up, 320 persons suffering from cataract should have undergone surgical treatment.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Know-how on how to deal with fake news campaigns and information on the background of the European Neighbourhood Policy will be shared with young journalists from Georgia and Germany. For that purpose, field trips and networking conferences will take place in Tbilisi (Georgia) in October and December 2019 and in Berlin in November. These conferences include methodological workshops and an exchange of ideas among the participants and representatives of the political sphere and of media NGOs. Furthermore, the participants will create their own articles which will be published through the online-platform Myth Detector. This platform will allow journalists to network, share and pool information and shares contents meant for public information in English.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Qualified service structures for gender pedagogical and therapeutic offers for psychological stabilisation and school (re-)integration of 3000 children and adolescents have been established in Ramadi, Falluja, Kirkuk, Mosul.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The project's goal is to analyse best practice examples on how to integrate people with disabilities on the first job market and to make use of strategies to adapt those practices with regard to the countries of the Eastern Partnership. In doing so, human rights and human dignity get bolstered. In the course of seminars, German partners teach the participants. In September 2019 a common conference of the DISEMEX (International Conference 'Disability Employment Expert') partners will take place in Düsseldorf. The project results will be published spread at the regional conferences in Ukraine (Kiev), Armenia (Gyumri), Georgia (Tbilisi) and Russia (Yekaterinburg). In December 2019 an online conference will be held to spread the project's results and facillitate a deepened future cooperation.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: Unprecedented growth in African cities is resulting in traffic congestion and uncontrolled sprawl, leading to rising greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, local air pollution, urban poverty, and climate vulnerabilities. The project aims to avoid this trajectory and deliver GHG reductions from the transport sector by promoting and improving public and non-motorized transport. The project will focus on Kenya, Rwanda, Tanzania, and Uganda, all of which mention transport as part of their NDCs (nationally determined contributions). The project will implement 'shift' strategies that introduce low carbon mobility options as well as 'avoid' strategies that reduce the need for trips. The project will support the implementation of high quality mass rapid transit systems in Nairobi, Kigali, and Kampala and the expansion of the existing BRT (bus rapid transit) system in Dar es Salaam. The project seeks to complement rapid transit through better access for pedestrians and cyclists and regulations to facilitate the intensification of land uses along rapid transit corridors.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: Improving the capacity to apply green port principles. Large ports in the Caspian Sea, such as the ports of Baku (Azerbaijan) and Turkmenbashi (Turkmenistan), but also neighbouring seaports, such as Aktau (Kazakhstan), expect to be able to significantly increase their trading activities. The port of Baku (Azerbaijan) was the first port in the region to commit itself to becoming a green port. The  Port Principles commit to reducing the ecological and energy footprint of goods distribution, including materials management, waste management and physical distribution. This includes best practices in energy, waste management, water and air quality and sustainable business practices.  port principles can help reduce air pollutants and greenhouse gases, increase energy security and open up economic opportunities.  ports are safe, sustainable and economic, offering best practices for sustainable trade and transport. The integration of renewable energy and energy efficiency in port operations is a key element in this endeavour. While these challenges exist, ports face a knowledge, capability and technology gap when it comes to integrating renewable energy into their operations as part of the green port principles.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: The population of the city of Tunis, (in the Medina), especially pupils should be made aware of the waste prevention and waste recycling. Sensibilisation of the population for the waste problematic - waste avoidance (Tunisia). To build up recycling ressources and the use of it.
Donor Agency: Federal State of North Rhine-Westphalia

Long Description: The project aims to develop a solar cooling-drying system for fish. The project will introduce a containerised, stand-alone solar technology package consisting of a hundred percent off-grid cooling and drying system among mariculture farmers. Mariculture is becoming increasingly important in Kenya as natural fish stocks (e.g. tilapia in Lake Victoria) shrink. Farmers on the coast of Kenya currently produce Milkfish (Chanos chanos Forskal) in ponds. Fishermen also harvest a local sardine called Kimarawali (Stolephorus delecatulus) along the banks of rivers in the Kwale and Kilifi counties. The seasonal nature of fishing yields and the lack of suitable processing technologies force fishermen to sell their products as long as they are fresh - often below price. Unsuitable processing and handling technologies also deny access to high-end markets. The German and Kenyan partners develop a technology package to process and add value to Milkfish and Kimarawali. The technology will include the latest advances in photovoltaics (PV), phase change materials (PCM) and modelling technologies. For cooling technology, PCM cold storages or use of electrical battery, or a combination, will be optimised to guarantee stable and reliable cooling operations. Drying will be coupled to the cooling system and heat remissions will be used to supplement drying. For the production of high-quality dried fish (first-class nutritional value, texture and taste), dehydration takes place through optimised temperature and humidity control. The fishermen are trained in processing and quality assurance. Fraunhofer Institute for Solar Energy Systems ISE (Fraunhofer ISE) and Innotech cooperate with the Kenyan Industrial Research and Development Institute (KIRDI), the Kenya Marine and Fisheries Research Institute (KMFRI) and the Mombasa  of Technology (TUM) to design, develop and transfer the proposed technology package.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: This project on urban farming (UF) aims to contribute to the improvement of urban food security, nutrition and food safety. Possible means to increase availability, consumption and marketing of diverse, safe and nutritious foods through improved production and marketing of crops and animal products in disadvantaged communities of Maputo and Cape Town are investigated. The operational framework for UF shall be improved and research on UF and the sustainable application of the project results from grass root to upper policy levels strengthened. Objectives 1) study food habits, consumer behaviour and current systems of UF, explore value-adding options through improving and diversifying the UF systems, 2) investigate benefits and risks to human health and food safety of crop and animal UF. 3) extend the current agricultural research of the partner universities to the area of UF for all Mozambican, South African and German project partners. 4)sustainable implementation of project results.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: This project on urban farming (UF) aims to contribute to the improvement of urban food security, nutrition and food safety. Long Description: Travelling Conference in Tbilisi and Yerevan on 'South Caucasus Urban Futures' - smart, systemic, resource efficient - Viable technologies to protect resources (water, Integrated Water Resources Management (IWRM), land, forests, settlements) and eco-technologies in the developing country
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Long Description: The annual interdisciplinary conference on research in tropical and subtropical agriculture, natural resource management and rural development (TROPENTAG) is jointly organised by the universities of Berlin, Bonn, Göttingen, Hohenheim, Kassel-Witzenhausen, Hamburg, ZALF e. V. (Leibniz Centre for Agricultural Landscape Research), ETH Zurich (Switzerland), Czech  of Life Sciences Prague (Czech Republic), BOKU Vienna (Austria) ( of Natural Resources and Life Sciences) and the Council for Tropical and Subtropical Research (ATSAF e. V.) in co-operation with the GIZ Advisory Service on Agricultural Research for Development (BEAF). The Tropical Day has become the most important international conference on development-oriented research in the fields of food security, natural resource management and rural development in central Europe and provides a unique platform for scientific and personal exchange for students, junior and senior scientists, development experts and funding organisations from several countries together with their international partner institutions. The Tropical Day is held annually at different host sites. Tropical Day 2019 will take place in Kassel, Germany, 18 to 20 September 2019. This year's theme is 'Filling gaps and removing traps for sustainable resources management'.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: Subproject 2. Erfurt  of Applied Sciences (EUAS) is a project partner of FRUVASE project (Fruits and vegetables for all seasons...), led by  Göttingen, with partners in Tanzania, Uganda and Kenya, which engages in developing processing technologies for selected fruits and leafy vegetables to prolong shelf-life and generate and commercialize new products. Task of EUAS is to embed the developed technologies in a resource-efficient, energy-autonomous cyclic systems approach (water-energy-waste-food nexus), considering renewable energy generation and use (biomass, photovoltaic - PV), cyclic processes including organic waste management and water purification and re-use.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: Brazil's new government' - this was the title of the joint discussion event of the Cologne-Rio City Twinning Association and Department of International Affairs. (registered association) /  of Duisburg-Essen, b) Thomas Fatheuer, former director of the Heinrich Böll Foundation in Rio de Janeiro, sociologist in Berlin, c) Dr. (Doctor) Carola Saavedra, writer, and from April at the Portuguese-Brazilian Institute of the  of Cologne, e) Astrid Prange de Oiveira, journalist and presenter of the evening.

Long Description: Research, teaching, training and further education as well as consulting and health care in the fields of infectious and tropical medicine. The BNITM is Germany's largest institution for research, treatment and training in the field of tropical diseases and new emerging infections. As a member of the Leibniz-Association and as a research institute of national importance, the Institute is jointly funded by the  Government, the Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg and the other federal states. Research topics include clinical studies, epidemiology and disease control as well as the biology of pathogens, their reservoirs and vectors. The current scientific focus is on malaria, haemorrhagic fever viruses, immunology, epidemiology and clinical studies of tropical infections as well as the optimization of control measures against tropical infectious diseases in resource-poor countries and the mechanisms of virus transmission by mosquitoes.For the handling of highly pathogenic viruses and infected insects, the Institute has laboratories of the highest biosafety level (BSL-4) and a BSL-3 insectary. The Institute's health care services include specific laboratory diagnostics of tropical diseases and other rare infections, capacity building as well as the consultation of the scientific community, politics and the general public, which essentially contribute to the Institute's national reputation. The Institute has been appointed by the  Ministry of Health as the National Reference Center (NRC) for the detection of all tropical pathogens as well as by the WHO as Collaborating Center for arboviruses and haemorrhagic fever viruses. In collaboration with the Ghanaian Health Ministry and the  of Kumasi the Institute has been operating a modern research and training center in the West-African rain forest for over twenty years, which is also available to external research groups.The teaching activities comprise a three months full-time course on all aspects of tropical medicine for physicians as well as a training program for PhD students at the Institute and a number of activities on continuing education in topics related to travel medicine and international health. Numerous scientists of the Institute are involved in student teaching as appointed professors of the  and the  Hospital of Hamburg.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Health

Long Description: The project contributes to biodiversity conservation, reduction of GHG emissions and climate change adaptation in the Mata Atlântica. Areas located in the back country of Rio de Janeiro, in the southern part of the state of Bahia, and in the coastal region between the states of Sao Paulo and Paraná are protected and interlinked. The project works together with local communities to register small-scale landholders in a rural environmental land registry. It further provides advisory support to state environmental authorities on establishing reference centers to support the restoration of degraded areas. Development scenarios including climate change, its impacts and vulnerability analyses help identify ways in which the sustainable use of ecosystems can contribute to GHG reductions and climate change adaptation. The project disseminates lessons learned which can be incorporated into policy approaches and fed into concrete measures for protecting and restoring the Mata Atlântica.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The rapid growth in African cities leads to traffic jams and uncontrolled urban sprawl - and the consequences are rising greenhouse gas emissions, air pollution, urban poverty and climate vulnerability. The project helps to avoid this and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the transport sector at the same time by supporting public & non-motorised transport and urban planning in the target countries. It also supports the implementation of high-quality public transport systems in Nairobi, Kigali and Kampala and the expansion of the existing bus rapid transport system in Dar es Salaam. The integration of public transport with cycling and walking is being improved and urban development along transport corridors addressed. The project also promotes policy frameworks at urban and national levels, accelerating changes in the transport sector through quality standards, improved financing and other policy measures.
Donor Agency: Federal Min. for the Env., Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

Long Description: The project aims to develop a solar cooling-drying system for fish. The project will introduce a containerised, stand-alone solar technology package consisting of a hundred percent off-grid cooling and drying system among mariculture farmers. Mariculture is becoming increasingly important in Kenya as natural fish stocks (e.g. tilapia in Lake Victoria) shrink. Farmers on the coast of Kenya currently produce Milkfish (Chanos chanos Forskal) in ponds. Fishermen also harvest a local sardine called Kimarawali (Stolephorus delecatulus) along the banks of rivers in the Kwale and Kilifi counties. The seasonal nature of fishing yields and the lack of suitable processing technologies force fishermen to sell their products as long as they are fresh - often below price. Unsuitable processing and handling technologies also deny access to high-end markets. The German and Kenyan partners develop a technology package to process and add value to Milkfish and Kimarawali.The technology will include the latest advances in photovoltaics (PV), phase change materials (PCM) and modelling technologies. For cooling technology, PCM cold storages or use of electrical battery, or a combination, will be optimised to guarantee stable and reliable cooling operations. Drying will be coupled to the cooling system and heat remissions will be used to supplement drying. For the production of high-quality dried fish (first-class nutritional value, texture and taste), dehydration takes place through optimised temperature and humidity control. The fishermen are trained in processing and quality assurance. Fraunhofer Institute for Solar Energy Systems ISE (Fraunhofer ISE) and Innotech cooperate with the Kenyan Industrial Research and Development Institute (KIRDI), the Kenya Marine and Fisheries Research Institute (KMFRI) and the Mombasa  of Technology (TUM) to design, develop and transfer the proposed technology package.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: The annual interdisciplinary conference on research in tropical and subtropical agriculture, natural resource management and rural development (TROPENTAG) is jointly organised by the universities of Berlin, Bonn, Göttingen, Hohenheim, Kassel-Witzenhausen, Hamburg, ZALF e. V. (Leibniz Centre for Agricultural Landscape Research), ETH Zurich (Switzerland), Czech  of Life Sciences Prague (Czech Republic), BOKU Vienna (Austria) ( of Natural Resources and Life Sciences) and the Council for Tropical and Subtropical Research (ATSAF e. V.) in co-operation with the GIZ Advisory Service on Agricultural Research for Development (BEAF).The Tropical Day has become the most important international conference on development-oriented research in the fields of food security, natural resource management and rural development in central Europe and provides a unique platform for scientific and personal exchange for students, junior and senior scientists, development experts and funding organisations from several countries together with their international partner institutions. The Tropical Day is held annually at different host sites. Tropical Day 2020 took place as a virtuel conference. 2020 theme was  Food and nutrition security and ist resilience to global crisis .
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture

Long Description: This Project is one of the micro-projects of the Consulate General Donetsk in its consular district (5 regions of the Eastern Ukraine). This part of the country needs a special support, because of the war in the Donbas, the constant migration of internally displaced persons and the insufficient state support for people in need. The COVID-19 pandemic aggravated the situation in the Donbas. Despite the lack of equipment, the Starobilsk hospital has become one of the most important hospitals for the treatment of COVID patients in the Luhansk region. But the hospital's capabilities allow treating only 30 patients at the same time. And the beds used were produced more than 40 years ago. Thanks to the project 15 additional beds and other medical equipment (4 medical monitors, 3 electrocardiographs) have been purchased, which significantly improve the treatment conditions in the hospital.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

This will take place through quarterly monitoring visits to the rehabilitation centres in Baidoa, Kismayo and Mogadishu.
Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Finance

Long Description: The current COVID-19 situation has a strong negative impact on the vulnerable population groups in the remote regions of Kyrgyzstan. The village communities Ak-Suu, Tup and the city of Karakol are about 350-400 km away from the capital Bishkek. The corona virus cases were officially reported in all of these locations in April 2020. Accordingly, several security measures have been taken by the government, including the introduction of a state of emergency in several parts of the country. The introduction of the state of emergency in the country blocked almost all business activities and resulted in many people losing their income. Those who were employed in the low-wage sector are particularly affected. At the same time, the government, with the support of international donors and the private sector, took measures to supply the vulnerable population groups with the most important foods.These measures have been criticized in part because of their lack of transparency and delays. In this context, there is a great need among women, disabled people and children in the above-mentioned places for drugstore items that they cannot currently afford due to the lack of sources of income. The supply of personal care items reduces the risk of infection for various diseases, including the corona virus.
Donor Agency: Foreign Office

Long Description: As part of the implementation of economic reforms, local economic development in regions of Uzbekistan with a focus on Karakalpakstan, Fergana, Namangan and Andijan has been strengthened.
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Long Description: The main goal of the project is to support the Iraqi health system in the care of Covid19 patients and to create additional basic infrastructure for this purpose. To achieve this, up to five temporary prefabricated hospitals with 100 beds each, including 40 intensive care beds, are to be built and equipped. The locations identified are Baghdad, Mosul, Basra and Sulaimaniya as well as Anbar (BMZ preference) or Najaf. Each hospital is expected to be able to treat 1,800 patients (total number of patients 9,000).
Donor Agency: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

The COVID-19 pandemic aggravated situation in the region. Mechnikov hospital has become one of the most important hospitals for the treatment of COVID-19 patients in the city of Dnipro and the Dnipropetrovsk region. According to the hospital, the capacity load is already 200%. At the same time the hospital laboratory is one of the 3 state testing centers for COVID-19 in the Dnipropetrovsk region. Today the laboratory's capabilities allow 2000 tests per shift. Thanks to the project 2 additional centrifuges will be purchased in order to increase the tests amount up to 6000 per shift.
